1.english: The word that Isaiah the son of Amoz saw concerning Judah and Jerusalem.

2.hebrew: ††ејд»й»д бћја«з¬шƒйъ д«йћ»оƒйн, р»ле…п йƒдјй∆д д«ш бћ≈йъ-йјде»д бћјш…ащ— д∆д»шƒйн, ејрƒщћ“»а, оƒвћјб»те…ъ; ејр»д¬шећ а≈м»йе, лћ»м-д«вће…йƒн.
2.english: And it shall come to pass in the end of days, that the mountain of the LORD'S house shall be established as the top of the mountains, and shall be exalted above the hills; and all nations shall flow unto it.

3.english: And many peoples shall go and say: 'Come ye, and let us go up to the mountain of the LORD, to the house of the God of Jacob; and He will teach us of His ways, and we will walk in His paths.' For out of Zion shall go forth the law, and the word of the LORD from Jerusalem.

4.hebrew: ††ејщ—»ф«и бћ≈йп д«вће…йƒн, ејде…лƒйз« мјт«оћƒйн ш«бћƒйн; ејлƒъћјъећ з«шјбе…ъ»н мјаƒъћƒйн, е«з¬рƒйъе…ъ≈йд∆н мјо«жјо≈ше…ъ--м…а-йƒщћ“»а ве…й а∆м-вће…й з∆ш∆б, ејм…а-йƒмјојгећ те…г оƒмјз»о»д.† {ф}
4.english: And He shall judge between the nations, and shall decide for many peoples; and they shall beat their swords into plowshares, and their spears into pruninghooks; nation shall not lift up sword against nation, neither shall they learn war any more. {P}

5.hebrew: ††бћ≈йъ, й«т¬ч…б--мјлећ ејр≈мјл»д, бћјае…ш йјде»д.
5.english: O house of Jacob, come ye, and let us walk in the light of the LORD.

6.hebrew: ††лћƒй р»и«щ—јъћ»д, т«оћјк» бћ≈йъ й«т¬ч…б--лћƒй о»мјаећ оƒчћ∆г∆н, ејт…рјрƒйн лћ«фћјмƒщ—јъћƒйн; ећбјй«мјг≈й р»лјшƒйн, й«щ“јфћƒйчећ.
6.english: For Thou hast forsaken Thy people the house of Jacob; for they are replenished from the east, and with soothsayers like the Philistines, and they please themselves in the brood of aliens.

7.hebrew: ††е«ъћƒоћ»м≈а а«шјце… лћ∆с∆у ејж»д»б, еја≈йп ч≈ц∆д мја…цјш…ъ»йе; е«ъћƒоћ»м≈а а«шјце… сећсƒйн, еја≈йп ч≈ц∆д мјо«шјлћјб…ъ»йе.
7.english: Their land also is full of silver and gold, neither is there any end of their treasures; their land also is full of horses, neither is there any end of their chariots.

8.hebrew: ††е«ъћƒоћ»м≈а а«шјце…, аЅмƒймƒйн:† мјо«т¬щ“≈д й»г»йе йƒщ—јъћ«з¬еећ, м«а¬щ—∆ш т»щ“ећ а∆цјбћјт…ъ»йе.
8.english: Their land also is full of idols; every one worshippeth the work of his own hands, that which his own fingers have made.

9.hebrew: ††е«йћƒщћ—«з а»г»н, е«йћƒщ—јфћ«м-аƒйщ—; еја«м-ъћƒщћ“»а, м»д∆н.
9.english: And man boweth down, and man lowereth himself; and Thou canst not bear with them.

10.hebrew: ††бће…а б«цћећш, ејдƒић»о≈п бћ∆т»ф»ш, оƒфћјр≈й фћ«з«г йјде»д, ећо≈д¬г«ш вћја…ре….
10.english: Enter into the rock, and hide thee in the dust, from before the terror of the LORD, and from the glory of His majesty.

11.hebrew: ††т≈йр≈й вћ«бјдећъ а»г»н, щ—»ф≈м, ејщ—«з, шећн а¬р»щ—ƒйн; ејрƒщ“јвћ«б йјде»д мјб«гће…, бћ«йће…н д«дећа.† {ф}
11.english: The lofty looks of man shall be brought low, and the haughtiness of men shall be bowed down, and the LORD alone shall be exalted in that day. {P}

12.hebrew: ††лћƒй йе…н м«йде»д цјб»ае…ъ, т«м лћ»м-вћ≈а∆д--е»ш»н; ејт«м, лћ»м-рƒщћ“»а ејщ—»ф≈м.
12.english: For the LORD of hosts hath a day upon all that is proud and lofty, and upon all that is lifted up, and it shall be brought low;

13.hebrew: ††ејт«м лћ»м-а«шјж≈й д«мћјб»ре…п, д»ш»оƒйн ејд«рћƒщћ“»аƒйн; ејт«м, лћ»м-а«мће…р≈й д«бћ»щ—»п.
13.english: And upon all the cedars of Lebanon that are high and lifted up, and upon all the oaks of Bashan;

14.hebrew: ††ејт«м, лћ»м-д∆д»шƒйн д»ш»оƒйн; ејт«м, лћ»м-д«вћјб»те…ъ д«рћƒщћ“»ае…ъ.
14.english: And upon all the high mountains, and upon all the hills that are lifted up;

15.hebrew: ††ејт«м, лћ»м-оƒвјгћ»м вћ»б…дћ«; ејт«м, лћ»м-зе…о»д бјцећш»д.
15.english: And upon every lofty tower, and upon every fortified wall;

16.hebrew: ††ејт«м, лћ»м-а√рƒйће…ъ ъћ«шјщ—ƒйщ—; ејт«м, лћ»м-щ“јлƒйће…ъ д«з∆ојгћ»д.
16.english: And upon all the ships of Tarshish, and upon all delightful imagery.

17.hebrew: ††ејщ—«з вћ«бјдећъ д»а»г»н, ејщ—»ф≈м шећн а¬р»щ—ƒйн; ејрƒщ“јвћ«б йјде»д мјб«гће…, бћ«йће…н д«дећа.
17.english: And the loftiness of man shall be bowed down, and the haughtiness of men shall be brought low; and the LORD alone shall be exalted in that day.

18.hebrew: ††ејд»аЅмƒймƒйн, лћ»мƒйм й«з¬м…у.
18.english: And the idols shall utterly pass away.

19.hebrew: ††ећб»аећ бћƒојт»ше…ъ цЋшƒйн, ећбƒојзƒмће…ъ т»ф»ш--оƒфћјр≈й фћ«з«г йјде»д, ећо≈д¬г«ш вћјае…ре…, бћјчећое…, м«т¬ш…х д»а»ш∆х.
19.english: And men shall go into the caves of the rocks, and into the holes of the earth, from before the terror of the LORD, and from the glory of His majesty, when He ariseth to shake mightily the earth.

20.hebrew: ††бћ«йће…н д«дећа, й«щ—јмƒйкј д»а»г»н, а≈ъ аЅмƒйм≈й л«сјфће…, еја≈ъ аЅмƒйм≈й жјд»бе…--а¬щ—∆ш т»щ“ећ-ме… мјдƒщ—јъћ«з¬е ъ, м«зјфћ…ш фћ≈ше…ъ ејм»т¬и«мћ≈фƒйн.
20.english: In that day a man shall cast away his idols of silver, and his idols of gold, which they made for themselves to worship, to the moles and to the bats;

21.hebrew: ††м»бе…а бћјрƒчјше…ъ д«цћЋшƒйн, ећбƒсјтƒф≈й д«сћјм»тƒйн--оƒфћјр≈й фћ«з«г йјде»д, ећо≈д¬г«ш вћјае…ре…, бћјчећое…, м«т¬ш…х д»а»ш∆х.
21.english: To go into the clefts of the rocks, and into the crevices of the crags, from before the terror of the LORD, and from the glory of His majesty, when he ariseth to shake mightily the earth.

22.hebrew: ††зƒгјмећ м»л∆н оƒп-д»а»г»н, а¬щ—∆ш рјщ—»о»д бћја«фће…:† лћƒй-б«оћ∆д р∆зјщ—»б, дећа.† {ф}
22.english: Cease ye from man, in whose nostrils is a breath; for how little is he to be accounted! {P}

1.hebrew: כִּי הִנֵּה הָאָדוֹן יְהוָה צְבָאוֹת, מֵסִיר מִירוּשָׁלִַם וּמִיהוּדָה, מַשְׁעֵן, וּמַשְׁעֵנָה:  כֹּל, מִשְׁעַן-לֶחֶם, וְכֹל, מִשְׁעַן-מָיִם.
1.english: For, behold, the Lord, the LORD of hosts, doth take away from Jerusalem and from Judah stay and staff, every stay of bread, and every stay of water;

2.hebrew: גִּבּוֹר, וְאִישׁ מִלְחָמָה; שׁוֹפֵט וְנָבִיא, וְקֹסֵם וְזָקֵן.
2.english: The mighty man, and the man of war; the judge, and the prophet, and the diviner, and the elder;

3.hebrew: שַׂר-חֲמִשִּׁים, וּנְשׂוּא פָנִים; וְיוֹעֵץ וַחֲכַם חֲרָשִׁים, וּנְבוֹן לָחַשׁ.
3.english: The captain of fifty, and the man of rank, and the counsellor, and the cunning charmer, and the skilful enchanter.

4.hebrew: וְנָתַתִּי נְעָרִים, שָׂרֵיהֶם; וְתַעֲלוּלִים, יִמְשְׁלוּ-בָם.
4.english: And I will give children to be their princes, and babes shall rule over them.

5.hebrew: וְנִגַּשׂ הָעָם, אִישׁ בְּאִישׁ וְאִישׁ בְּרֵעֵהוּ; יִרְהֲבוּ, הַנַּעַר בַּזָּקֵן, וְהַנִּקְלֶה, בַּנִּכְבָּד.
5.english: And the people shall oppress one another, every man his fellow, and every man his neighbour; the child shall behave insolently against the aged, and the base against the honourable,

6.hebrew: כִּי-יִתְפֹּשׂ אִישׁ בְּאָחִיו, בֵּית אָבִיו, שִׂמְלָה לְכָה, קָצִין תִּהְיֶה-לָּנוּ; וְהַמַּכְשֵׁלָה הַזֹּאת, תַּחַת יָדֶךָ.
6.english: For a man shall take hold of his brother of the house of his father: 'Thou hast a mantle, be thou our ruler, and let this ruin be under thy hand.'

7.hebrew: יִשָּׂא בַיּוֹם הַהוּא לֵאמֹר, לֹא-אֶהְיֶה חֹבֵשׁ, וּבְבֵיתִי, אֵין לֶחֶם וְאֵין שִׂמְלָה; לֹא תְשִׂימֻנִי, קְצִין עָם.
7.english: In that day shall he swear, saying: 'I will not be a healer; for in my house is neither bread nor a mantle; ye shall not make me ruler of a people.'

8.hebrew: כִּי כָשְׁלָה יְרוּשָׁלִַם, וִיהוּדָה נָפָל:  כִּי-לְשׁוֹנָם וּמַעַלְלֵיהֶם אֶל-יְהוָה, לַמְרוֹת עֵנֵי כְבוֹדוֹ.
8.english: For Jerusalem is ruined, and Judah is fallen; because their tongue and their doings are against the LORD, to provoke the eyes of His glory.

9.hebrew: הַכָּרַת פְּנֵיהֶם עָנְתָה בָּם, וְחַטָּאתָם כִּסְדֹם הִגִּידוּ לֹא כִחֵדוּ; אוֹי לְנַפְשָׁם, כִּי-גָמְלוּ לָהֶם רָעָה.
9.english: The show of their countenance doth witness against them; and they declare their sin as Sodom, they hide it not. Woe unto their soul! for they have wrought evil unto themselves.

10.hebrew: אִמְרוּ צַדִּיק, כִּי-טוֹב:  כִּי-פְרִי מַעַלְלֵיהֶם, יֹאכֵלוּ.
10.english: Say ye of the righteous, that it shall be well with him; for they shall eat the fruit of their doings.

11.hebrew: אוֹי, לְרָשָׁע רָע:  כִּי-גְמוּל יָדָיו, יֵעָשֶׂה לּוֹ.
11.english: Woe unto the wicked! it shall be ill with him; for the work of his hands shall be done to him.

12.hebrew: עַמִּי נֹגְשָׂיו מְעוֹלֵל, וְנָשִׁים מָשְׁלוּ בוֹ; עַמִּי מְאַשְּׁרֶיךָ מַתְעִים, וְדֶרֶךְ אֹרְחֹתֶיךָ בִּלֵּעוּ.  {פ}
12.english: As for My people, a babe is their master, and women rule over them. O My people, they that lead thee cause thee to err, and destroy the way of thy paths. {P}

13.hebrew: נִצָּב לָרִיב, יְהוָה; וְעֹמֵד, לָדִין עַמִּים.
13.english: The LORD standeth up to plead, and standeth to judge the peoples.

14.hebrew: יְהוָה בְּמִשְׁפָּט יָבוֹא, עִם-זִקְנֵי עַמּוֹ וְשָׂרָיו; וְאַתֶּם בִּעַרְתֶּם הַכֶּרֶם, גְּזֵלַת הֶעָנִי בְּבָתֵּיכֶם.
14.english: The LORD will enter into judgment with the elders of His people, and the princes thereof: 'It is ye that have eaten up the vineyard; the spoil of the poor is in your houses;

15.hebrew: מלכם (מַה-לָּכֶם) תְּדַכְּאוּ עַמִּי, וּפְנֵי עֲנִיִּים תִּטְחָנוּ:  נְאֻם-אֲדֹנָי יְהוִה, צְבָאוֹת.  {ס}
15.english: What mean ye that ye crush My people, and grind the face of the poor?' saith the Lord, the GOD of hosts. {S}

16.hebrew: וַיֹּאמֶר יְהוָה, יַעַן כִּי גָבְהוּ בְּנוֹת צִיּוֹן, וַתֵּלַכְנָה נטוות (נְטוּיוֹת) גָּרוֹן, וּמְשַׂקְּרוֹת עֵינָיִם; הָלוֹךְ וְטָפֹף תֵּלַכְנָה, וּבְרַגְלֵיהֶם תְּעַכַּסְנָה.
16.english: Moreover the LORD said: Because the daughters of Zion are haughty, and walk with stretched-forth necks and wanton eyes, walking and mincing as they go, and making a tinkling with their feet;

17.hebrew: וְשִׂפַּח אֲדֹנָי, קָדְקֹד בְּנוֹת צִיּוֹן; וַיהוָה, פָּתְהֵן יְעָרֶה.  {ס}
17.english: Therefore the Lord will smite with a scab the crown of the head of the daughters of Zion, and the LORD will lay bare their secret parts. {S}

18.hebrew: בַּיּוֹם הַהוּא יָסִיר אֲדֹנָי, אֵת תִּפְאֶרֶת הָעֲכָסִים וְהַשְּׁבִיסִים--וְהַשַּׂהֲרֹנִים.
18.english: In that day the Lord will take away the bravery of their anklets, and the fillets, and the crescents;

19.hebrew: הַנְּטִפוֹת וְהַשֵּׁירוֹת, וְהָרְעָלוֹת.
19.english: the pendants, and the bracelets, and the veils;

20.hebrew: הַפְּאֵרִים וְהַצְּעָדוֹת וְהַקִּשֻּׁרִים, וּבָתֵּי הַנֶּפֶשׁ וְהַלְּחָשִׁים.
20.english: the headtires, and the armlets, and the sashes, and the corselets, and the amulets;

21.hebrew: הַטַּבָּעוֹת, וְנִזְמֵי הָאָף.
21.english: the rings, and the nose-jewels;

22.hebrew: הַמַּחֲלָצוֹת, וְהַמַּעֲטָפוֹת, וְהַמִּטְפָּחוֹת, וְהָחֲרִיטִים.
22.english: the aprons, and the mantelets, and the cloaks, and the girdles;

23.hebrew: וְהַגִּלְיֹנִים, וְהַסְּדִינִים, וְהַצְּנִיפוֹת, וְהָרְדִידִים.
23.english: and the gauze robes, and the fine linen, and the turbans, and the mantles.

24.hebrew: וְהָיָה תַחַת בֹּשֶׂם מַק יִהְיֶה, וְתַחַת חֲגוֹרָה נִקְפָּה וְתַחַת מַעֲשֶׂה מִקְשֶׁה קָרְחָה, וְתַחַת פְּתִיגִיל, מַחֲגֹרֶת שָׂק:  כִּי-תַחַת, יֹפִי.
24.english: And it shall come to pass, that instead of sweet spices there shall be rottenness; and instead of a girdle rags; and instead of curled hair baldness; and instead of a stomacher a girding of sackcloth; branding instead of beauty.

25.english: Thy men shall fall by the sword, and thy mighty in the war.

26.hebrew: וְאָנוּ וְאָבְלוּ, פְּתָחֶיהָ; וְנִקָּתָה, לָאָרֶץ תֵּשֵׁב.
26.english: And her gates shall lament and mourn; and utterly bereft she shall sit upon the ground.

1.hebrew: וְהֶחֱזִיקוּ שֶׁבַע נָשִׁים בְּאִישׁ אֶחָד, בַּיּוֹם הַהוּא לֵאמֹר, לַחְמֵנוּ נֹאכֵל, וְשִׂמְלָתֵנוּ נִלְבָּשׁ:  רַק, יִקָּרֵא שִׁמְךָ עָלֵינוּ--אֱסֹף, חֶרְפָּתֵנוּ.  {ס}
1.english: And seven women shall take hold of one man in that day, saying: 'We will eat our own bread, and wear our own apparel; only let us be called by thy name; take thou away our reproach.' {S}

2.hebrew: בַּיּוֹם הַהוּא, יִהְיֶה צֶמַח יְהוָה, לִצְבִי, וּלְכָבוֹד; וּפְרִי הָאָרֶץ לְגָאוֹן וּלְתִפְאֶרֶת, לִפְלֵיטַת יִשְׂרָאֵל.
2.english: In that day shall the growth of the LORD be beautiful and glorious, and the fruit of the land excellent and comely for them that are escaped of Israel.

3.hebrew: וְהָיָה הַנִּשְׁאָר בְּצִיּוֹן, וְהַנּוֹתָר בִּירוּשָׁלִַם--קָדוֹשׁ, יֵאָמֶר לוֹ:  כָּל-הַכָּתוּב לַחַיִּים, בִּירוּשָׁלִָם.
3.english: And it shall come to pass, that he that is left in Zion, and he that remaineth in Jerusalem, shall be called holy, even every one that is written unto life in Jerusalem;

4.hebrew: אִם רָחַץ אֲדֹנָי, אֵת צֹאַת בְּנוֹת-צִיּוֹן, וְאֶת-דְּמֵי יְרוּשָׁלִַם, יָדִיחַ מִקִּרְבָּהּ--בְּרוּחַ מִשְׁפָּט, וּבְרוּחַ בָּעֵר.
4.english: when the Lord shall have washed away the filth of the daughters of Zion, and shall have purged the blood of Jerusalem from the midst thereof, by the spirit of judgment, and by the spirit of destruction.

5.hebrew: וּבָרָא יְהוָה עַל כָּל-מְכוֹן הַר-צִיּוֹן וְעַל-מִקְרָאֶהָ, עָנָן יוֹמָם וְעָשָׁן, וְנֹגַהּ אֵשׁ לֶהָבָה, לָיְלָה:  כִּי עַל-כָּל-כָּבוֹד, חֻפָּה.
5.english: And the LORD will create over the whole habitation of mount Zion, and over her assemblies, a cloud and smoke by day, and the shining of a flaming fire by night; for over all the glory shall be a canopy.

6.hebrew: וְסֻכָּה תִּהְיֶה לְצֵל-יוֹמָם, מֵחֹרֶב; וּלְמַחְסֶה, וּלְמִסְתּוֹר, מִזֶּרֶם, וּמִמָּטָר.  {פ}
6.english: And there shall be a pavilion for a shadow in the day-time from the heat, and for a refuge and for a covert from storm and from rain. {P}

1.hebrew: ††а»щ—ƒйш»д рћ»а мƒйгƒйгƒй, щ—ƒйш«ъ гће…гƒй мјл«шјое…:† лћ∆ш∆н д»й»д мƒйгƒйгƒй, бћјч∆ш∆п бћ∆п-щ—»о∆п.
1.english: Let me sing of my well-beloved, a song of my beloved touching his vineyard. My well-beloved had a vineyard in a very fruitful hill;

2.hebrew: ††е«йјт«жћјч≈дећ е«йјс«чћјм≈дећ, е«йћƒић»т≈дећ щ“…ш≈ч, е«йћƒб∆п оƒвјгћ»м бћјъе…ле…, ејв«н-й∆ч∆б з»ц≈б бће…; е«йјч«е м«т¬щ“е…ъ т¬р»бƒйн, е«йћ«т«щ“ бћјаЋщ—ƒйн.
2.english: And he digged it, and cleared it of stones, and planted it with the choicest vine, and built a tower in the midst of it, and also hewed out a vat therein; and he looked that it should bring forth grapes, and it brought forth wild grapes.

3.hebrew: ††ејт«ъћ»д йе…щ—≈б йјшећщ—»м«ƒн, ејаƒйщ— йјдећг»д--щ—ƒфјиећ-р»а, бћ≈йрƒй ећб≈йп лћ«шјоƒй.
3.english: And now, O inhabitants of Jerusalem and men of Judah, judge, I pray you, betwixt me and my vineyard.

4.hebrew: ††о«д-мћ«т¬щ“е…ъ те…г мјл«шјоƒй, ејм…а т»щ“ƒйъƒй бће…:† о«гћећт« чƒећ≈йъƒй м«т¬щ“е…ъ т¬р»бƒйн, е«йћ«т«щ“ бћјаЋщ—ƒйн.
4.english: What could have been done more to my vineyard, that I have not done in it? Wherefore, when I looked that it should bring forth grapes, brought it forth wild grapes?

5.hebrew: ††ејт«ъћ»д ае…гƒйт»д-рћ»а а∆ъјл∆н, а≈ъ а¬щ—∆ш-а¬рƒй т…щ“∆д мјл«шјоƒй:† д»с≈ш ојщ“ећлћ»ъе… ејд»й»д мјб»т≈ш, фћ»ш…х вћјг≈ше… ејд»й»д мјоƒшјо»с.
5.english: And now come, I will tell you what I will do to my vineyard: I will take away the hedge thereof, and it shall be eaten up; I will break down the fence thereof, and it shall be trodden down;

6.hebrew: ††е«а¬щ—ƒйъ≈дећ б»ъ»д, м…а йƒжћ»о≈ш ејм…а й≈т»г≈ш, ејт»м»д щ—»оƒйш, е»щ—»йƒъ; ејт«м д∆т»бƒйн а¬ц«ећ∆д, о≈д«ојиƒйш т»м»йе о»и»ш.
6.english: And I will lay it waste: it shall not be pruned nor hoed, but there shall come up briers and thorns; I will also command the clouds that they rain no rain upon it.

7.hebrew: ††лћƒй л∆ш∆н йјде»д цјб»ае…ъ, бћ≈йъ йƒщ“јш»а≈м, ејаƒйщ— йјдећг»д, рји«т щ—«т¬щ—ећт»йе; е«йјч«е мјоƒщ—јфћ»и ејдƒрћ≈д оƒщ“јфћ»з, мƒцјг»ч»д ејдƒрћ≈д цјт»ч»д.† {ф}
7.english: For the vineyard of the LORD of hosts is the house of Israel, and the men of Judah the plant of His delight; and He looked for justice, but behold violence; for righteousness, but behold a cry. {P}

8.hebrew: ††де…й, о«вћƒйт≈й б«йƒъ бћјб«йƒъ--щ“»г∆д бјщ“»г∆д, й«чјшƒйбећ:† т«г а∆ф∆с о»че…н, ејдећщ—«бјъћ∆н мјб«гћјл∆н бћјч∆ш∆б д»а»ш∆х.
8.english: Woe unto them that join house to house, that lay field to field, till there be no room, and ye be made to dwell alone in the midst of the land!

9.hebrew: ††бћја»жјр»й, йјде»д цјб»ае…ъ:† аƒн-м…а бћ»ъћƒйн ш«бћƒйн, мјщ—«оћ»д йƒдјйећ--вћјг…мƒйн ејие…бƒйн, о≈а≈йп йе…щ—≈б.
9.english: In mine ears said the LORD of hosts: of a truth many houses shall be desolate, even great and fair, without inhabitant.

10.hebrew: ††лћƒй, т¬щ“∆ш∆ъ цƒојгћ≈й-л∆ш∆н, й«т¬щ“ећ, бћ«ъ а∆з»ъ; ејж∆ш«т з…о∆ш, й«т¬щ“∆д а≈йф»д.† {с}
10.english: For ten acres of vineyard shall yield one bath, and the seed of a homer shall yield an ephah. {S}

11.hebrew: ††де…й о«щ—јлћƒйо≈й б«бћ…ч∆ш, щ—≈л»ш йƒшјгћ…фећ; оја«з¬ш≈й б«рћ∆щ—∆у, й«йƒп й«гјмƒйч≈н.
11.english: Woe unto them that rise up early in the morning, that they may follow strong drink; that tarry late into the night, till wine inflame them!

12.hebrew: ††ејд»й»д лƒрће…ш е»р∆б∆м, ъћ…у ејз»мƒйм е»й«йƒп--оƒщ—јъћ≈йд∆н; еја≈ъ фћ…т«м йјде»д м…а й«бћƒйиећ, ећо«т¬щ“≈д й»г»йе м…а ш»аећ.
12.english: And the harp and the psaltery, the tabret and the pipe, and wine, are in their feasts; but they regard not the work of the LORD, neither have they considered the operation of His hands.

13.hebrew: ††м»л≈п вћ»м»д т«оћƒй, оƒбћјмƒй-г»т«ъ; ећлјбе…ге… ојъ≈й ш»т»б, е«д¬ое…ре… цƒз≈д ц»о»а.
13.english: Therefore My people are gone into captivity, for want of knowledge; and their honourable men are famished, and their multitude are parched with thirst.

14.hebrew: ††м»л≈п, дƒшјзƒйб»д щћ—јае…м р«фјщ—»дћ, ећф»т¬ш»д фƒйд», мƒбјмƒй-з…ч; ејй»ш«г д¬г»ш»дћ е«д¬ое…р»дћ ећщ—јае…р»дћ, ејт»м≈ж бћ»дћ.
14.english: Therefore the nether-world hath enlarged her desire, and opened her mouth without measure; and down goeth their glory, and their tumult, and their uproar, and he that rejoiceth among them.

15.hebrew: ††е«йћƒщћ—«з а»г»н, е«йћƒщ—јфћ«м-аƒйщ—; ејт≈йр≈й вјб…дƒйн, ъћƒщ—јфћ«мјр»д.
15.english: And man is bowed down, and man is humbled, and the eyes of the lofty are humbled;

16.hebrew: ††е«йћƒвјбћ«дћ йјде»д цјб»ае…ъ, бћ«оћƒщ—јфћ»и; ејд»а≈м, д«чћ»ге…щ—, рƒчјгћ»щ—, бћƒцјг»ч»д.
16.english: But the LORD of hosts is exalted through justice, and God the Holy One is sanctified through righteousness.

17.hebrew: ††ејш»тећ лјб»щ“ƒйн, лћјг»бјш»н; ејз»шјбе…ъ о≈зƒйн, вћ»шƒйн й…ал≈мећ.† {с}
17.english: Then shall the lambs feed as in their pasture, and the waste places of the fat ones shall wanderers eat. {S}

18.hebrew: ††де…й о…щ—јл≈й д∆т»е п, бћјз«бјм≈й д«щћ—»еја; ејл«т¬бе…ъ д»т¬в»м»д, з«ић»а»д.
18.english: Woe unto them that draw iniquity with cords of vanity, and sin as it were with a cart rope,

19.hebrew: ††д»а…ојшƒйн, йјо«д≈ш й»зƒйщ—»д о«т¬щ“≈дећ--мјо«т«п рƒшја∆д; ејъƒчјш«б ејъ»бе…а»д, т¬ц«ъ чјге…щ— йƒщ“јш»а≈м--ејр≈г»т»д.† {ф}
19.english: That say: 'Let Him make speed, let Him hasten His work, that we may see it; and let the counsel of the Holy One of Israel draw nigh and come, that we may know it!' {P}

20.hebrew: ††де…й д»а…ојшƒйн м»ш«т ие…б, ејм«иће…б ш»т:† щ“»оƒйн з…щ—∆кј мјае…ш ејае…ш мјз…щ—∆кј, щ“»оƒйн о«ш мјо»ъе…ч ећо»ъе…ч мјо»ш.† {с}
20.english: Woe unto them that call evil good, and good evil; that change darkness into light, and light into darkness; that change bitter into sweet, and sweet into bitter! {S}

21.hebrew: ††де…й, з¬л»оƒйн бћјт≈йр≈йд∆н; ејр∆в∆г фћјр≈йд∆н, рјб…рƒйн.† {с}
21.english: Woe unto them that are wise in their own eyes, and prudent in their own sight! {S}

22.hebrew: ††де…й, вћƒбће…шƒйн мƒщ—јъће…ъ й»йƒп; еја«рјщ—≈й-з«йƒм, мƒојс…кј щ—≈л»ш.
22.english: Woe unto them that are mighty to drink wine, and men of strength to mingle strong drink;

23.hebrew: ††о«цјгћƒйч≈й ш»щ—»т, т≈ч∆б щ—…з«г; ејцƒгјч«ъ ц«гћƒйчƒйн, й»сƒйшећ оƒоћ∆рћећ.† {ф}
23.english: That justify the wicked for a reward, and take away the righteousness of the righteous from him! {P}

24.hebrew: ††м»л≈п лћ∆аЅл…м ч«щ— мјщ—е…п а≈щ—, е«з¬щ—«щ— м∆д»б»д йƒшјфћ∆д, щ—»шјщ—»н лћ«оћ»ч йƒдјй∆д, ећфƒшјз»н лћ»а»б»ч й«т¬м∆д:† лћƒй о»а¬сећ, а≈ъ ъће…ш«ъ йјде»д цјб»ае…ъ, еја≈ъ аƒојш«ъ чјге…щ—-йƒщ“јш»а≈м, рƒа≈цећ.
24.english: Therefore as the tongue of fire devoureth the stubble, and as the chaff is consumed in the flame, so their root shall be as rottenness, and their blossom shall go up as dust; because they have rejected the law of the LORD of hosts, and contemned the word of the Holy One of Israel.

25.hebrew: ††т«м-лћ≈п з»ш»д а«у-йјде»д бћјт«оће… е«йћ≈и й»ге… т»м»йе е«йћ«лћ≈дећ, е«йћƒшјвћјжећ д∆д»шƒйн, е«ъћјдƒй рƒбјм»ъ»н лћ«сћећз»д, бћјч∆ш∆б зећце…ъ; бћјл»м-ж…аъ м…а-щ—»б а«фће…, ејте…г й»ге… рјиећй»д.
25.english: Therefore is the anger of the LORD kindled against His people, and He hath stretched forth His hand against them, and hath smitten them, and the hills did tremble, and their carcasses were as refuse in the midst of the streets. For all this His anger is not turned away, but His hand is stretched out still.

26.hebrew: ††ејр»щ“»а-р≈с м«вће…йƒн о≈ш»зе…ч, ејщ—»ш«ч ме… оƒчјц≈д д»а»ш∆х; ејдƒрћ≈д ојд≈ш»д, ч«м й»бе…а.
26.english: And He will lift up an ensign to the nations from far, and will hiss unto them from the end of the earth; and, behold, they shall come with speed swiftly;

27.hebrew: ††а≈йп-т»й≈у еја≈йп-лће…щ—≈м бће…, м…а й»рећн ејм…а йƒйщ—»п; ејм…а рƒфјъћ«з а≈же…ш з¬м»ц»йе, ејм…а рƒъћ«ч щ“јше…кј рјт»м»йе.
27.english: None shall be weary nor stumble among them; none shall slumber nor sleep; neither shall the girdle of their loins be loosed, nor the latchet of their shoes be broken;

28.hebrew: ††а¬щ—∆ш зƒцћ»йе щ—јрећрƒйн, ејл»м-ч«щћ—јъ…ъ»йе гћјшЋле…ъ; фћ«шјсе…ъ сећс»йе лћ«цћ«ш р∆зјщ—»бећ, ејв«мјвћƒмћ»йе лћ«сћећф»д.
28.english: Whose arrows are sharp, and all their bows bent; their horses' hoofs shall be counted like flint, and their wheels like a whirlwind;

29.hebrew: ††щ—ја»в»д ме…, лћ«мћ»бƒйа; ещав (йƒщ—ја«в) лћ«лћјфƒйшƒйн ејйƒрјд…н ејй…аз≈ж и∆ш∆у, ејй«фјмƒйи еја≈йп о«цћƒйм.
29.english: Their roaring shall be like a lion, they shall roar like young lions, yea, they shall roar, and lay hold of the prey, and carry it away safe, and there shall be none to deliver.

30.hebrew: ††ејйƒрјд…н т»м»йе бћ«йће…н д«дећа, лћјр«д¬о«ъ-й»н; ејрƒбћ«и м»а»ш∆х, ејдƒрћ≈д-з…щ—∆кј, ц«ш е»ае…ш, з»щ—«кј бћ«т¬шƒйф∆йд».† {ф}
30.english: And they shall roar against them in that day like the roaring of the sea; and if one look unto the land, behold darkness and distress, and the light is darkened in the skies thereof. {P}

1.hebrew: ††бћƒщ—јр«ъ-ое…ъ д«оћ∆м∆кј тЋжћƒйћ»дећ, е»а∆шја∆д а∆ъ-а¬г…р»й й…щ—≈б т«м-лћƒсћ≈а ш»н ејрƒщћ“»а; ејщ—ећм»йе, ојм≈аƒйн а∆ъ-д«д≈йл»м.
1.english: In the year that king Uzziah died I saw the Lord sitting upon a throne high and lifted up, and His train filled the temple.

2.hebrew: ††щ“јш»фƒйн т…ојгƒйн оƒоћ«т«м ме…, щ—≈щ— лћјр»ф«йƒн щ—≈щ— лћјр»ф«йƒн мја∆з»г:† бћƒщ—јъћ«йƒн йјл«сћ∆д ф»р»йе, ећбƒщ—јъћ«йƒн йјл«сћ∆д ш«вјм»йе--ећбƒщ—јъћ«йƒн йјте…ф≈у.
2.english: Above Him stood the seraphim; each one had six wings: with twain he covered his face and with twain he covered his feet, and with twain he did fly.

3.hebrew: ††ејч»ш»а ж∆д а∆м-ж∆д еја»о«ш, ч»ге…щ— ч»ге…щ— ч»ге…щ— йјде»д цјб»ае…ъ; ојм…а л»м-д»а»ш∆х, лћјбе…ге….
3.english: And one called unto another, and said: Holy, holy, holy, is the LORD of hosts; the whole earth is full of His glory.

4.hebrew: ††е«йћ»рЋтећ а«оће…ъ д«сћƒфћƒйн, оƒчће…м д«чће…ш≈а; ејд«бћ«йƒъ, йƒоћ»м≈а т»щ—»п.
4.english: And the posts of the door were moved at the voice of them that called, and the house was filled with smoke.

5.hebrew: ††е»а…о«ш ае…й-мƒй лƒй-рƒгјо≈йъƒй, лћƒй аƒйщ— ијо≈а-щ“јф»ъ«йƒн а»р…лƒй, ећбјъе…кј т«н-ијо≈а щ“јф»ъ«йƒн, а»р…лƒй йе…щ—≈б:† лћƒй, а∆ъ-д«оћ∆м∆кј йјде»д цјб»ае…ъ--ш»аећ т≈йр»й.
5.english: Then said I: Woe is me! for I am undone; because I am a man of unclean lips, and I dwell in the midst of a people of unclean lips; for mine eyes have seen the King, the LORD of hosts.

6.hebrew: ††е«йћ»т»у а≈м«й, а∆з»г оƒп-д«щћ“јш»фƒйн, ећбјй»ге…, шƒцјфћ»д; бћјо∆мјч«з«йƒн--м»ч«з, о≈т«м д«оћƒжјбћ≈з«.
6.english: Then flew unto me one of the seraphim, with a glowing stone in his hand, which he had taken with the tongs from off the altar;

7.hebrew: ††е«йћ«вћ«т т«м-фћƒй--е«йћ…ао∆ш, дƒрћ≈д р»в«т ж∆д т«м-щ“јф»ъ∆йк»; ејс»ш т¬е р∆к», ејз«ић»аъјк» ъћјлЋфћ»ш.
7.english: and he touched my mouth with it, and said: Lo, this hath touched thy lips; and thine iniquity is taken away, and thy sin expiated.

8.hebrew: ††е»а∆щ—јо«т а∆ъ-че…м а¬г…р»й, а…о≈ш, а∆ъ-оƒй а∆щ—јм«з, ећоƒй й≈м∆кј-м»рећ; е»а…о«ш, дƒрјрƒй щ—јм»з≈рƒй.
8.english: And I heard the voice of the Lord, saying: Whom shall I send, and who will go for us? Then I said: 'Here am I; send me.'

9.hebrew: ††е«йћ…ао∆ш, м≈кј еја»о«шјъћ» м»т»н д«жћ∆д:† щ—ƒојтећ щ—»ое…т« еја«м-ъћ»бƒйрећ, ећшјаећ ш»ае… еја«м-ъћ≈г»тећ.
9.english: And He said: 'Go, and tell this people: hear ye indeed, but understand not; and see ye indeed, but perceive not.

10.hebrew: ††д«щ—јо≈п м≈б-д»т»н д«жћ∆д, еја»жјр»йе д«лјбћ≈г ејт≈йр»йе д»щ—«т:† фћ∆п-йƒшја∆д бјт≈йр»йе ећбја»жјр»йе йƒщ—јо»т, ећмјб»бе… й»бƒйп е»щ—»б--ејш»ф»а ме….
10.english: Make the heart of this people fat, and make their ears heavy, and shut their eyes; lest they, seeing with their eyes, and hearing with their ears, and understanding with their heart, return, and be healed.'

11.hebrew: ††е»а…о«ш, т«г-о»ъ«й а¬г…р»й; е«йћ…ао∆ш т«г а¬щ—∆ш аƒн-щ—»аећ т»шƒйн о≈а≈йп йе…щ—≈б, ећб»ъћƒйн о≈а≈йп а»г»н, ејд»а¬г»о»д, ъћƒщћ—»а∆д щ—јо»о»д.
11.english: Then said I: 'Lord, how long?' And He answered: 'Until cities be waste without inhabitant, and houses without man, and the land become utterly waste,

12.hebrew: ††ејшƒз«ч йјде»д, а∆ъ-д»а»г»н; ејш«бћ»д д»т¬жећб»д, бћјч∆ш∆б д»а»ш∆х.
12.english: And the LORD have removed men far away, and the forsaken places be many in the midst of the land.

13.hebrew: ††ејте…г бћ»дћ т¬щ“ƒшƒйћ»д, ејщ—»б»д ејд»йјъ»д мјб»т≈ш:† лћ»а≈м»д ејл»а«мће…п, а¬щ—∆ш бћјщ—«мћ∆л∆ъ о«цћ∆б∆ъ бћ»н--ж∆ш«т ч…г∆щ—, о«цћ«бјъћ»дћ.† {ф}
13.english: And if there be yet a tenth in it, it shall again be eaten up; as a terebinth, and as an oak, whose stock remaineth, when they cast their leaves, so the holy seed shall be the stock thereof.' {P}

1.hebrew: וַיְהִי בִּימֵי אָחָז בֶּן-יוֹתָם בֶּן-עֻזִּיָּהוּ מֶלֶךְ יְהוּדָה, עָלָה רְצִין מֶלֶךְ-אֲרָם וּפֶקַח בֶּן-רְמַלְיָהוּ מֶלֶךְ-יִשְׂרָאֵל יְרוּשָׁלִַם, לַמִּלְחָמָה, עָלֶיהָ; וְלֹא יָכֹל, לְהִלָּחֵם עָלֶיהָ.
1.english: And it came to pass in the days of Ahaz the son of Jotham, the son of Uzziah, king of Judah, that Rezin the king of Aram, and Pekah the son of Remaliah, king of Israel, went up to Jerusalem to war against it; but could not prevail against it.

2.hebrew: וַיֻּגַּד, לְבֵית דָּוִד לֵאמֹר, נָחָה אֲרָם, עַל-אֶפְרָיִם; וַיָּנַע לְבָבוֹ וּלְבַב עַמּוֹ, כְּנוֹעַ עֲצֵי-יַעַר מִפְּנֵי-רוּחַ.  {ס}
2.english: And it was told the house of David, saying: 'Aram is confederate with Ephraim.' And his heart was moved, and the heart of his people, as the trees of the forest are moved with the wind. {S}

3.hebrew: וַיֹּאמֶר יְהוָה, אֶל-יְשַׁעְיָהוּ, צֵא-נָא לִקְרַאת אָחָז, אַתָּה וּשְׁאָר יָשׁוּב בְּנֶךָ:  אֶל-קְצֵה, תְּעָלַת הַבְּרֵכָה הָעֶלְיוֹנָה--אֶל-מְסִלַּת, שְׂדֵה כוֹבֵס.
3.english: Then said the LORD unto Isaiah: 'Go forth now to meet Ahaz, thou, and Shear-jashub thy son, at the end of the conduit of the upper pool, in the highway of the fullers' field;

4.hebrew: וְאָמַרְתָּ אֵלָיו הִשָּׁמֵר וְהַשְׁקֵט אַל-תִּירָא, וּלְבָבְךָ אַל-יֵרַךְ, מִשְּׁנֵי זַנְבוֹת הָאוּדִים הָעֲשֵׁנִים, הָאֵלֶּה--בָּחֳרִי-אַף רְצִין וַאֲרָם, וּבֶן-רְמַלְיָהוּ.
4.english: and say unto him: Keep calm, and be quiet; fear not, neither let thy heart be faint, because of these two tails of smoking firebrands, for the fierce anger of Rezin and Aram, and of the son of Remaliah.

5.hebrew: יַעַן, כִּי-יָעַץ עָלֶיךָ אֲרָם--רָעָה:  אֶפְרַיִם וּבֶן-רְמַלְיָהוּ, לֵאמֹר.
5.english: Because Aram hath counselled evil against thee, Ephraim also, and the son of Remaliah, saying:

6.hebrew: נַעֲלֶה בִיהוּדָה וּנְקִיצֶנָּה, וְנַבְקִעֶנָּה אֵלֵינוּ; וְנַמְלִיךְ מֶלֶךְ בְּתוֹכָהּ, אֵת בֶּן-טָבְאַל.  {פ}
6.english: Let us go up against Judah, and vex it, and let us make a breach therein for us, and set up a king in the midst of it, even the son of Tabeel; {P}

7.hebrew: כֹּה אָמַר, אֲדֹנָי יְהוִה:  לֹא תָקוּם, וְלֹא תִהְיֶה.
7.english: thus saith the Lord GOD: It shall not stand, neither shall it come to pass.

8.hebrew: כִּי רֹאשׁ אֲרָם דַּמֶּשֶׂק, וְרֹאשׁ דַּמֶּשֶׂק רְצִין; וּבְעוֹד, שִׁשִּׁים וְחָמֵשׁ שָׁנָה, יֵחַת אֶפְרַיִם, מֵעָם.
8.english: For the head of Aram is Damascus, and the head of Damascus is Rezin; and within threescore and five years shall Ephraim be broken, that it be not a people;

9.hebrew: וְרֹאשׁ אֶפְרַיִם שֹׁמְרוֹן, וְרֹאשׁ שֹׁמְרוֹן בֶּן-רְמַלְיָהוּ; אִם לֹא תַאֲמִינוּ, כִּי לֹא תֵאָמֵנוּ.  {פ}
9.english: And the head of Ephraim is Samaria, and the head of Samaria is Remaliah's son. If ye will not have faith, surely ye shall not be established.' {P}

10.hebrew: וַיּוֹסֶף יְהוָה, דַּבֵּר אֶל-אָחָז לֵאמֹר.
10.english: And the LORD spoke again unto Ahaz, saying:

11.hebrew: שְׁאַל-לְךָ אוֹת, מֵעִם יְהוָה אֱלֹהֶיךָ; הַעְמֵק שְׁאָלָה, אוֹ הַגְבֵּהַּ לְמָעְלָה.
11.english: 'Ask thee a sign of the LORD thy God: ask it either in the depth, or in the height above.'

12.hebrew: וַיֹּאמֶר, אָחָז:  לֹא-אֶשְׁאַל וְלֹא-אֲנַסֶּה, אֶת-יְהוָה.
12.english: But Ahaz said: 'I will not ask, neither will I try the LORD.'

13.hebrew: וַיֹּאמֶר, שִׁמְעוּ-נָא בֵּית דָּוִד:  הַמְעַט מִכֶּם הַלְאוֹת אֲנָשִׁים, כִּי תַלְאוּ גַּם אֶת-אֱלֹהָי.
13.english: And he said: 'Hear ye now, O house of David: Is it a small thing for you to weary men, that ye will weary my God also?

14.hebrew: לָכֵן יִתֵּן אֲדֹנָי הוּא, לָכֶם--אוֹת:  הִנֵּה הָעַלְמָה, הָרָה וְיֹלֶדֶת בֵּן, וְקָרָאת שְׁמוֹ, עִמָּנוּ אֵל.
14.english: Therefore the Lord Himself shall give you a sign: behold, the young woman shall conceive, and bear a son, and shall call his name Immanuel.

15.hebrew: חֶמְאָה וּדְבַשׁ, יֹאכֵל--לְדַעְתּוֹ מָאוֹס בָּרָע, וּבָחוֹר בַּטּוֹב.
15.english: Curd and honey shall he eat, when he knoweth to refuse the evil, and choose the good.

16.hebrew: כִּי בְּטֶרֶם יֵדַע הַנַּעַר, מָאֹס בָּרָע--וּבָחֹר בַּטּוֹב:  תֵּעָזֵב הָאֲדָמָה אֲשֶׁר אַתָּה קָץ, מִפְּנֵי שְׁנֵי מְלָכֶיהָ.
16.english: Yea, before the child shall know to refuse the evil, and choose the good, the land whose two kings thou hast a horror of shall be forsaken.

17.hebrew: יָבִיא יְהוָה עָלֶיךָ, וְעַל-עַמְּךָ וְעַל-בֵּית אָבִיךָ, יָמִים אֲשֶׁר לֹא-בָאוּ, לְמִיּוֹם סוּר-אֶפְרַיִם מֵעַל יְהוּדָה:  אֵת, מֶלֶךְ אַשּׁוּר.  {פ}
17.english: The LORD shall bring upon thee, and upon thy people, and upon thy father's house, days that have not come, from the day that Ephraim departed from Judah; even the king of Assyria.' {P}

18.hebrew: וְהָיָה בַּיּוֹם הַהוּא, יִשְׁרֹק יְהוָה לַזְּבוּב, אֲשֶׁר בִּקְצֵה, יְאֹרֵי מִצְרָיִם; וְלַדְּבוֹרָה--אֲשֶׁר, בְּאֶרֶץ אַשּׁוּר.
18.english: And it shall come to pass in that day, that the LORD shall hiss for the fly that is in the uttermost part of the rivers of Egypt, and for the bee that is in the land of Assyria.

19.hebrew: וּבָאוּ וְנָחוּ כֻלָּם בְּנַחֲלֵי הַבַּתּוֹת, וּבִנְקִיקֵי הַסְּלָעִים; וּבְכֹל, הַנַּעֲצוּצִים, וּבְכֹל, הַנַּהֲלֹלִים.
19.english: And they shall come, and shall rest all of them in the rugged valleys, and in the holes of the rocks, and upon all thorns, and upon all brambles.

20.hebrew: בַּיּוֹם הַהוּא יְגַלַּח אֲדֹנָי בְּתַעַר הַשְּׂכִירָה בְּעֶבְרֵי נָהָר, בְּמֶלֶךְ אַשּׁוּר, אֶת-הָרֹאשׁ, וְשַׂעַר הָרַגְלָיִם; וְגַם אֶת-הַזָּקָן, תִּסְפֶּה.  {פ}
20.english: In that day shall the Lord shave with a razor that is hired in the parts beyond the River, even with the king of Assyria, the head and the hair of the feet; and it shall also sweep away the beard. {P}

21.hebrew: וְהָיָה, בַּיּוֹם הַהוּא; יְחַיֶּה-אִישׁ עֶגְלַת בָּקָר, וּשְׁתֵּי-צֹאן.
21.english: And it shall come to pass in that day, that a man shall rear a young cow, and two sheep;

22.hebrew: וְהָיָה, מֵרֹב עֲשׂוֹת חָלָב--יֹאכַל חֶמְאָה:  כִּי-חֶמְאָה וּדְבַשׁ יֹאכֵל, כָּל-הַנּוֹתָר בְּקֶרֶב הָאָרֶץ.  {ס}
22.english: and it shall come to pass, for the abundance of milk that they shall give, he shall eat curd; for curd and honey shall every one eat that is left in the midst of the land. {S}

23.hebrew: וְהָיָה, בַּיּוֹם הַהוּא--יִהְיֶה כָל-מָקוֹם אֲשֶׁר יִהְיֶה-שָּׁם אֶלֶף גֶּפֶן, בְּאֶלֶף כָּסֶף:  לַשָּׁמִיר וְלַשַּׁיִת, יִהְיֶה.
23.english: And it shall come to pass in that day, that every place, where there were a thousand vines at a thousand silverlings, shall even be for briers and thorns.

24.hebrew: בַּחִצִּים וּבַקֶּשֶׁת, יָבוֹא שָׁמָּה:  כִּי-שָׁמִיר וָשַׁיִת, תִּהְיֶה כָל-הָאָרֶץ.
24.english: With arrows and with bow shall one come thither; because all the land shall become briers and thorns.

25.hebrew: וְכֹל הֶהָרִים, אֲשֶׁר בַּמַּעְדֵּר יֵעָדֵרוּן--לֹא-תָבוֹא שָׁמָּה, יִרְאַת שָׁמִיר וָשָׁיִת; וְהָיָה לְמִשְׁלַח שׁוֹר, וּלְמִרְמַס שֶׂה.  {פ}
25.english: And all the hills that were digged with the mattock, thou shalt not come thither for fear of briers and thorns, but it shall be for the sending forth of oxen, and for the treading of sheep. {P}

1.hebrew: וַיֹּאמֶר יְהוָה אֵלַי, קַח-לְךָ גִּלָּיוֹן גָּדוֹל; וּכְתֹב עָלָיו בְּחֶרֶט אֱנוֹשׁ, לְמַהֵר שָׁלָל חָשׁ בַּז.
1.english: And the LORD said unto me: 'Take thee a great tablet, and write upon it in common script: The spoil speedeth, the prey hasteth;

2.hebrew: וְאָעִידָה לִּי, עֵדִים נֶאֱמָנִים--אֵת אוּרִיָּה הַכֹּהֵן, וְאֶת-זְכַרְיָהוּ בֶּן יְבֶרֶכְיָהוּ.
2.english: and I will take unto Me faithful witnesses to record, Uriah the priest, and Zechariah the son of Jeberechiah.'

3.hebrew: וָאֶקְרַב, אֶל-הַנְּבִיאָה, וַתַּהַר, וַתֵּלֶד בֵּן;  {ס}  וַיֹּאמֶר יְהוָה, אֵלַי, קְרָא שְׁמוֹ, מַהֵר שָׁלָל חָשׁ בַּז.
3.english: And I went unto the prophetess; and she conceived, and bore a son. {S} Then said the LORD unto me: 'Call his name Maher-shalal-hashbaz.

4.hebrew: כִּי, בְּטֶרֶם יֵדַע הַנַּעַר, קְרֹא, אָבִי וְאִמִּי--יִשָּׂא אֶת-חֵיל דַּמֶּשֶׂק, וְאֵת שְׁלַל שֹׁמְרוֹן, לִפְנֵי, מֶלֶךְ אַשּׁוּר.  {ס}
4.english: For before the child shall have knowledge to cry: My father, and: My mother, the riches of Damascus and the spoil of Samaria shall be carried away before the king of Assyria.' {S}

5.hebrew: וַיֹּסֶף יְהוָה, דַּבֵּר אֵלַי עוֹד לֵאמֹר.
5.english: And the LORD spoke unto me yet again, saying:

6.hebrew: יַעַן, כִּי מָאַס הָעָם הַזֶּה, אֵת מֵי הַשִּׁלֹחַ, הַהֹלְכִים לְאַט; וּמְשׂוֹשׂ אֶת-רְצִין, וּבֶן-רְמַלְיָהוּ.
6.english: Forasmuch as this people hath refused the waters of Shiloah that go softly, and rejoiceth with Rezin and Remaliah's son;

7.hebrew: וְלָכֵן הִנֵּה אֲדֹנָי מַעֲלֶה עֲלֵיהֶם אֶת-מֵי הַנָּהָר, הָעֲצוּמִים וְהָרַבִּים--אֶת-מֶלֶךְ אַשּׁוּר, וְאֶת-כָּל-כְּבוֹדוֹ; וְעָלָה, עַל-כָּל-אֲפִיקָיו, וְהָלַךְ, עַל-כָּל-גְּדוֹתָיו.
7.english: Now therefore, behold, the Lord bringeth up upon them the waters of the River, mighty and many, even the king of Assyria and all his glory; and he shall come up over all his channels, and go over all his banks;

8.hebrew: וְחָלַף בִּיהוּדָה שָׁטַף וְעָבַר, עַד-צַוָּאר יַגִּיעַ; וְהָיָה מֻטּוֹת כְּנָפָיו, מְלֹא רֹחַב-אַרְצְךָ עִמָּנוּ אֵל.  {ס}
8.english: And he shall sweep through Judah overflowing as he passeth through he shall reach even to the neck; and the stretching out of his wings shall fill the breadth of thy land, O Immanuel. {S}

9.hebrew: רֹעוּ עַמִּים, וָחֹתּוּ, וְהַאֲזִינוּ, כֹּל מֶרְחַקֵּי-אָרֶץ; הִתְאַזְּרוּ וָחֹתּוּ, הִתְאַזְּרוּ וָחֹתּוּ.
9.english: Make an uproar, O ye peoples, and ye shall be broken in pieces; and give ear, all ye of far countries; gird yourselves, and ye shall be broken in pieces; gird yourselves, and ye shall be broken in pieces.

10.hebrew: עֻצוּ עֵצָה, וְתֻפָר; דַּבְּרוּ דָבָר וְלֹא יָקוּם, כִּי עִמָּנוּ אֵל.  {ס}
10.english: Take counsel together, and it shall be brought to nought; speak the word, and it shall not stand; for God is with us. {S}

11.hebrew: כִּי כֹה אָמַר יְהוָה אֵלַי, כְּחֶזְקַת הַיָּד; וְיִסְּרֵנִי, מִלֶּכֶת בְּדֶרֶךְ הָעָם-הַזֶּה לֵאמֹר.
11.english: For the LORD spoke thus to me with a strong hand, admonishing me that I should not walk in the way of this people, saying:

12.hebrew: לֹא-תֹאמְרוּן קֶשֶׁר, לְכֹל אֲשֶׁר-יֹאמַר הָעָם הַזֶּה קָשֶׁר; וְאֶת-מוֹרָאוֹ לֹא-תִירְאוּ, וְלֹא תַעֲרִיצוּ.
12.english: 'Say ye not: A conspiracy, concerning all whereof this people do say: A conspiracy; neither fear ye their fear, nor account it dreadful.

13.hebrew: אֶת-יְהוָה צְבָאוֹת, אֹתוֹ תַקְדִּישׁוּ; וְהוּא מוֹרַאֲכֶם, וְהוּא מַעֲרִצְכֶם.
13.english: The LORD of hosts, Him shall ye sanctify; and let Him be your fear, and let Him be your dread.

14.hebrew: וְהָיָה, לְמִקְדָּשׁ; וּלְאֶבֶן נֶגֶף וּלְצוּר מִכְשׁוֹל לִשְׁנֵי בָתֵּי יִשְׂרָאֵל, לְפַח וּלְמוֹקֵשׁ--לְיוֹשֵׁב, יְרוּשָׁלִָם.
14.english: And He shall be for a sanctuary; but for a stone of stumbling and for a rock of offence to both the houses of Israel, for a gin and for a snare to the inhabitants of Jerusalem.

15.hebrew: וְכָשְׁלוּ בָם, רַבִּים; וְנָפְלוּ וְנִשְׁבָּרוּ, וְנוֹקְשׁוּ וְנִלְכָּדוּ.  {פ}
15.english: And many among them shall stumble, and fall, and be broken, and be snared, and be taken.' {P}

16.hebrew: צוֹר, תְּעוּדָה; חֲתוֹם תּוֹרָה, בְּלִמֻּדָי.
16.english: 'Bind up the testimony, seal the instruction among My disciples.'

17.hebrew: וְחִכִּיתִי, לַיהוָה, הַמַּסְתִּיר פָּנָיו, מִבֵּית יַעֲקֹב; וְקִוֵּיתִי-לוֹ.
17.english: And I will wait for the LORD, that hideth His face from the house of Jacob, and I will look for Him.

18.hebrew: הִנֵּה אָנֹכִי, וְהַיְלָדִים אֲשֶׁר נָתַן-לִי יְהוָה, לְאֹתוֹת וּלְמוֹפְתִים, בְּיִשְׂרָאֵל--מֵעִם יְהוָה צְבָאוֹת, הַשֹּׁכֵן בְּהַר צִיּוֹן.  {ס}
18.english: Behold, I and the children whom the LORD hath given me shall be for signs and for wonders in Israel from the LORD of hosts, who dwelleth in mount Zion. {S}

19.hebrew: וְכִי-יֹאמְרוּ אֲלֵיכֶם, דִּרְשׁוּ אֶל-הָאֹבוֹת וְאֶל-הַיִּדְּעֹנִים, הַמְצַפְצְפִים, וְהַמַּהְגִּים:  הֲלוֹא-עַם אֶל-אֱלֹהָיו יִדְרֹשׁ, בְּעַד הַחַיִּים אֶל-הַמֵּתִים.
19.english: And when they shall say unto you: 'Seek unto the ghosts and the familiar spirits, that chirp and that mutter; should not a people seek unto their God? on behalf of the living unto the dead

20.hebrew: לְתוֹרָה, וְלִתְעוּדָה; אִם-לֹא יֹאמְרוּ כַּדָּבָר הַזֶּה, אֲשֶׁר אֵין-לוֹ שָׁחַר.
20.english: for instruction and for testimony?'--Surely they will speak according to this word, wherein there is no light.--

21.hebrew: וְעָבַר בָּהּ, נִקְשֶׁה וְרָעֵב; וְהָיָה כִי-יִרְעַב וְהִתְקַצַּף, וְקִלֵּל בְּמַלְכּוֹ וּבֵאלֹהָיו--וּפָנָה לְמָעְלָה.
21.english: And they shall pass this way that are sore bestead and hungry; and it shall come to pass that, when they shall be hungry, they shall fret themselves, and curse by their king and by their God, and, whether they turn their faces upward,

22.hebrew: וְאֶל-אֶרֶץ, יַבִּיט; וְהִנֵּה צָרָה וַחֲשֵׁכָה מְעוּף צוּקָה, וַאֲפֵלָה מְנֻדָּח.
22.english: or look unto the earth, behold distress and darkness, the gloom of anguish, and outspread thick darkness.

23.hebrew: כִּי לֹא מוּעָף, לַאֲשֶׁר מוּצָק לָהּ, כָּעֵת הָרִאשׁוֹן הֵקַל אַרְצָה זְבֻלוּן וְאַרְצָה נַפְתָּלִי, וְהָאַחֲרוֹן הִכְבִּיד--דֶּרֶךְ הַיָּם עֵבֶר הַיַּרְדֵּן, גְּלִיל הַגּוֹיִם.
23.english: For is there no gloom to her that was stedfast? Now the former hath lightly afflicted the land of Zebulun and the land of Naphtali, but the latter hath dealt a more grievous blow by the way of the sea, beyond the Jordan, in the district of the nations.

1.hebrew: הָעָם הַהֹלְכִים בַּחֹשֶׁךְ, רָאוּ אוֹר גָּדוֹל:  יֹשְׁבֵי בְּאֶרֶץ צַלְמָוֶת, אוֹר נָגַהּ עֲלֵיהֶם.
1.english: The people that walked in darkness have seen a great light; they that dwelt in the land of the shadow of death, upon them hath the light shined.

2.hebrew: הִרְבִּיתָ הַגּוֹי, לא (לוֹ) הִגְדַּלְתָּ הַשִּׂמְחָה; שָׂמְחוּ לְפָנֶיךָ כְּשִׂמְחַת בַּקָּצִיר, כַּאֲשֶׁר יָגִילוּ בְּחַלְּקָם שָׁלָל.
2.english: Thou hast multiplied the nation, Thou hast increased their joy; they joy before Thee according to the joy in harvest, as men rejoice when they divide the spoil.

3.hebrew: כִּי אֶת-עֹל סֻבֳּלוֹ, וְאֵת מַטֵּה שִׁכְמוֹ, שֵׁבֶט, הַנֹּגֵשׂ בּוֹ--הַחִתֹּתָ, כְּיוֹם מִדְיָן.
3.english: For the yoke of his burden, and the staff of his shoulder, the rod of his oppressor, Thou hast broken as in the day of Midian.

4.hebrew: כִּי כָל-סְאוֹן סֹאֵן בְּרַעַשׁ, וְשִׂמְלָה מְגוֹלָלָה בְדָמִים; וְהָיְתָה לִשְׂרֵפָה, מַאֲכֹלֶת אֵשׁ.
4.english: For every boot stamped with fierceness, and every cloak rolled in blood, shall even be for burning, for fuel of fire.

5.hebrew: כִּי-יֶלֶד יֻלַּד-לָנוּ, בֵּן נִתַּן-לָנוּ, וַתְּהִי הַמִּשְׂרָה, עַל-שִׁכְמוֹ; וַיִּקְרָא שְׁמוֹ פֶּלֶא יוֹעֵץ, אֵל גִּבּוֹר, אֲבִי-עַד, שַׂר-שָׁלוֹם.
5.english: For a child is born unto us, a son is given unto us; and the government is upon his shoulder; and his name is called Pele-joez-el-gibbor-Abi-ad-sar-shalom;

6.hebrew: לם רבה (לְמַרְבֵּה) הַמִּשְׂרָה וּלְשָׁלוֹם אֵין-קֵץ, עַל-כִּסֵּא דָוִד וְעַל-מַמְלַכְתּוֹ, לְהָכִין אֹתָהּ וּלְסַעֲדָהּ, בְּמִשְׁפָּט וּבִצְדָקָה; מֵעַתָּה, וְעַד-עוֹלָם, קִנְאַת יְהוָה צְבָאוֹת, תַּעֲשֶׂה-זֹּאת.  {פ}
6.english: That the government may be increased, and of peace there be no end, upon the throne of David, and upon his kingdom, to establish it, and to uphold it through justice and through righteousness from henceforth even for ever. The zeal of the LORD of hosts doth perform this. {P}

7.hebrew: דָּבָר שָׁלַח אֲדֹנָי, בְּיַעֲקֹב; וְנָפַל, בְּיִשְׂרָאֵל.
7.english: The Lord sent a word into Jacob, and it hath lighted upon Israel.

8.hebrew: וְיָדְעוּ הָעָם כֻּלּוֹ, אֶפְרַיִם וְיוֹשֵׁב שֹׁמְרוֹן, בְּגַאֲוָה וּבְגֹדֶל לֵבָב, לֵאמֹר.
8.english: And all the people shall know, even Ephraim and the inhabitant of Samaria, that say in pride and in arrogancy of heart:

9.hebrew: לְבֵנִים נָפָלוּ, וְגָזִית נִבְנֶה; שִׁקְמִים גֻּדָּעוּ, וַאֲרָזִים נַחֲלִיף.
9.english: 'The bricks are fallen, but we will build with hewn stones; the sycamores are cut down, but cedars will we put in their place.'

10.hebrew: וַיְשַׂגֵּב יְהוָה אֶת-צָרֵי רְצִין, עָלָיו; וְאֶת-אֹיְבָיו, יְסַכְסֵךְ.
10.english: Therefore the LORD doth set upon high the adversaries of Rezin against him, and spur his enemies;

11.hebrew: אֲרָם מִקֶּדֶם, וּפְלִשְׁתִּים מֵאָחוֹר, וַיֹּאכְלוּ אֶת-יִשְׂרָאֵל, בְּכָל-פֶּה; בְּכָל-זֹאת לֹא-שָׁב אַפּוֹ, וְעוֹד יָדוֹ נְטוּיָה.
11.english: The Arameans on the east, and the Philistines on the west; and they devour Israel with open mouth. For all this His anger is not turned away, but His hand is stretched out still.

12.hebrew: וְהָעָם לֹא-שָׁב, עַד-הַמַּכֵּהוּ; וְאֶת-יְהוָה צְבָאוֹת, לֹא דָרָשׁוּ.  {ס}
12.english: Yet the people turneth not unto Him that smiteth them, neither do they seek the LORD of hosts. {S}

13.hebrew: וַיַּכְרֵת יְהוָה מִיִּשְׂרָאֵל, רֹאשׁ וְזָנָב כִּפָּה וְאַגְמוֹן--יוֹם אֶחָד.
13.english: Therefore the LORD doth cut off from Israel head and tail, palm-branch and rush, in one day.

14.hebrew: זָקֵן וּנְשׂוּא-פָנִים, הוּא הָרֹאשׁ; וְנָבִיא מוֹרֶה-שֶּׁקֶר, הוּא הַזָּנָב.
14.english: The elder and the man of rank, he is the head; and the prophet that teacheth lies, he is the tail.

15.hebrew: וַיִּהְיוּ מְאַשְּׁרֵי הָעָם-הַזֶּה, מַתְעִים; וּמְאֻשָּׁרָיו, מְבֻלָּעִים.
15.english: For they that lead this people cause them to err; and they that are led of them are destroyed.

16.hebrew: עַל-כֵּן עַל-בַּחוּרָיו לֹא-יִשְׂמַח אֲדֹנָי, וְאֶת-יְתֹמָיו וְאֶת-אַלְמְנוֹתָיו לֹא יְרַחֵם--כִּי כֻלּוֹ חָנֵף וּמֵרַע, וְכָל-פֶּה דֹּבֵר נְבָלָה; בְּכָל-זֹאת לֹא-שָׁב אַפּוֹ, וְעוֹד יָדוֹ נְטוּיָה.
16.english: Therefore the Lord shall have no joy in their young men, neither shall He have compassion on their fatherless and widows; for every one is ungodly and an evil-doer, and every mouth speaketh wantonness. For all this His anger is not turned away, but His hand is stretched out still.

17.hebrew: כִּי-בָעֲרָה כָאֵשׁ רִשְׁעָה, שָׁמִיר וָשַׁיִת תֹּאכֵל; וַתִּצַּת בְּסִבְכֵי הַיַּעַר, וַיִּתְאַבְּכוּ גֵּאוּת עָשָׁן.
17.english: For wickedness burneth as the fire; it devoureth the briers and thorns; yea, it kindleth in the thickets of the forest, and they roll upward in thick clouds of smoke.

18.hebrew: בְּעֶבְרַת יְהוָה צְבָאוֹת, נֶעְתַּם אָרֶץ; וַיְהִי הָעָם כְּמַאֲכֹלֶת אֵשׁ, אִישׁ אֶל-אָחִיו לֹא יַחְמֹלוּ.
18.english: Through the wrath of the LORD of hosts is the land burnt up; the people also are as the fuel of fire; no man spareth his brother.

19.hebrew: וַיִּגְזֹר עַל-יָמִין וְרָעֵב, וַיֹּאכַל עַל-שְׂמֹאול וְלֹא שָׂבֵעוּ:  אִישׁ בְּשַׂר-זְרֹעוֹ, יֹאכֵלוּ.
19.english: And one snatcheth on the right hand, and is hungry; and he eateth on the left hand, and is not satisfied; they eat every man the flesh of his own arm:

20.hebrew: מְנַשֶּׁה אֶת-אֶפְרַיִם, וְאֶפְרַיִם אֶת-מְנַשֶּׁה--יַחְדָּו הֵמָּה, עַל-יְהוּדָה; בְּכָל-זֹאת לֹא-שָׁב אַפּוֹ, וְעוֹד יָדוֹ נְטוּיָה.  {ס}
20.english: Manasseh, Ephraim; and Ephraim, Manasseh; and they together are against Judah. For all this His anger is not turned away, but His hand is stretched out still. {S}

1.hebrew: הוֹי הַחֹקְקִים, חִקְקֵי-אָוֶן; וּמְכַתְּבִים עָמָל, כִּתֵּבוּ.
1.english: Woe unto them that decree unrighteous decrees, and to the writers that write iniquity;

2.hebrew: לְהַטּוֹת מִדִּין, דַּלִּים, וְלִגְזֹל, מִשְׁפַּט עֲנִיֵּי עַמִּי--לִהְיוֹת אַלְמָנוֹת שְׁלָלָם, וְאֶת-יְתוֹמִים יָבֹזּוּ.
2.english: To turn aside the needy from judgment, and to take away the right of the poor of My people, that widows may be their spoil, and that they may make the fatherless their prey!

3.hebrew: וּמַה-תַּעֲשׂוּ לְיוֹם פְּקֻדָּה, וּלְשׁוֹאָה מִמֶּרְחָק תָּבוֹא:  עַל-מִי תָּנוּסוּ לְעֶזְרָה, וְאָנָה תַעַזְבוּ כְּבוֹדְכֶם.
3.english: And what will ye do in the day of visitation, and in the ruin which shall come from far? To whom will ye flee for help? And where will ye leave your glory?

4.hebrew: בִּלְתִּי כָרַע תַּחַת אַסִּיר, וְתַחַת הֲרוּגִים יִפֹּלוּ; בְּכָל-זֹאת לֹא-שָׁב אַפּוֹ, וְעוֹד יָדוֹ נְטוּיָה.  {פ}
4.english: They can do nought except crouch under the captives, and fall under the slain. For all this His anger is not turned away, but His hand is stretched out still. {P}

5.hebrew: הוֹי אַשּׁוּר, שֵׁבֶט אַפִּי; וּמַטֶּה-הוּא בְיָדָם, זַעְמִי.
5.english: O Asshur, the rod of Mine anger, in whose hand as a staff is Mine indignation!

6.hebrew: בְּגוֹי חָנֵף אֲשַׁלְּחֶנּוּ, וְעַל-עַם עֶבְרָתִי אֲצַוֶּנּוּ--לִשְׁלֹל שָׁלָל וְלָבֹז בַּז, ולשימו (וּלְשׂוּמוֹ) מִרְמָס כְּחֹמֶר חוּצוֹת.
6.english: I do send him against an ungodly nation, and against the people of My wrath do I give him a charge, to take the spoil, and to take the prey, and to tread them down like the mire of the streets.

7.hebrew: וְהוּא לֹא-כֵן יְדַמֶּה, וּלְבָבוֹ לֹא-כֵן יַחְשֹׁב:  כִּי לְהַשְׁמִיד בִּלְבָבוֹ, וּלְהַכְרִית גּוֹיִם לֹא מְעָט.
7.english: Howbeit he meaneth not so, neither doth his heart think so; but it is in his heart to destroy, and to cut off nations not a few.

8.hebrew: כִּי, יֹאמַר:  הֲלֹא שָׂרַי יַחְדָּו, מְלָכִים.
8.english: For he saith: 'Are not my princes all of them kings?

9.hebrew: הֲלֹא כְּכַרְכְּמִישׁ, כַּלְנוֹ:  אִם-לֹא כְאַרְפַּד חֲמָת, אִם-לֹא כְדַמֶּשֶׂק שֹׁמְרוֹן.
9.english: Is not Calno as Carchemish? Is not Hamath as Arpad? Is not Samaria as Damascus?

10.hebrew: כַּאֲשֶׁר מָצְאָה יָדִי, לְמַמְלְכֹת הָאֱלִיל; וּפְסִילֵיהֶם, מִירוּשָׁלִַם וּמִשֹּׁמְרוֹן.
10.english: As my hand hath reached the kingdoms of the idols, whose graven images did exceed them of Jerusalem and of Samaria;

11.hebrew: הֲלֹא, כַּאֲשֶׁר עָשִׂיתִי לְשֹׁמְרוֹן--וְלֶאֱלִילֶיהָ:  כֵּן אֶעֱשֶׂה לִירוּשָׁלִַם, וְלַעֲצַבֶּיהָ.  {פ}
11.english: Shall I not, as I have done unto Samaria and her idols, so do to Jerusalem and her idols?' {P}

12.hebrew: וְהָיָה, כִּי-יְבַצַּע אֲדֹנָי אֶת-כָּל-מַעֲשֵׂהוּ, בְּהַר צִיּוֹן, וּבִירוּשָׁלִָם--אֶפְקֹד, עַל-פְּרִי-גֹדֶל לְבַב מֶלֶךְ-אַשּׁוּר, וְעַל-תִּפְאֶרֶת, רוּם עֵינָיו.
12.english: Wherefore it shall come to pass, that when the Lord hath performed His whole work upon mount Zion and on Jerusalem, I will punish the fruit of the arrogant heart of the king of Assyria, and the glory of his haughty looks.

13.hebrew: כִּי אָמַר, בְּכֹחַ יָדִי עָשִׂיתִי, וּבְחָכְמָתִי, כִּי נְבֻנוֹתִי; וְאָסִיר גְּבוּלֹת עַמִּים, ועתידתיהם (וַעֲתוּדֹתֵיהֶם) שׁוֹשֵׂתִי, וְאוֹרִיד כַּאבִּיר, יוֹשְׁבִים.
13.english: For he hath said: by the strength of my hand I have done it, and by my wisdom, for I am prudent; in that I have removed the bounds of the peoples, and have robbed their treasures, and have brought down as one mighty the inhabitants;

14.hebrew: וַתִּמְצָא כַקֵּן יָדִי, לְחֵיל הָעַמִּים, וְכֶאֱסֹף בֵּיצִים עֲזֻבוֹת, כָּל-הָאָרֶץ אֲנִי אָסָפְתִּי; וְלֹא הָיָה נֹדֵד כָּנָף, וּפֹצֶה פֶה וּמְצַפְצֵף.
14.english: And my hand hath found as a nest the riches of the peoples; and as one gathereth eggs that are forsaken, have I gathered all the earth; and there was none that moved the wing, or that opened the mouth, or chirped.

15.hebrew: הֲיִתְפָּאֵר, הַגַּרְזֶן, עַל, הַחֹצֵב בּוֹ:  אִם-יִתְגַּדֵּל הַמַּשּׂוֹר, עַל-מְנִיפוֹ, כְּהָנִיף שֵׁבֶט וְאֶת-מְרִימָיו, כְּהָרִים מַטֶּה לֹא-עֵץ.  {פ}
15.english: Should the axe boast itself against him that heweth therewith? Should the saw magnify itself against him that moveth it? as if a rod should move them that lift it up, or as if a staff should lift up him that is not wood. {P}

16.hebrew: לָכֵן יְשַׁלַּח הָאָדוֹן יְהוָה צְבָאוֹת, בְּמִשְׁמַנָּיו--רָזוֹן; וְתַחַת כְּבֹדוֹ יֵקַד יְקֹד, כִּיקוֹד אֵשׁ.
16.english: Therefore will the Lord, the LORD of hosts, send among his fat ones leanness; and under his glory there shall be kindled a burning like the burning of fire.

17.hebrew: וְהָיָה אוֹר-יִשְׂרָאֵל לְאֵשׁ, וּקְדוֹשׁוֹ לְלֶהָבָה; וּבָעֲרָה, וְאָכְלָה שִׁיתוֹ וּשְׁמִירוֹ--בְּיוֹם אֶחָד.
17.english: And the light of Israel shall be for a fire, and his Holy One for a flame; and it shall burn and devour his thorns and his briers in one day.

18.hebrew: וּכְבוֹד יַעְרוֹ וְכַרְמִלּוֹ, מִנֶּפֶשׁ וְעַד-בָּשָׂר יְכַלֶּה; וְהָיָה, כִּמְסֹס נֹסֵס.
18.english: And the glory of his forest and of his fruitful field, he will consume both soul and body; and it shall be as when a sick man wasteth away.

19.hebrew: וּשְׁאָר עֵץ יַעְרוֹ, מִסְפָּר יִהְיוּ; וְנַעַר, יִכְתְּבֵם.  {ס}
19.english: And the remnant of the trees of his forest shall be few, that a child may write them down. {S}

20.hebrew: וְהָיָה בַּיּוֹם הַהוּא, לֹא-יוֹסִיף עוֹד שְׁאָר יִשְׂרָאֵל וּפְלֵיטַת בֵּית-יַעֲקֹב, לְהִשָּׁעֵן, עַל-מַכֵּהוּ; וְנִשְׁעַן, עַל-יְהוָה קְדוֹשׁ יִשְׂרָאֵל--בֶּאֱמֶת.
20.english: And it shall come to pass in that day, that the remnant of Israel, and they that are escaped of the house of Jacob, shall no more again stay upon him that smote them; but shall stay upon the LORD, the Holy One of Israel, in truth.

21.hebrew: שְׁאָר יָשׁוּב, שְׁאָר יַעֲקֹב--אֶל-אֵל, גִּבּוֹר.
21.english: A remnant shall return, even the remnant of Jacob, unto God the Mighty.

22.hebrew: כִּי אִם-יִהְיֶה עַמְּךָ יִשְׂרָאֵל, כְּחוֹל הַיָּם--שְׁאָר, יָשׁוּב בּוֹ; כִּלָּיוֹן חָרוּץ, שׁוֹטֵף צְדָקָה.
22.english: For though thy people, O Israel, be as the sand of the sea, only a remnant of them shall return; an extermination is determined, overflowing with righteousness.

23.hebrew: כִּי כָלָה, וְנֶחֱרָצָה--אֲדֹנָי יְהוִה צְבָאוֹת, עֹשֶׂה בְּקֶרֶב כָּל-הָאָרֶץ.  {פ}
23.english: For an extermination wholly determined shall the Lord, the GOD of hosts, make in the midst of all the earth. {P}

24.hebrew: לָכֵן, כֹּה-אָמַר אֲדֹנָי יְהוִה צְבָאוֹת, אַל-תִּירָא עַמִּי יֹשֵׁב צִיּוֹן, מֵאַשּׁוּר; בַּשֵּׁבֶט יַכֶּכָּה, וּמַטֵּהוּ יִשָּׂא-עָלֶיךָ בְּדֶרֶךְ מִצְרָיִם.
24.english: Therefore thus saith the Lord, the GOD of hosts: O My people that dwellest in Zion, be not afraid of Asshur, though he smite thee with the rod, and lift up his staff against thee, after the manner of Egypt.

25.hebrew: כִּי-עוֹד, מְעַט מִזְעָר, וְכָלָה זַעַם, וְאַפִּי עַל-תַּבְלִיתָם.
25.english: For yet a very little while, and the indignation shall be accomplished, and Mine anger shall be to their destruction.

26.hebrew: וְעוֹרֵר עָלָיו יְהוָה צְבָאוֹת, שׁוֹט, כְּמַכַּת מִדְיָן, בְּצוּר עוֹרֵב; וּמַטֵּהוּ, עַל-הַיָּם, וּנְשָׂאוֹ, בְּדֶרֶךְ מִצְרָיִם.
26.english: And the LORD of hosts shall stir up against him a scourge, as in the slaughter of Midian at the Rock of Oreb; and as His rod was over the sea, so shall He lift it up after the manner of Egypt.

27.hebrew: וְהָיָה בַּיּוֹם הַהוּא, יָסוּר סֻבֳּלוֹ מֵעַל שִׁכְמֶךָ, וְעֻלּוֹ, מֵעַל צַוָּארֶךָ; וְחֻבַּל עֹל, מִפְּנֵי-שָׁמֶן.
27.english: And it shall come to pass in that day, that his burden shall depart from off thy shoulder, and his yoke from off thy neck, and the yoke shall be destroyed by reason of fatness.

28.hebrew: בָּא עַל-עַיַּת, עָבַר בְּמִגְרוֹן; לְמִכְמָשׂ, יַפְקִיד כֵּלָיו.
28.english: He is come to Aiath, he is passed through Migron; at Michmas he layeth up his baggage;

29.hebrew: עָבְרוּ, מַעְבָּרָה, גֶּבַע, מָלוֹן לָנוּ; חָרְדָה, הָרָמָה--גִּבְעַת שָׁאוּל, נָסָה.
29.english: They are gone over the pass; they have taken up their lodging at Geba; Ramah trembleth; Gibeath-shaul is fled.

30.hebrew: צַהֲלִי קוֹלֵךְ, בַּת-גַּלִּים; הַקְשִׁיבִי לַיְשָׁה, עֲנִיָּה עֲנָתוֹת.
30.english: Cry thou with a shrill voice, O daughter of Gallim! Hearken, O Laish! O thou poor Anathoth!

31.english: Madmenah is in mad flight; the inhabitants of Gebim flee to cover.

32.hebrew: עוֹד הַיּוֹם, בְּנֹב לַעֲמֹד; יְנֹפֵף יָדוֹ הַר בית- (בַּת-) צִיּוֹן, גִּבְעַת יְרוּשָׁלִָם.  {פ}
32.english: This very day shall he halt at Nob, shaking his hand at the mount of the daughter of Zion, the hill of Jerusalem. {P}

33.hebrew: הִנֵּה הָאָדוֹן יְהוָה צְבָאוֹת, מְסָעֵף פֻּארָה בְּמַעֲרָצָה; וְרָמֵי הַקּוֹמָה גְּדוּעִים, וְהַגְּבֹהִים יִשְׁפָּלוּ.
33.english: Behold, the Lord, the LORD of hosts, shall lop the boughs with terror; and the high ones of stature shall be hewn down, and the lofty shall be laid low.

34.hebrew: וְנִקַּף סִבְכֵי הַיַּעַר, בַּבַּרְזֶל; וְהַלְּבָנוֹן, בְּאַדִּיר יִפּוֹל.  {ס}
34.english: And He shall cut down the thickets of the forest with iron, and Lebanon shall fall by a mighty one. {S}

1.hebrew: וְיָצָא חֹטֶר, מִגֵּזַע יִשָׁי; וְנֵצֶר, מִשָּׁרָשָׁיו יִפְרֶה.
1.english: And there shall come forth a shoot out of the stock of Jesse, and a twig shall grow forth out of his roots.

2.hebrew: וְנָחָה עָלָיו, רוּחַ יְהוָה--רוּחַ חָכְמָה וּבִינָה, רוּחַ עֵצָה וּגְבוּרָה, רוּחַ דַּעַת, וְיִרְאַת יְהוָה.
2.english: And the spirit of the LORD shall rest upon him, the spirit of wisdom and understanding, the spirit of counsel and might, the spirit of knowledge and of the fear of the LORD.

3.hebrew: וַהֲרִיחוֹ, בְּיִרְאַת יְהוָה; וְלֹא-לְמַרְאֵה עֵינָיו יִשְׁפּוֹט, וְלֹא-לְמִשְׁמַע אָזְנָיו יוֹכִיחַ.
3.english: And his delight shall be in the fear of the LORD; and he shall not judge after the sight of his eyes, neither decide after the hearing of his ears;

4.hebrew: וְשָׁפַט בְּצֶדֶק דַּלִּים, וְהוֹכִיחַ בְּמִישׁוֹר לְעַנְוֵי-אָרֶץ; וְהִכָּה-אֶרֶץ בְּשֵׁבֶט פִּיו, וּבְרוּחַ שְׂפָתָיו יָמִית רָשָׁע.
4.english: But with righteousness shall he judge the poor, and decide with equity for the meek of the land; and he shall smite the land with the rod of his mouth, and with the breath of his lips shall he slay the wicked.

5.hebrew: וְהָיָה צֶדֶק, אֵזוֹר מָתְנָיו; וְהָאֱמוּנָה, אֵזוֹר חֲלָצָיו.
5.english: And righteousness shall be the girdle of his loins, and faithfulness the girdle of his reins.

6.hebrew: וְגָר זְאֵב עִם-כֶּבֶשׂ, וְנָמֵר עִם-גְּדִי יִרְבָּץ; וְעֵגֶל וּכְפִיר וּמְרִיא יַחְדָּו, וְנַעַר קָטֹן נֹהֵג בָּם.
6.english: And the wolf shall dwell with the lamb, and the leopard shall lie down with the kid; and the calf and the young lion and the fatling together; and a little child shall lead them.

7.hebrew: וּפָרָה וָדֹב תִּרְעֶינָה, יַחְדָּו יִרְבְּצוּ יַלְדֵיהֶן; וְאַרְיֵה, כַּבָּקָר יֹאכַל-תֶּבֶן.
7.english: And the cow and the bear shall feed; their young ones shall lie down together; and the lion shall eat straw like the ox.

8.hebrew: וְשִׁעֲשַׁע יוֹנֵק, עַל-חֻר פָּתֶן; וְעַל מְאוּרַת צִפְעוֹנִי, גָּמוּל יָדוֹ הָדָה.
8.english: And the sucking child shall play on the hole of the asp, and the weaned child shall put his hand on the basilisk's den.

9.hebrew: לֹא-יָרֵעוּ וְלֹא-יַשְׁחִיתוּ, בְּכָל-הַר קָדְשִׁי:  כִּי-מָלְאָה הָאָרֶץ, דֵּעָה אֶת-יְהוָה, כַּמַּיִם, לַיָּם מְכַסִּים.  {ס}
9.english: They shall not hurt nor destroy in all My holy mountain; for the earth shall be full of the knowledge of the LORD, as the waters cover the sea. {S}

10.hebrew: וְהָיָה, בַּיּוֹם הַהוּא, שֹׁרֶשׁ יִשַׁי אֲשֶׁר עֹמֵד לְנֵס עַמִּים, אֵלָיו גּוֹיִם יִדְרֹשׁוּ; וְהָיְתָה מְנֻחָתוֹ, כָּבוֹד.  {פ}
10.english: And it shall come to pass in that day, that the root of Jesse, that standeth for an ensign of the peoples, unto him shall the nations seek; and his resting-place shall be glorious. {P}

11.hebrew: וְהָיָה בַּיּוֹם הַהוּא, יוֹסִיף אֲדֹנָי שֵׁנִית יָדוֹ, לִקְנוֹת, אֶת-שְׁאָר עַמּוֹ--אֲשֶׁר יִשָּׁאֵר מֵאַשּׁוּר וּמִמִּצְרַיִם וּמִפַּתְרוֹס וּמִכּוּשׁ, וּמֵעֵילָם וּמִשִּׁנְעָר וּמֵחֲמָת, וּמֵאִיֵּי, הַיָּם.
11.english: And it shall come to pass in that day, that the Lord will set His hand again the second time to recover the remnant of His people, that shall remain from Assyria, and from Egypt, and from Pathros, and from Cush, and from Elam, and from Shinar, and from Hamath, and from the islands of the sea.

12.hebrew: וְנָשָׂא נֵס לַגּוֹיִם, וְאָסַף נִדְחֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל; וּנְפֻצוֹת יְהוּדָה יְקַבֵּץ, מֵאַרְבַּע כַּנְפוֹת הָאָרֶץ.
12.english: And He will set up an ensign for the nations, and will assemble the dispersed of Israel, and gather together the scattered of Judah from the four corners of the earth.

13.hebrew: וְסָרָה קִנְאַת אֶפְרַיִם, וְצֹרְרֵי יְהוּדָה יִכָּרֵתוּ:  אֶפְרַיִם לֹא-יְקַנֵּא אֶת-יְהוּדָה, וִיהוּדָה לֹא-יָצֹר אֶת-אֶפְרָיִם.
13.english: The envy also of Ephraim shall depart, and they that harass Judah shall be cut off; Ephraim shall not envy Judah, and Judah shall not vex Ephraim.

14.hebrew: וְעָפוּ בְכָתֵף פְּלִשְׁתִּים יָמָּה, יַחְדָּו יָבֹזּוּ אֶת-בְּנֵי-קֶדֶם; אֱדוֹם וּמוֹאָב מִשְׁלוֹחַ יָדָם, וּבְנֵי עַמּוֹן מִשְׁמַעְתָּם.
14.english: And they shall fly down upon the shoulder of the Philistines on the west; together shall they spoil the children of the east; they shall put forth their hand upon Edom and Moab; and the children of Ammon shall obey them.

15.hebrew: וְהֶחֱרִים יְהוָה, אֵת לְשׁוֹן יָם-מִצְרַיִם, וְהֵנִיף יָדוֹ עַל-הַנָּהָר, בַּעְיָם רוּחוֹ; וְהִכָּהוּ לְשִׁבְעָה נְחָלִים, וְהִדְרִיךְ בַּנְּעָלִים.
15.english: And the LORD will utterly destroy the tongue of the Egyptian sea; and with His scorching wind will He shake His hand over the River, and will smite it into seven streams, and cause men to march over dry-shod.

16.hebrew: וְהָיְתָה מְסִלָּה--לִשְׁאָר עַמּוֹ, אֲשֶׁר יִשָּׁאֵר מֵאַשּׁוּר:  כַּאֲשֶׁר הָיְתָה לְיִשְׂרָאֵל, בְּיוֹם עֲלֹתוֹ מֵאֶרֶץ מִצְרָיִם.
16.english: And there shall be a highway for the remnant of His people, that shall remain from Assyria, like as there was for Israel in the day that he came up out of the land of Egypt.

1.hebrew: וְאָמַרְתָּ, בַּיּוֹם הַהוּא, אוֹדְךָ יְהוָה, כִּי אָנַפְתָּ בִּי; יָשֹׁב אַפְּךָ, וּתְנַחֲמֵנִי.
1.english: And in that day thou shalt say: 'I will give thanks unto Thee, O LORD; for though Thou was angry with me, Thine anger is turned away, and Thou comfortest me.

2.hebrew: הִנֵּה אֵל יְשׁוּעָתִי אֶבְטַח, וְלֹא אֶפְחָד:  כִּי-עָזִּי וְזִמְרָת יָהּ יְהוָה, וַיְהִי-לִי לִישׁוּעָה.
2.english: Behold, God is my salvation; I will trust, and will not be afraid; for GOD the LORD is my strength and song; and He is become my salvation.'

3.hebrew: וּשְׁאַבְתֶּם-מַיִם, בְּשָׂשׂוֹן, מִמַּעַיְנֵי, הַיְשׁוּעָה.
3.english: Therefore with joy shall ye draw water out of the wells of salvation.

4.hebrew: וַאֲמַרְתֶּם בַּיּוֹם הַהוּא, הוֹדוּ לַיהוָה קִרְאוּ בִשְׁמוֹ, הוֹדִיעוּ בָעַמִּים, עֲלִילֹתָיו; הַזְכִּירוּ, כִּי נִשְׂגָּב שְׁמוֹ.
4.english: And in that day shall ye say: 'Give thanks unto the LORD, proclaim His name, declare His doings among the peoples, make mention that His name is exalted.

5.hebrew: זַמְּרוּ יְהוָה, כִּי גֵאוּת עָשָׂה; מידעת (מוּדַעַת) זֹאת, בְּכָל-הָאָרֶץ.
5.english: Sing unto the LORD; for He hath done gloriously; this is made known in all the earth.

6.hebrew: צַהֲלִי וָרֹנִּי, יוֹשֶׁבֶת צִיּוֹן:  כִּי-גָדוֹל בְּקִרְבֵּךְ, קְדוֹשׁ יִשְׂרָאֵל.  {ס}
6.english: Cry aloud and shout, thou inhabitant of Zion, for great is the Holy One of Israel in the midst of thee.' {S}

9.hebrew: ††дƒрћ≈д йе…н-йјде»д бћ»а, а«лјж»шƒй ејт∆бјш»д е«з¬ше…п а»у--м»щ“ећн д»а»ш∆х мјщ—«оћ»д, ејз«ић»а∆йд» й«щ—јоƒйг оƒоћ∆рћ»д.
9.english: Behold, the day of the LORD cometh, cruel, and full of wrath and fierce anger; to make the earth a desolation, and to destroy the sinners thereof out of it,
