11.hebrew: ††ећф»ч«гјъћƒй т«м-ъћ≈б≈м ш»т»д, ејт«м-шјщ—»тƒйн т¬е р»н; ејдƒщ—јбћ«ъћƒй вћјае…п ж≈гƒйн, ејв«а¬е«ъ т»шƒйцƒйн а«щ—јфћƒйм.
11.english: And I will visit upon the world their evil, and upon the wicked their iniquity; and I will cause the arrogancy of the proud to cease, and will lay low the haughtiness of the tyrants.

12.hebrew: ††ае…чƒйш аЅре…щ—, оƒфћ»ж; еја»г»н, оƒлћ∆ъ∆н ае…фƒйш.
12.english: I will make man more rare than fine gold, even man than the pure gold of Ophir.

13.hebrew: ††т«м-лћ≈п щ—»о«йƒн а«шјвћƒйж, ејъƒшјт«щ— д»а»ш∆х оƒоћјче…о»дћ--бћјт∆бјш«ъ йјде»д цјб»ае…ъ, ећбјйе…н з¬ше…п а«фће….
13.english: Therefore I will make the heavens to tremble, and the earth shall be shaken out of her place, for the wrath of the LORD of hosts, and for the day of His fierce anger.

14.hebrew: ††ејд»й»д лћƒцјбƒй оЋгћ»з, ећлјц…ап еја≈йп ојч«бћ≈х:† аƒйщ— а∆м-т«оће… йƒфјрећ, ејаƒйщ— а∆м-а«шјце… й»рећсећ.
14.english: And it shall come to pass, that as the chased gazelle, and as sheep that no man gathereth, they shall turn every man to his own people, and shall flee every man to his own land.

15.hebrew: ††лћ»м-д«рћƒојц»а, йƒгћ»ч≈ш; ејл»м-д«рћƒсјфћ∆д, йƒфће…м бћ∆з»ш∆б.
15.english: Every one that is found shall be thrust through; and every one that is caught shall fall by the sword.

16.hebrew: ††ејт…мјм≈йд∆н йјшЋићјщ—ећ, мјт≈йр≈йд∆н; йƒщћ—«сћећ, бћ»ъћ≈йд∆н, ећрјщ—≈йд∆н, ъщвмрд (ъћƒщћ—»л«бјр»д).
16.english: Their babes also shall be dashed in pieces before their eyes; their houses shall be spoiled, and their wives ravished.

17.hebrew: ††дƒрјрƒй о≈тƒйш т¬м≈йд∆н, а∆ъ-о»г»й, а¬щ—∆ш-лћ∆с∆у м…а й«зјщ—…бећ, ејж»д»б м…а й«зјфћјцећ-бе….
17.english: Behold, I will stir up the Medes against them, who shall not regard silver, and as for gold, they shall not delight in it.

18.hebrew: ††ећчјщ—»ъе…ъ, рјт»шƒйн ъћјш«ић«щ—јр»д:† ећфјшƒй-б∆и∆п м…а йјш«з≈оећ, т«м-бћ»рƒйн м…а-ъ»зећс т≈йр»н.
18.english: And their bows shall dash the young men in pieces; and they shall have no pity on the fruit of the womb; their eye shall not spare children.

19.hebrew: ††ејд»йјъ»д б»б∆м цјбƒй о«ојм»ле…ъ, ъћƒфја∆ш∆ъ вћјае…п лћ«щ“јгћƒйн, лћјо«дјфћ≈л«ъ аЅм…дƒйн, а∆ъ-сјг…н еја∆ъ-т¬о…ш»д.
19.english: And Babylon, the glory of kingdoms, the beauty of the Chaldeans' pride, shall be as when God overthrew Sodom and Gomorrah.

20.hebrew: ††м…а-ъ≈щ—≈б м»р∆ц«з, ејм…а ъƒщ—јлћ…п т«г-гће…ш е»ге…ш; ејм…а-й«д≈м щ—»н т¬ш»бƒй, ејш…тƒйн м…а-й«шјбћƒцећ щ—»н.
20.english: It shall never be inhabited, neither shall it be dwelt in from generation to generation; neither shall the Arabian pitch tent there; neither shall the shepherds make their fold there.

21.hebrew: ††ејш»бјцећ-щ—»н цƒйћƒйн, ећо»мјаећ б»ъћ≈йд∆н а…зƒйн; ејщ—»лјрећ щ—»н бћјре…ъ й«т¬р»д, ећщ“јтƒйшƒйн йјш«чћјгећ-щ—»н.
21.english: But wild-cats shall lie there; and their houses shall be full of ferrets; and ostriches shall dwell there, and satyrs shall dance there.

22.hebrew: ††ејт»р»д аƒйћƒйн бћја«мјојре…ъ»йе, ејъ«рћƒйн бћјд≈йлјм≈й т…р∆в; ејч»ше…б м»бе…а тƒъћ»дћ, ејй»о∆йд» м…а йƒоћ»щ—≈лећ.
22.english: And jackals shall howl in their castles, and wild-dogs in the pleasant palaces; and her time is near to come, and her days shall not be prolonged.

1.hebrew: ††лћƒй йјш«з≈н йјде»д а∆ъ-й«т¬ч…б, ећб»з«ш те…г бћјйƒщ“јш»а≈м, ејдƒрћƒйз»н, т«м-а«гјо»ъ»н; ејрƒмје»д д«вћ≈ш т¬м≈йд∆н, ејрƒсјфћјзећ т«м-бћ≈йъ й«т¬ч…б.
1.english: For the LORD will have compassion on Jacob, and will yet choose Israel, and set them in their own land; and the stranger shall join himself with them, and they shall cleave to the house of Jacob.

2.hebrew: ††ећмјч»зећн т«оћƒйн, е∆дЅбƒйаећн а∆м-ојче…о»н, ејдƒъјр«з¬мећн бћ≈йъ-йƒщ“јш»а≈м т«м а«гјо«ъ йјде»д, м«т¬б»гƒйн ејмƒщ—јф»зе…ъ; ејд»йећ щ—…бƒйн мјщ—…б≈йд∆н, ејш»гећ бћјр…вјщ“≈йд∆н.† {с}
2.english: And the peoples shall take them, and bring them to their place; and the house of Israel shall possess them in the land of the LORD for servants and for handmaids; and they shall take them captive, whose captives they were; and they shall rule over their oppressors. {S}

3.hebrew: ††ејд»й»д, бћјйе…н д»рƒйз« йјде»д мјк», о≈т»цјбћјк», ећоƒш»вјж∆к»--ећоƒп-д»т¬б…г»д д«чћ»щ—»д, а¬щ—∆ш тЋбћ«г-бћ»кј.
3.english: And it shall come to pass in the day that the LORD shall give thee rest from thy travail, and from thy trouble, and from the hard service wherein thou wast made to serve,

4.hebrew: ††ејр»щ“»аъ» д«оћ»щ—»м д«жћ∆д, т«м-о∆м∆кј бћ»б∆м--еја»о»шјъћ»:† а≈йкј щ—»б«ъ р…в≈щ“, щ—»бјъ»д о«гјд≈б»д.
4.english: that thou shalt take up this parable against the king of Babylon, and say: How hath the oppressor ceased! the exactress of gold ceased!

5.hebrew: ††щ—»б«ш йјде»д, о«ић≈д шјщ—»тƒйн--щ—≈б∆и, о…щ—јмƒйн.
5.english: The LORD hath broken the staff of the wicked, the sceptre of the rulers,

6.hebrew: ††о«лћ∆д т«оћƒйн бћјт∆бјш»д, о«лћ«ъ бћƒмјъћƒй с»ш»д; ш…г∆д б»а«у вће…йƒн, оЋшјгћ»у бћјмƒй з»щ“»кј.
6.english: That smote the peoples in wrath with an incessant stroke, that ruled the nations in anger, with a persecution that none restrained.

7.hebrew: ††р»з»д щ—»чји»д, лћ»м-д»а»ш∆х; фћ»цјзећ, шƒрћ»д.
7.english: The whole earth is at rest, and is quiet; they break forth into singing.

8.hebrew: ††вћ«н-бћјше…щ—ƒйн щ“»ојзећ мјк», а«шјж≈й мјб»ре…п; о≈а»ж щ—»л«бјъћ», м…а-й«т¬м∆д д«лћ…ш≈ъ т»м≈йрећ.
8.english: Yea, the cypresses rejoice at thee, and the cedars of Lebanon: 'Since thou art laid down, no feller is come up against us.'

9.hebrew: ††щ—јае…м, оƒъћ«з«ъ ш»вјж»д мјк»--мƒчјш«аъ бће…а∆к»; те…ш≈ш мјк» шјф»аƒйн, лћ»м-т«ъћећг≈й а»ш∆х--д≈чƒйн оƒлћƒсјае…ъ»н, лћ…м о«мјл≈й ве…йƒн.
9.english: The nether-world from beneath is moved for thee to meet thee at thy coming; the shades are stirred up for thee, even all the chief ones of the earth; all the kings of the nations are raised up from their thrones.

10.hebrew: ††лћЋмћ»н й«т¬рећ, ејй…аојшећ а≈м∆йк»:† вћ«н-а«ъћ»д зЋмћ≈йъ» л»ое…рећ, а≈м≈йрећ рƒојщ—»мјъћ».
10.english: All they do answer and say unto thee: 'Art thou also become weak as we? Art thou become like unto us?

11.hebrew: ††дећш«г щ—јае…м вћјае…р∆к», д∆ојй«ъ рјб»м∆йк»; ъћ«зјъћ∆йк» йЋцћ«т шƒоћ»д, ећојл«сћ∆йк» ъће…м≈т»д.
11.english: Thy pomp is brought down to the nether-world, and the noise of thy psalteries; the maggot is spread under thee, and the worms cover thee.'

12.hebrew: ††а≈йкј р»ф«мјъћ» оƒщћ—»о«йƒн, д≈йм≈м бћ∆п-щ—»з«ш; рƒвјгћ«тјъћ» м»а»ш∆х, зе…м≈щ— т«м-вће…йƒн.
12.english: How art thou fallen from heaven, O day-star, son of the morning! How art thou cut down to the ground, that didst cast lots over the nations!

13.hebrew: ††еја«ъћ»д а»о«шјъћ» бƒмјб»бјк», д«щћ—»о«йƒн а∆тЅм∆д--оƒоћ«т«м мјле…лјб≈й-а≈м, а»шƒйн лћƒсјаƒй; еја≈щ—≈б бћјд«ш-ое…т≈г, бћјй«шјлћјъ≈й ц»фе…п.
13.english: And thou saidst in thy heart: 'I will ascend into heaven, above the stars of God will I exalt my throne, and I will sit upon the mount of meeting, in the uttermost parts of the north;

14.hebrew: ††а∆тЅм∆д, т«м-бћ»о√ъ≈й т»б; а∆гћ«оћ∆д, мјт∆мјйе…п.
14.english: I will ascend above the heights of the clouds; I will be like the Most High.'

15.hebrew: ††а«кј а∆м-щ—јае…м ъћећш»г, а∆м-й«шјлћјъ≈й-бе…ш.
15.english: Yet thou shalt be brought down to the nether-world, to the uttermost parts of the pit.

16.hebrew: ††ш…а∆йк» а≈м∆йк» й«щ—јвћƒйзећ, а≈м∆йк» йƒъјбће…р»рећ:† д¬ж∆д д»аƒйщ— о«шјвћƒйж д»а»ш∆х, о«шјтƒйщ— о«ојм»ле…ъ.
16.english: They that saw thee do narrowly look upon thee, they gaze earnestly at thee: 'Is this the man that made the earth to tremble, that did shake kingdoms;

17.hebrew: ††щ“»н ъћ≈б≈м лћ«оћƒгјбћ»ш, ејт»ш»йе д»ш»с; а¬сƒйш»йе, м…а-ф»ъ«з бћ»йјъ»д.
17.english: That made the world as a wilderness, and destroyed the cities thereof; that opened not the house of his prisoners?'

18.hebrew: ††лћ»м-о«мјл≈й ве…йƒн, лћЋмћ»н--щ—»лјбећ бјл»бе…г, аƒйщ— бћјб≈йъе….
18.english: All the kings of the nations, all of them, sleep in glory, every one in his own house.

19.hebrew: ††еја«ъћ»д д»щ—јм«лјъћ» оƒчћƒбјшјк», лћјр≈ц∆ш рƒъјт»б--мјбЋщ— д¬шЋвƒйн, оји…т¬р≈й з»ш∆б; йе…шјг≈й а∆м-а«бјр≈й-бе…ш, лћјф∆в∆ш оећб»с.
19.english: But thou art cast forth away from thy grave like an abhorred offshoot, in the raiment of the slain, that are thrust through with the sword, that go down to the pavement of the pit, as a carcass trodden under foot.

20.hebrew: ††м…а-ъ≈з«г аƒъћ»н бћƒчјбећш»д, лћƒй-а«шјцјк» щ—ƒз«ъћ» т«оћјк» д»ш»вјъћ»; м…а-йƒчћ»ш≈а мјте…м»н, ж∆ш«т ојш≈тƒйн.
20.english: Thou shalt not be joined with them in burial, because thou hast destroyed thy land, thou hast slain thy people; the seed of evil-doers shall not be named for ever.

21.hebrew: ††д»лƒйрећ мјб»р»йе о«ијбћ≈з«, бћ«т¬е п а¬бе…ъ»н; бћ«м-й»чЋоећ ејй»шјщ—ећ а»ш∆х, ећо»мјаећ фјр≈й-ъ≈б≈м т»шƒйн.
21.english: Prepare ye slaughter for his children for the iniquity of their fathers; that they rise not up, and possess the earth, and fill the face of the world with cities.

22.hebrew: ††ејч«ојъћƒй т¬м≈йд∆н, рјаЋн йјде»д цјб»ае…ъ; ејдƒлјш«ъћƒй мјб»б∆м щ—≈н ећщ—ја»ш, ејрƒйп е»р∆л∆г--рјаЋн-йјде»д.
22.english: And I will rise up against them, saith the LORD of hosts, and cut off from Babylon name and remnant, and offshoot and offspring, saith the LORD.

23.hebrew: ††ејщ“«ојъћƒйд» мјое…ш«щ— чƒфћ…г, еја«вјо≈й-о»йƒн; еји≈аи≈аъƒйд» бћјо«ија¬и≈а д«щ—јо≈г, рјаЋн йјде»д цјб»ае…ъ.† {с}
23.english: I will also make it a possession for the bittern, and pools of water; and I will sweep it with the besom of destruction, saith the LORD of hosts. {S}

24.hebrew: ††рƒщ—јбћ«т йјде»д цјб»ае…ъ, м≈ао…ш:† аƒн-м…а лћ«а¬щ—∆ш гћƒоћƒйъƒй, лћ≈п д»й»ъ»д, ејл«а¬щ—∆ш й»т«цјъћƒй, дƒйа ъ»чећн.
24.english: The LORD of hosts hath sworn, saying: Surely as I have thought, so shall it come to pass; and as I have purposed, so shall it stand,

25.hebrew: ††мƒщ—јбћ…ш а«щћ—ећш бћја«шјцƒй, ејт«м-д»ш«й а¬бећс∆рћећ; ејс»ш о≈т¬м≈йд∆н, тЋмће…, ејсЋбћ√ме…, о≈т«м щ—ƒлјое… й»сећш.
25.english: That I will break Asshur in My land, and upon My mountains tread him under foot; then shall his yoke depart from off them, and his burden depart from off their shoulder.

26.hebrew: ††ж…аъ д»т≈ц»д д«йћјтећц»д, т«м-лћ»м-д»а»ш∆х; ејж…аъ д«йћ»г д«рћјиећй»д, т«м-лћ»м-д«вће…йƒн.
26.english: This is the purpose that is purposed upon the whole earth; and this is the hand that is stretched out upon all the nations.

27.hebrew: ††лћƒй-йјде»д цјб»ае…ъ й»т»х, ећоƒй й»ф≈ш; ејй»ге… д«рћјиећй»д, ећоƒй йјщ—ƒйб∆рћ»д.† {ф}
27.english: For the LORD of hosts hath purposed, and who shall disannul it? And His hand is stretched out, and who shall turn it back? {P}

28.english: In the year that king Ahaz died was this burden.

29.hebrew: ††а«м-ъћƒщ“јојзƒй фјм∆щ—∆ъ лћЋмћ≈кј, лћƒй рƒщ—јбћ«ш щ—≈б∆и о«лћ≈кј:† лћƒй-оƒщћ—…ш∆щ— р»з»щ— й≈ц≈а ц∆ф«т, ећфƒшјйе… щ“»ш»у ојте…ф≈у.
29.english: Rejoice not, O Philistia, all of thee, because the rod that smote thee is broken: for out of the serpent's root shall come forth a basilisk, and his fruit shall be a flying serpent.

30.hebrew: ††ејш»тећ бћјле…ш≈й г«мћƒйн, еја∆бјйе…рƒйн м»б∆и«з йƒшјбћ»цећ; ејд≈о«ъћƒй б»ш»т»б щ—»шјщ—≈кј, ећщ—ја≈шƒйъ≈кј й«д¬ш…в.
30.english: And the first-born of the poor shall feed, and the needy shall lie down in safety; and I will kill thy root with famine, and thy remnant shall be slain.

31.hebrew: ††д≈ймƒймƒй щ—«т«ш ж«т¬чƒй-тƒйш, р»ое…в фћјм∆щ—∆ъ лћЋмћ≈кј:† лћƒй оƒцћ»фе…п т»щ—»п бћ»а, еја≈йп бће…г≈г бћјое…т»г»йе.
31.english: Howl, O gate; cry, O city; melt away, O Philistia, all of thee; for there cometh a smoke out of the north, and there is no straggler in his ranks.

32.hebrew: ††ећо«д-йћ«т¬р∆д, о«мја¬л≈й-ве…й:† лћƒй йјде»д йƒсћ«г цƒйће…п, ећб»дћ й∆зЅсећ т¬рƒйћ≈й т«оће….† {ф}
32.english: What then shall one answer the messengers of the nation? That the LORD hath founded Zion, and in her shall the afflicted of His people take refuge. {P}

1.hebrew: מַשָּׂא, מוֹאָב:  כִּי בְּלֵיל שֻׁדַּד עָר מוֹאָב, נִדְמָה--כִּי בְּלֵיל שֻׁדַּד קִיר-מוֹאָב, נִדְמָה.
1.english: The burden of Moab. For in the night that Ar of Moab is laid waste, he is brought to ruin; for in the night that Kir of Moab is laid waste, he is brought to ruin.

2.hebrew: עָלָה הַבַּיִת וְדִיבֹן הַבָּמוֹת, לְבֶכִי:  עַל-נְבוֹ וְעַל מֵידְבָא, מוֹאָב יְיֵלִיל--בְּכָל-רֹאשָׁיו קָרְחָה, כָּל-זָקָן גְּרוּעָה.
2.english: He is gone up to Baith, and to Dibon, to the high places, to weep; upon Nebo, and upon Medeba, Moab howleth; on all their heads is baldness, every beard is shaven.

3.hebrew: בְּחוּצֹתָיו, חָגְרוּ שָׂק:  עַל גַּגּוֹתֶיהָ וּבִרְחֹבֹתֶיהָ כֻּלֹּה יְיֵלִיל, יֹרֵד בַּבֶּכִי.
3.english: In their streets they gird themselves with sackcloth; on their housetops, and in their broad places, every one howleth, weeping profusely.

4.hebrew: וַתִּזְעַק חֶשְׁבּוֹן וְאֶלְעָלֵה, עַד-יַהַץ נִשְׁמַע קוֹלָם; עַל-כֵּן, חֲלֻצֵי מוֹאָב יָרִיעוּ--נַפְשׁוֹ, יָרְעָה לּוֹ.
4.english: And Heshbon crieth out, and Elealeh; their voice is heard even unto Jahaz; therefore the armed men of Moab cry aloud; his soul is faint within him.

5.hebrew: לִבִּי, לְמוֹאָב יִזְעָק, בְּרִיחֶהָ, עַד-צֹעַר עֶגְלַת שְׁלִשִׁיָּה:  כִּי מַעֲלֵה הַלּוּחִית, בִּבְכִי יַעֲלֶה-בּוֹ--כִּי דֶּרֶךְ חוֹרֹנַיִם, זַעֲקַת-שֶׁבֶר יְעֹעֵרוּ.
5.english: My heart crieth out for Moab; her fugitives reach unto Zoar, a heifer of three years old; for by the ascent of Luhith with weeping they go up; for in the way of Horonaim they raise up a cry of destruction.

6.hebrew: כִּי-מֵי נִמְרִים, מְשַׁמּוֹת יִהְיוּ:  כִּי-יָבֵשׁ חָצִיר כָּלָה דֶשֶׁא, יֶרֶק לֹא הָיָה.
6.english: For the Waters of Nimrim shall be desolate; for the grass is withered away, the herbage faileth, there is no green thing.

7.hebrew: עַל-כֵּן, יִתְרָה עָשָׂה; וּפְקֻדָּתָם--עַל נַחַל הָעֲרָבִים, יִשָּׂאוּם.
7.english: Therefore the abundance they have gotten, and that which they have laid up, shall they carry away to the brook of the willows.

8.hebrew: כִּי-הִקִּיפָה הַזְּעָקָה, אֶת-גְּבוּל מוֹאָב, עַד-אֶגְלַיִם יִלְלָתָהּ, וּבְאֵר אֵילִים יִלְלָתָהּ.
8.english: For the cry is gone round about the borders of Moab; the howling thereof unto Eglaim, and the howling thereof unto Beer-elim.

9.hebrew: כִּי מֵי דִימוֹן מָלְאוּ דָם, כִּי-אָשִׁית עַל-דִּימוֹן נוֹסָפוֹת--לִפְלֵיטַת מוֹאָב אַרְיֵה, וְלִשְׁאֵרִית אֲדָמָה.
9.english: For the waters of Dimon are full of blood; for I will bring yet more upon Dimon, a lion upon him that escapeth of Moab, and upon the remnant of the land.

1.hebrew: שִׁלְחוּ-כַר מֹשֵׁל-אֶרֶץ, מִסֶּלַע מִדְבָּרָה, אֶל-הַר, בַּת-צִיּוֹן.
1.english: Send ye the lambs for the ruler of the land from the crags that are toward the wilderness, unto the mount of the daughter of Zion.

2.hebrew: וְהָיָה כְעוֹף-נוֹדֵד, קֵן מְשֻׁלָּח--תִּהְיֶינָה בְּנוֹת מוֹאָב, מַעְבָּרֹת לְאַרְנוֹן.
2.english: For it shall be that, as wandering birds, as a scattered nest, so shall the daughters of Moab be at the fords of Arnon.

3.hebrew: הביאו (הָבִיאִי) עֵצָה עֲשׂוּ פְלִילָה, שִׁיתִי כַלַּיִל צִלֵּךְ בְּתוֹךְ צָהֳרָיִם; סַתְּרִי, נִדָּחִים--נֹדֵד, אַל-תְּגַלִּי.
3.english: 'Give counsel, execute justice; make thy shadow as the night in the midst of the noonday; hide the outcasts; betray not the fugitive.

4.hebrew: יָגוּרוּ בָךְ נִדָּחַי, מוֹאָב הֱוִי-סֵתֶר לָמוֹ מִפְּנֵי שׁוֹדֵד:  כִּי-אָפֵס הַמֵּץ כָּלָה שֹׁד, תַּמּוּ רֹמֵס מִן-הָאָרֶץ.  {ס}
4.english: Let mine outcasts dwell with thee; as for Moab, be thou a covert to him from the face of the spoiler.' For the extortion is at an end, spoiling ceaseth, they that trampled down are consumed out of the land; {S}

5.hebrew: וְהוּכַן בַּחֶסֶד כִּסֵּא, וְיָשַׁב עָלָיו בֶּאֱמֶת בְּאֹהֶל דָּוִד; שֹׁפֵט וְדֹרֵשׁ מִשְׁפָּט, וּמְהִר צֶדֶק.
5.english: And a throne is established through mercy, and there sitteth thereon in truth, in the tent of David, one that judgeth, and seeketh justice, and is ready in righteousness.

6.hebrew: שָׁמַעְנוּ גְאוֹן-מוֹאָב, גֵּא מְאֹד:  גַּאֲוָתוֹ וּגְאוֹנוֹ וְעֶבְרָתוֹ, לֹא-כֵן בַּדָּיו.
6.english: We have heard of the pride of Moab; he is very proud; even of his haughtiness, and his pride, and his arrogancy, his ill-founded boastings.

7.hebrew: לָכֵן, יְיֵלִיל מוֹאָב לְמוֹאָב--כֻּלֹּה יְיֵלִיל:  לַאֲשִׁישֵׁי קִיר-חֲרֶשֶׂת תֶּהְגּוּ, אַךְ-נְכָאִים.
7.english: Therefore shall Moab wail for Moab, every one shall wail; for the sweet cakes of Kir-hareseth shall ye mourn, sorely stricken.

8.hebrew: כִּי שַׁדְמוֹת חֶשְׁבּוֹן אֻמְלָל גֶּפֶן שִׂבְמָה, בַּעֲלֵי גוֹיִם הָלְמוּ שְׂרוּקֶּיהָ--עַד-יַעְזֵר נָגָעוּ, תָּעוּ מִדְבָּר; שְׁלֻחוֹתֶיהָ, נִטְּשׁוּ עָבְרוּ יָם.
8.english: For the fields of Heshbon languish, and the vine of Sibmah, whose choice plants did overcome the lords of nations; they reached even unto Jazer, they wandered into the wilderness; her branches were spread abroad, they passed over the sea.

9.hebrew: עַל-כֵּן אֶבְכֶּה בִּבְכִי יַעְזֵר, גֶּפֶן שִׂבְמָה, אֲרַיָּוֶךְ דִּמְעָתִי, חֶשְׁבּוֹן וְאֶלְעָלֵה:  כִּי עַל-קֵיצֵךְ וְעַל-קְצִירֵךְ, הֵידָד נָפָל.
9.english: Therefore I will weep with the weeping of Jazer for the vine of Sibmah; I will water thee with my tears, O Heshbon, and Elealeh; for upon thy summer fruits and upon thy harvest the battle shout is fallen.

10.hebrew: וְנֶאֱסַף שִׂמְחָה וָגִיל מִן-הַכַּרְמֶל, וּבַכְּרָמִים לֹא-יְרֻנָּן לֹא יְרֹעָע; יַיִן, בַּיְקָבִים לֹא-יִדְרֹךְ הַדֹּרֵךְ--הֵידָד הִשְׁבַּתִּי.
10.english: And gladness and joy are taken away out of the fruitful field; and in the vineyards there shall be no singing, neither shall there be shouting; no treader shall tread out wine in the presses; I have made the vintage shout to cease.

11.hebrew: עַל-כֵּן מֵעַי לְמוֹאָב, כַּכִּנּוֹר יֶהֱמוּ; וְקִרְבִּי, לְקִיר חָרֶשׂ.
11.english: Wherefore my heart moaneth like a harp for Moab, and mine inward parts for Kir-heres.

12.hebrew: וְהָיָה כִי-נִרְאָה כִּי-נִלְאָה מוֹאָב, עַל-הַבָּמָה; וּבָא אֶל-מִקְדָּשׁוֹ לְהִתְפַּלֵּל, וְלֹא יוּכָל.  {ס}
12.english: And it shall come to pass, when it is seen that Moab hath wearied himself upon the high place, that he shall come to his sanctuary to pray; but he shall not prevail. {S}

13.hebrew: זֶה הַדָּבָר, אֲשֶׁר דִּבֶּר יְהוָה אֶל-מוֹאָב--מֵאָז.
13.english: This is the word that the LORD spoke concerning Moab in time past.

14.hebrew: וְעַתָּה, דִּבֶּר יְהוָה לֵאמֹר, בְּשָׁלֹשׁ שָׁנִים כִּשְׁנֵי שָׂכִיר, וְנִקְלָה כְּבוֹד מוֹאָב בְּכֹל הֶהָמוֹן הָרָב; וּשְׁאָר מְעַט מִזְעָר, לוֹא כַבִּיר.  {פ}
14.english: But now the LORD hath spoken, saying: 'Within three years, as the years of a hireling, and the glory of Moab shall wax contemptible for all his great multitude; and the remnant shall be very small and without strength.' {P}

1.hebrew: מַשָּׂא, דַּמָּשֶׂק:  הִנֵּה דַמֶּשֶׂק מוּסָר מֵעִיר, וְהָיְתָה מְעִי מַפָּלָה.
1.english: The burden of Damascus. Behold, Damascus is taken away from being a city, and it shall be a ruinous heap.

2.hebrew: עֲזֻבוֹת, עָרֵי עֲרֹעֵר; לַעֲדָרִים תִּהְיֶינָה, וְרָבְצוּ וְאֵין מַחֲרִיד.
2.english: The cities of Aroer are forsaken; they shall be for flocks, which shall lie down, and none shall make them afraid.

3.hebrew: וְנִשְׁבַּת מִבְצָר מֵאֶפְרַיִם, וּמַמְלָכָה מִדַּמֶּשֶׂק וּשְׁאָר אֲרָם; כִּכְבוֹד בְּנֵי-יִשְׂרָאֵל יִהְיוּ, נְאֻם יְהוָה צְבָאוֹת.  {פ}
3.english: The fortress also shall cease from Ephraim, and the kingdom from Damascus; and the remnant of Aram shall be as the glory of the children of Israel, saith the LORD of hosts. {P}

4.hebrew: וְהָיָה בַּיּוֹם הַהוּא, יִדַּל כְּבוֹד יַעֲקֹב; וּמִשְׁמַן בְּשָׂרוֹ, יֵרָזֶה.
4.english: And it shall come to pass in that day, that the glory of Jacob shall be made thin, and the fatness of his flesh shall wax lean.

5.hebrew: וְהָיָה, כֶּאֱסֹף קָצִיר קָמָה, וּזְרֹעוֹ, שִׁבֳּלִים יִקְצוֹר; וְהָיָה כִּמְלַקֵּט שִׁבֳּלִים, בְּעֵמֶק רְפָאִים.
5.english: And it shall be as when the harvestman gathereth the standing corn, and reapeth the ears with his arm; yea, it shall be as when one gleaneth ears in the valley of Rephaim.

6.hebrew: וְנִשְׁאַר-בּוֹ עוֹלֵלֹת כְּנֹקֶף זַיִת, שְׁנַיִם שְׁלֹשָׁה גַּרְגְּרִים בְּרֹאשׁ אָמִיר; אַרְבָּעָה חֲמִשָּׁה, בִּסְעִפֶיהָ פֹּרִיָּה--נְאֻם-יְהוָה, אֱלֹהֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל.
6.english: Yet there shall be left therein gleanings, as at the beating of an olive-tree, two or three berries in the top of the uppermost bough, four or five in the branches of the fruitful tree, saith the LORD, the God of Israel.

7.hebrew: בַּיּוֹם הַהוּא, יִשְׁעֶה הָאָדָם עַל-עֹשֵׂהוּ; וְעֵינָיו, אֶל-קְדוֹשׁ יִשְׂרָאֵל תִּרְאֶינָה.
7.english: In that day shall a man regard his Maker, and his eyes shall look to the Holy One of Israel.

8.hebrew: וְלֹא יִשְׁעֶה, אֶל-הַמִּזְבְּחוֹת מַעֲשֵׂה יָדָיו; וַאֲשֶׁר עָשׂוּ אֶצְבְּעֹתָיו לֹא יִרְאֶה, וְהָאֲשֵׁרִים וְהָחַמָּנִים.  {ס}
8.english: And he shall not regard the altars, the work of his hands, neither shall he look to that which his fingers have made, either the Asherim, or the sun-images. {S}

9.hebrew: בַּיּוֹם הַהוּא יִהְיוּ עָרֵי מָעוּזּוֹ, כַּעֲזוּבַת הַחֹרֶשׁ וְהָאָמִיר, אֲשֶׁר עָזְבוּ, מִפְּנֵי בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל; וְהָיְתָה, שְׁמָמָה.
9.english: In that day shall his strong cities be as the forsaken places, which were forsaken from before the children of Israel, after the manner of woods and lofty forests; and it shall be a desolation.

10.hebrew: כִּי שָׁכַחַתְּ אֱלֹהֵי יִשְׁעֵךְ, וְצוּר מָעֻזֵּךְ לֹא זָכָרְתְּ; עַל-כֵּן, תִּטְּעִי נִטְעֵי נַעֲמָנִים, וּזְמֹרַת זָר, תִּזְרָעֶנּוּ.
10.english: For thou hast forgotten the God of thy salvation, and thou hast not been mindful of the Rock of thy stronghold; therefore thou didst plant plants of pleasantness, and didst set it with slips of a stranger;

11.hebrew: בְּיוֹם נִטְעֵךְ תְּשַׂגְשֵׂגִי, וּבַבֹּקֶר זַרְעֵךְ תַּפְרִיחִי; נֵד קָצִיר בְּיוֹם נַחֲלָה, וּכְאֵב אָנוּשׁ.  {ס}
11.english: In the day of thy planting thou didst make it to grow, and in the morning thou didst make thy seed to blossom--a heap of boughs in the day of grief and of desperate pain. {S}

12.hebrew: הוֹי, הֲמוֹן עַמִּים רַבִּים, כַּהֲמוֹת יַמִּים, יֶהֱמָיוּן; וּשְׁאוֹן לְאֻמִּים, כִּשְׁאוֹן מַיִם כַּבִּירִים יִשָּׁאוּן.
12.english: Ah, the uproar of many peoples, that roar like the roaring of the seas; and the rushing of nations, that rush like the rushing of mighty waters!

13.hebrew: לְאֻמִּים, כִּשְׁאוֹן מַיִם רַבִּים יִשָּׁאוּן, וְגָעַר בּוֹ, וְנָס מִמֶּרְחָק; וְרֻדַּף, כְּמֹץ הָרִים לִפְנֵי-רוּחַ, וּכְגַלְגַּל, לִפְנֵי סוּפָה.
13.english: The nations shall rush like the rushing of many waters; but He shall rebuke them, and they shall flee far off, and shall be chased as the chaff of the mountains before the wind, and like the whirling dust before the storm.

14.hebrew: לְעֵת עֶרֶב וְהִנֵּה בַלָּהָה, בְּטֶרֶם בֹּקֶר אֵינֶנּוּ; זֶה חֵלֶק שׁוֹסֵינוּ, וְגוֹרָל לְבֹזְזֵינוּ.  {פ}
14.english: At eventide behold terror; and before the morning they are not. This is the portion of them that spoil us, and the lot of them that rob us. {P}

1.hebrew: הוֹי אֶרֶץ, צִלְצַל כְּנָפָיִם, אֲשֶׁר מֵעֵבֶר, לְנַהֲרֵי-כוּשׁ.
1.english: Ah, land of the buzzing of wings, which is beyond the rivers of Ethiopia;

2.hebrew: הַשֹּׁלֵחַ בַּיָּם צִירִים, וּבִכְלֵי-גֹמֶא עַל-פְּנֵי-מַיִם, לְכוּ מַלְאָכִים קַלִּים אֶל-גּוֹי מְמֻשָּׁךְ וּמוֹרָט, אֶל-עַם נוֹרָא מִן-הוּא וָהָלְאָה--גּוֹי קַו-קָו וּמְבוּסָה, אֲשֶׁר-בָּזְאוּ נְהָרִים אַרְצוֹ.
2.english: That sendeth ambassadors by the sea, even in vessels of papyrus upon the waters! Go, ye swift messengers, to a nation tall and of glossy skin, to a people terrible from their beginning onward; a nation that is sturdy and treadeth down, whose land the rivers divide!

3.hebrew: כָּל-יֹשְׁבֵי תֵבֵל, וְשֹׁכְנֵי אָרֶץ, כִּנְשֹׂא-נֵס הָרִים תִּרְאוּ, וְכִתְקֹעַ שׁוֹפָר תִּשְׁמָעוּ.  {ס}
3.english: All ye inhabitants of the world, and ye dwellers on the earth, when an ensign is lifted up on the mountains, see ye; and when the horn is blown, hear ye. {S}

4.hebrew: כִּי כֹה אָמַר יְהוָה אֵלַי, אשקוטה (אֶשְׁקֳטָה) וְאַבִּיטָה בִמְכוֹנִי, כְּחֹם צַח עֲלֵי-אוֹר, כְּעָב טַל בְּחֹם קָצִיר.
4.english: For thus hath the LORD said unto me: I will hold Me still, and I will look on in My dwelling-place, like clear heat in sunshine, like a cloud of dew in the heat of harvest.

5.hebrew: כִּי-לִפְנֵי קָצִיר כְּתָם-פֶּרַח, וּבֹסֶר גֹּמֵל יִהְיֶה נִצָּה; וְכָרַת הַזַּלְזַלִּים בַּמַּזְמֵרוֹת, וְאֶת-הַנְּטִישׁוֹת הֵסִיר הֵתַז.
5.english: For before the harvest, when the blossom is over, and the bud becometh a ripening grape, He will cut off the sprigs with pruning-hooks, and the shoots will He take away and lop off.

6.hebrew: יֵעָזְבוּ יַחְדָּו לְעֵיט הָרִים, וּלְבֶהֱמַת הָאָרֶץ; וְקָץ עָלָיו הָעַיִט, וְכָל-בֶּהֱמַת הָאָרֶץ עָלָיו תֶּחֱרָף.  {ס}
6.english: They shall be left together unto the ravenous birds of the mountains, and to the beasts of the earth; and the ravenous birds shall summer upon them, and all the beasts of the earth shall winter upon them. {S}

7.hebrew: בָּעֵת הַהִיא יוּבַל-שַׁי לַיהוָה צְבָאוֹת, עַם מְמֻשָּׁךְ וּמוֹרָט, וּמֵעַם נוֹרָא, מִן-הוּא וָהָלְאָה; גּוֹי קַו-קָו וּמְבוּסָה, אֲשֶׁר בָּזְאוּ נְהָרִים אַרְצוֹ, אֶל-מְקוֹם שֵׁם-יְהוָה צְבָאוֹת, הַר-צִיּוֹן.  {פ}
7.english: In that time shall a present be brought unto the LORD of hosts of a people tall and of glossy skin, and from a people terrible from their beginning onward; a nation that is sturdy and treadeth down, whose land the rivers divide, to the place of the name of the LORD of hosts, the mount Zion. {P}

1.hebrew: מַשָּׂא, מִצְרָיִם:  הִנֵּה יְהוָה רֹכֵב עַל-עָב קַל, וּבָא מִצְרַיִם, וְנָעוּ אֱלִילֵי מִצְרַיִם מִפָּנָיו, וּלְבַב מִצְרַיִם יִמַּס בְּקִרְבּוֹ.
1.english: The burden of Egypt. Behold, the LORD rideth upon a swift cloud, and cometh unto Egypt; and the idols of Egypt shall be moved at His presence, and the heart of Egypt shall melt within it.

2.hebrew: וְסִכְסַכְתִּי מִצְרַיִם בְּמִצְרַיִם, וְנִלְחֲמוּ אִישׁ-בְּאָחִיו וְאִישׁ בְּרֵעֵהוּ, עִיר בְּעִיר, מַמְלָכָה בְּמַמְלָכָה.
2.english: And I will spur Egypt against Egypt; and they shall fight every one against his brother, and everyone against his neighbour; city against city, and kingdom against kingdom.

3.hebrew: וְנָבְקָה רוּחַ-מִצְרַיִם בְּקִרְבּוֹ, וַעֲצָתוֹ אֲבַלֵּעַ; וְדָרְשׁוּ אֶל-הָאֱלִילִים וְאֶל-הָאִטִּים, וְאֶל-הָאֹבוֹת וְאֶל-הַיִּדְּעֹנִים.
3.english: And the spirit of Egypt shall be made empty within it; and I will make void the counsel thereof; and they shall seek unto the idols, and to the whisperers, and to the ghosts, and to the familiar spirits.

4.hebrew: וְסִכַּרְתִּי, אֶת-מִצְרַיִם, בְּיַד, אֲדֹנִים קָשֶׁה; וּמֶלֶךְ עַז יִמְשָׁל-בָּם, נְאֻם הָאָדוֹן יְהוָה צְבָאוֹת.
4.english: And I will give over the Egyptians into the hand of a cruel lord; and a fierce king shall rule over them, saith the Lord, the LORD of hosts.

5.hebrew: וְנִשְּׁתוּ-מַיִם, מֵהַיָּם; וְנָהָר, יֶחֱרַב וְיָבֵשׁ.
5.english: And the waters shall fail from the sea, and the river shall be drained dry,

6.hebrew: וְהֶאֶזְנִיחוּ נְהָרוֹת, דָּלְלוּ וְחָרְבוּ יְאֹרֵי מָצוֹר; קָנֶה וָסוּף, קָמֵלוּ.
6.english: And the rivers shall become foul; the streams of Egypt shall be minished and dried up; the reeds and flags shall wither.

7.hebrew: עָרוֹת עַל-יְאוֹר, עַל-פִּי יְאוֹר; וְכֹל מִזְרַע יְאוֹר, יִיבַשׁ נִדַּף וְאֵינֶנּוּ.
7.english: The mosses by the Nile, by the brink of the Nile, and all that is sown by the Nile, shall become dry, be driven away, and be no more.

8.hebrew: וְאָנוּ, הַדַּיָּגִים, וְאָבְלוּ, כָּל-מַשְׁלִיכֵי בַיְאוֹר חַכָּה; וּפֹרְשֵׂי מִכְמֹרֶת עַל-פְּנֵי-מַיִם, אֻמְלָלוּ.
8.english: The fishers also shall lament, and all they that cast angle into the Nile shall mourn, and they that spread nets upon the waters shall languish.

9.hebrew: וּבֹשׁוּ עֹבְדֵי פִשְׁתִּים, שְׂרִיקוֹת; וְאֹרְגִים, חוֹרָי.
9.english: Moreover they that work in combed flax, and they that weave cotton, shall be ashamed.

10.hebrew: וְהָיוּ שָׁתֹתֶיהָ, מְדֻכָּאִים; כָּל-עֹשֵׂי שֶׂכֶר, אַגְמֵי-נָפֶשׁ.
10.english: And her foundations shall be crushed, all they that make dams shall be grieved in soul.

11.hebrew: אַךְ-אֱוִלִים, שָׂרֵי צֹעַן, חַכְמֵי יֹעֲצֵי פַרְעֹה, עֵצָה נִבְעָרָה; אֵיךְ תֹּאמְרוּ אֶל-פַּרְעֹה, בֶּן-חֲכָמִים אֲנִי בֶּן-מַלְכֵי-קֶדֶם.
11.english: The princes of Zoan are utter fools; the wisest counsellors of Pharaoh are a senseless counsel; how can ye say unto Pharaoh: 'I am the son of the wise, the son of ancient kings'?

12.hebrew: אַיָּם אֵפוֹא חֲכָמֶיךָ, וְיַגִּידוּ נָא לָךְ; וְיֵדְעוּ, מַה-יָּעַץ יְהוָה צְבָאוֹת עַל-מִצְרָיִם.
12.english: Where are they, then, thy wise men? And let them tell thee now; and let them know what the LORD of hosts hath purposed concerning Egypt.

13.hebrew: נוֹאֲלוּ שָׂרֵי צֹעַן, נִשְּׁאוּ שָׂרֵי נֹף; הִתְעוּ אֶת-מִצְרַיִם, פִּנַּת שְׁבָטֶיהָ.
13.english: The princes of Zoan are become fools, the princes of Noph are deceived; they have caused Egypt to go astray, that are the corner-stone of her tribes.

14.hebrew: יְהוָה מָסַךְ בְּקִרְבָּהּ, רוּחַ עִוְעִים; וְהִתְעוּ אֶת-מִצְרַיִם בְּכָל-מַעֲשֵׂהוּ, כְּהִתָּעוֹת שִׁכּוֹר בְּקִיאוֹ.
14.english: The LORD hath mingled within her a spirit of dizziness; and they have caused Egypt to stagger in every work thereof, as a drunken man staggereth in his vomit.

15.hebrew: וְלֹא-יִהְיֶה לְמִצְרַיִם, מַעֲשֶׂה, אֲשֶׁר יַעֲשֶׂה רֹאשׁ וְזָנָב, כִּפָּה וְאַגְמוֹן.
15.english: Neither shall there be for Egypt any work, which head or tail, palm-branch or rush, may do.

16.hebrew: בַּיּוֹם הַהוּא, יִהְיֶה מִצְרַיִם כַּנָּשִׁים; וְחָרַד וּפָחַד, מִפְּנֵי תְּנוּפַת יַד-יְהוָה צְבָאוֹת, אֲשֶׁר-הוּא, מֵנִיף עָלָיו.
16.english: In that day shall Egypt be like unto women; and it shall tremble and fear because of the shaking of the hand of the LORD of hosts, which He shaketh over it.

17.hebrew: וְהָיְתָה אַדְמַת יְהוּדָה לְמִצְרַיִם, לְחָגָּא, כֹּל אֲשֶׁר יַזְכִּיר אֹתָהּ אֵלָיו, יִפְחָד--מִפְּנֵי, עֲצַת יְהוָה צְבָאוֹת, אֲשֶׁר-הוּא, יוֹעֵץ עָלָיו.  {ס}
17.english: And the land of Judah shall become a terror unto Egypt, whensoever one maketh mention thereof to it; it shall be afraid, because of the purpose of the LORD of hosts, which He purposeth against it. {S}

18.hebrew: בַּיּוֹם הַהוּא יִהְיוּ חָמֵשׁ עָרִים בְּאֶרֶץ מִצְרַיִם, מְדַבְּרוֹת שְׂפַת כְּנַעַן, וְנִשְׁבָּעוֹת, לַיהוָה צְבָאוֹת:  עִיר הַהֶרֶס, יֵאָמֵר לְאֶחָת.  {ס}
18.english: In that day there shall be five cities in the land of Egypt that speak the language of Canaan, and swear to the LORD of hosts; one shall be called the city of destruction. {S}

19.hebrew: בַּיּוֹם הַהוּא, יִהְיֶה מִזְבֵּחַ לַיהוָה, בְּתוֹךְ, אֶרֶץ מִצְרָיִם; וּמַצֵּבָה אֵצֶל-גְּבוּלָהּ, לַיהוָה.
19.english: In that day shall there be an altar to the LORD in the midst of the land of Egypt, and a pillar at the border thereof to the LORD.

20.hebrew: וְהָיָה לְאוֹת וּלְעֵד לַיהוָה צְבָאוֹת, בְּאֶרֶץ מִצְרָיִם:  כִּי-יִצְעֲקוּ אֶל-יְהוָה מִפְּנֵי לֹחֲצִים, וְיִשְׁלַח לָהֶם מוֹשִׁיעַ וָרָב וְהִצִּילָם.
20.english: And it shall be for a sign and for a witness unto the LORD of hosts in the land of Egypt; for they shall cry unto the LORD because of the oppressors, and He will send them a saviour, and a defender, who will deliver them.

21.hebrew: וְנוֹדַע יְהוָה לְמִצְרַיִם, וְיָדְעוּ מִצְרַיִם אֶת-יְהוָה בַּיּוֹם הַהוּא; וְעָבְדוּ זֶבַח וּמִנְחָה, וְנָדְרוּ-נֵדֶר לַיהוָה וְשִׁלֵּמוּ.
21.english: And the LORD shall make Himself known to Egypt, and the Egyptians shall know the LORD in that day; yea, they shall worship with sacrifice and offering, and shall vow a vow unto the LORD, and shall perform it.

22.hebrew: וְנָגַף יְהוָה אֶת-מִצְרַיִם, נָגֹף וְרָפוֹא; וְשָׁבוּ, עַד-יְהוָה, וְנֶעְתַּר לָהֶם, וּרְפָאָם.  {ס}
22.english: And the LORD will smite Egypt, smiting and healing; and they shall return unto the LORD, and He will be entreated of them, and will heal them. {S}

23.hebrew: בַּיּוֹם הַהוּא, תִּהְיֶה מְסִלָּה מִמִּצְרַיִם אַשּׁוּרָה, וּבָא-אַשּׁוּר בְּמִצְרַיִם, וּמִצְרַיִם בְּאַשּׁוּר; וְעָבְדוּ מִצְרַיִם, אֶת-אַשּׁוּר.  {ס}
23.english: In that day shall there be a highway out of Egypt to Assyria, and the Assyrian shall come into Egypt, and the Egyptian into Assyria; and the Egyptians shall worship with the Assyrians. {S}

24.hebrew: בַּיּוֹם הַהוּא, יִהְיֶה יִשְׂרָאֵל שְׁלִישִׁיָּה, לְמִצְרַיִם, וּלְאַשּׁוּר:  בְּרָכָה, בְּקֶרֶב הָאָרֶץ.
24.english: In that day shall Israel be the third with Egypt and with Assyria, a blessing in the midst of the earth;

25.hebrew: אֲשֶׁר בֵּרְכוֹ יְהוָה צְבָאוֹת, לֵאמֹר:  בָּרוּךְ עַמִּי מִצְרַיִם, וּמַעֲשֵׂה יָדַי אַשּׁוּר, וְנַחֲלָתִי, יִשְׂרָאֵל.  {ס}
25.english: for that the LORD of hosts hath blessed him, saying: 'Blessed be Egypt My people and Assyria the work of My hands, and Israel Mine inheritance.' {S}

1.hebrew: בִּשְׁנַת בֹּא תַרְתָּן, אַשְׁדּוֹדָה, בִּשְׁלֹחַ אֹתוֹ, סַרְגוֹן מֶלֶךְ אַשּׁוּר; וַיִּלָּחֶם בְּאַשְׁדּוֹד, וַיִּלְכְּדָהּ.
1.english: In the year that Tartan came into Ashdod, when Sargon the king of Assyria sent him, and he fought against Ashdod and took it;

2.hebrew: בָּעֵת הַהִיא, דִּבֶּר יְהוָה בְּיַד יְשַׁעְיָהוּ בֶן-אָמוֹץ לֵאמֹר, לֵךְ וּפִתַּחְתָּ הַשַּׂק מֵעַל מָתְנֶיךָ, וְנַעַלְךָ תַחֲלֹץ מֵעַל רַגְלֶךָ; וַיַּעַשׂ כֵּן, הָלֹךְ עָרוֹם וְיָחֵף.  {ס}
2.english: at that time the LORD spoke by Isaiah the son of Amoz, saying: 'Go, and loose the sackcloth from off thy loins, and put thy shoe from off thy foot.' And he did so, walking naked and barefoot. {S}

3.hebrew: וַיֹּאמֶר יְהוָה, כַּאֲשֶׁר הָלַךְ עַבְדִּי יְשַׁעְיָהוּ עָרוֹם וְיָחֵף--שָׁלֹשׁ שָׁנִים אוֹת וּמוֹפֵת, עַל-מִצְרַיִם וְעַל-כּוּשׁ.
3.english: And the LORD said: 'Like as My servant Isaiah hath walked naked and barefoot to be for three years a sign and a wonder upon Egypt and upon Ethiopia,

4.hebrew: כֵּן יִנְהַג מֶלֶךְ-אַשּׁוּר אֶת-שְׁבִי מִצְרַיִם וְאֶת-גָּלוּת כּוּשׁ, נְעָרִים וּזְקֵנִים--עָרוֹם וְיָחֵף; וַחֲשׂוּפַי שֵׁת, עֶרְוַת מִצְרָיִם.
4.english: so shall the king of Assyria lead away the captives of Egypt, and the exiles of Ethiopia, young and old, naked and barefoot, and with buttocks uncovered, to the shame of Egypt.

5.hebrew: וְחַתּוּ, וָבֹשׁוּ--מִכּוּשׁ, מַבָּטָם, וּמִן-מִצְרַיִם, תִּפְאַרְתָּם.
5.english: And they shall be dismayed and ashamed, because of Ethiopia their expectation, and of Egypt their glory.

6.hebrew: וְאָמַר יֹשֵׁב הָאִי הַזֶּה, בַּיּוֹם הַהוּא, הִנֵּה-כֹה מַבָּטֵנוּ אֲשֶׁר-נַסְנוּ שָׁם לְעֶזְרָה, לְהִנָּצֵל מִפְּנֵי מֶלֶךְ אַשּׁוּר; וְאֵיךְ, נִמָּלֵט אֲנָחְנוּ.  {פ}
6.english: And the inhabitant of this coast-land shall say in that day: Behold, such is our expectation, whither we fled for help to be delivered from the king of Assyria; and how shall we escape?' {P}

1.hebrew: מַשָּׂא, מִדְבַּר-יָם:  כְּסוּפוֹת בַּנֶּגֶב, לַחֲלֹף, מִמִּדְבָּר בָּא, מֵאֶרֶץ נוֹרָאָה.
1.english: The burden of the wilderness of the sea. As whirlwinds in the South sweeping on, it cometh from the wilderness, from a dreadful land.

2.hebrew: חָזוּת קָשָׁה, הֻגַּד-לִי:  הַבּוֹגֵד בּוֹגֵד, וְהַשּׁוֹדֵד שׁוֹדֵד, עֲלִי עֵילָם צוּרִי מָדַי, כָּל-אַנְחָתָה הִשְׁבַּתִּי.
2.english: A grievous vision is declared unto me: 'The treacherous dealer dealeth treacherously, and the spoiler spoileth. Go up, O Elam! besiege, O Media! All the sighing thereof have I made to cease.'

3.hebrew: עַל-כֵּן, מָלְאוּ מָתְנַי חַלְחָלָה--צִירִים אֲחָזוּנִי, כְּצִירֵי יוֹלֵדָה; נַעֲוֵיתִי מִשְּׁמֹעַ, נִבְהַלְתִּי מֵרְאוֹת.
3.english: Therefore are my loins filled with convulsion; pangs have taken hold upon me, as the pangs of a woman in travail; I am bent so that I cannot hear; I am affrighted so that I cannot see.

4.hebrew: תָּעָה לְבָבִי, פַּלָּצוּת בִּעֲתָתְנִי; אֵת נֶשֶׁף חִשְׁקִי, שָׂם לִי לַחֲרָדָה.
4.english: My heart is bewildered, terror hath overwhelmed me; the twilight that I longed for hath been turned for me into trembling.

5.hebrew: עָרֹךְ הַשֻּׁלְחָן צָפֹה הַצָּפִית, אָכוֹל שָׁתֹה; קוּמוּ הַשָּׂרִים, מִשְׁחוּ מָגֵן.  {ס}
5.english: They prepare the table, they light the lamps, they eat, they drink--'Rise up, ye princes, anoint the shield.' {S}

6.hebrew: כִּי כֹה אָמַר אֵלַי, אֲדֹנָי:  לֵךְ הַעֲמֵד הַמְצַפֶּה, אֲשֶׁר יִרְאֶה יַגִּיד.
6.english: For thus hath the Lord said unto me: Go, set a watchman; let him declare what he seeth!

7.hebrew: וְרָאָה רֶכֶב, צֶמֶד פָּרָשִׁים--רֶכֶב חֲמוֹר, רֶכֶב גָּמָל; וְהִקְשִׁיב קֶשֶׁב, רַב-קָשֶׁב.
7.english: And when he seeth a troop, horsemen by pairs, a troop of asses, a troop of camels, he shall hearken diligently with much heed.

8.hebrew: וַיִּקְרָא, אַרְיֵה--עַל-מִצְפֶּה אֲדֹנָי, אָנֹכִי עֹמֵד תָּמִיד יוֹמָם, וְעַל-מִשְׁמַרְתִּי, אָנֹכִי נִצָּב כָּל-הַלֵּילוֹת.
8.english: And he cried as a lion: 'Upon the watch-tower, O Lord, I stand continually in the daytime, and I am set in my ward all the nights.'

9.hebrew: וְהִנֵּה-זֶה בָא רֶכֶב אִישׁ, צֶמֶד פָּרָשִׁים; וַיַּעַן וַיֹּאמֶר, נָפְלָה נָפְלָה בָּבֶל, וְכָל-פְּסִילֵי אֱלֹהֶיהָ, שִׁבַּר לָאָרֶץ.
9.english: And, behold, there came a troop of men, horsemen by pairs. And he spoke and said: 'Fallen, fallen is Babylon; and all the graven images of her gods are broken unto the ground.'

10.hebrew: מְדֻשָׁתִי, וּבֶן-גָּרְנִי:  אֲשֶׁר שָׁמַעְתִּי, מֵאֵת יְהוָה צְבָאוֹת אֱלֹהֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל--הִגַּדְתִּי לָכֶם.  {פ}
10.english: O thou my threshing, and the winnowing of my floor, that which I have heard from the LORD of hosts, the God of Israel, have I declared unto you. {P}

11.hebrew: מַשָּׂא, דּוּמָה:  אֵלַי, קֹרֵא מִשֵּׂעִיר, שֹׁמֵר מַה-מִּלַּיְלָה, שֹׁמֵר מַה-מִּלֵּיל.
11.english: The burden of Dumah. One calleth unto me out of Seir: 'Watchman, what of the night? Watchman, what of the night?'

12.hebrew: אָמַר שֹׁמֵר, אָתָה בֹקֶר וְגַם-לָיְלָה; אִם-תִּבְעָיוּן בְּעָיוּ, שֻׁבוּ אֵתָיוּ.  {פ}
12.english: The watchman said: 'The morning cometh, and also the night--if ye will inquire, inquire ye; return, come.' {P}

13.hebrew: מַשָּׂא, בַּעְרָב:  בַּיַּעַר בַּעְרַב תָּלִינוּ, אֹרְחוֹת דְּדָנִים.
13.english: The burden upon Arabia. In the thickets in Arabia shall ye lodge, O ye caravans of Dedanites.

14.hebrew: לִקְרַאת צָמֵא, הֵתָיוּ מָיִם; יֹשְׁבֵי אֶרֶץ תֵּימָא, בְּלַחְמוֹ קִדְּמוּ נֹדֵד.
14.english: Unto him that is thirsty bring ye water! The inhabitants of the land of Tema did meet the fugitive with his bread.

15.hebrew: כִּי-מִפְּנֵי חֲרָבוֹת, נָדָדוּ; מִפְּנֵי חֶרֶב נְטוּשָׁה, וּמִפְּנֵי קֶשֶׁת דְּרוּכָה, וּמִפְּנֵי, כֹּבֶד מִלְחָמָה.  {ס}
15.english: For they fled away from the swords, from the drawn sword, and from the bent bow, and from the grievousness of war. {S}

16.hebrew: כִּי-כֹה אָמַר אֲדֹנָי, אֵלָי:  בְּעוֹד שָׁנָה כִּשְׁנֵי שָׂכִיר, וְכָלָה כָּל-כְּבוֹד קֵדָר.
16.english: For thus hath the Lord said unto me: 'Within a year, according to the years of a hireling, and all the glory of Kedar shall fail;

17.hebrew: וּשְׁאָר מִסְפַּר-קֶשֶׁת גִּבּוֹרֵי בְנֵי-קֵדָר, יִמְעָטוּ:  כִּי יְהוָה אֱלֹהֵי-יִשְׂרָאֵל, דִּבֵּר.  {ס}
17.english: and the residue of the number of the archers, the mighty men of the children of Kedar, shall be diminished; for the LORD, the God of Israel, hath spoken it.' {S}

2.english: Thou that art full of uproar, a tumultuous city, a joyous town? Thy slain are not slain with the sword, nor dead in battle.

3.english: All thy rulers are fled together, without the bow they are bound; all that are found of thee are bound together, they are fled afar off.

4.english: Therefore said I: 'Look away from me, I will weep bitterly; strain not to comfort me, for the destruction of the daughter of my people.'

5.english: For it is a day of trouble, and of trampling, and of perplexity, from the Lord, the GOD of hosts, in the Valley of Vision; Kir shouting, and Shoa at the mount.

6.english: And Elam bore the quiver, with troops of men, even horsemen; and Kir uncovered the shield.

7.english: And it came to pass, when thy choicest valleys were full of chariots, and the horsemen set themselves in array at the gate,

8.english: And the covering of Judah was laid bare, that thou didst look in that day to the armour in the house of the forest.

9.english: And ye saw the breaches of the city of David, that they were many; and ye gathered together the waters of the lower pool.

10.english: And ye numbered the houses of Jerusalem, and ye broke down the houses to fortify the wall;

11.hebrew: ††ећоƒчје»д т¬щ“ƒйъ∆н, бћ≈йп д«з…о…ъ«йƒн, мјо≈й, д«бћјш≈л»д д«йјщ—»р»д; ејм…а дƒбћ«ијъћ∆н а∆м-т…щ“∆йд», ејй…цјш»дћ о≈ш»зе…ч м…а шјаƒйъ∆н.
11.english: ye made also a basin between the two walls for the water of the old pool--but ye looked not unto Him that had done this, neither had ye respect unto Him that fashioned it long ago.

12.hebrew: ††е«йћƒчјш»а, а¬г…р»й йјдеƒд цјб»ае…ъ--бћ«йће…н д«дећа:† мƒбјлƒй, ећмјоƒсјфћ≈г, ећмјч»шјз»д, ејм«з¬в…ш щ“»ч.
12.english: And in that day did the Lord, the GOD of hosts, call to weeping, and to lamentation, and to baldness, and to girding with sackcloth;

13.hebrew: ††ејдƒрћ≈д щ“»щ“е…п ејщ“ƒојз»д, д»ш…в бћ»ч»ш ејщ—»з…и ц…ап, а»л…м бћ»щ“»ш, ејщ—»ъе…ъ й»йƒп; а»ле…м ејщ—»ъе…, лћƒй о»з»ш р»оећъ.
13.english: And behold joy and gladness, slaying oxen and killing sheep, eating flesh and drinking wine--'Let us eat and drink, for tomorrow we shall die!'

14.hebrew: ††ејрƒвјм»д бја»жјр»й, йјде»д цјб»ае…ъ:† аƒн-йјлЋфћ«ш д∆т»е п д«жћ∆д м»л∆н, т«г-ъћјоЋъећп, а»о«ш а¬г…р»й йјдеƒд, цјб»ае…ъ.† {ф}
14.english: And the LORD of hosts revealed Himself in mine ears: Surely this iniquity shall not be expiated by you till ye die, saith the Lord, the GOD of hosts. {P}

15.hebrew: ††лћ…д а»о«ш а¬г…р»й йјдеƒд, цјб»ае…ъ:† м∆кј-бћ…а а∆м-д«сћ…л≈п д«жћ∆д, т«м-щ—∆бјр»а а¬щ—∆ш т«м-д«бћ»йƒъ.
15.english: Thus saith the Lord, the GOD of hosts: Go, get thee unto this steward, even unto Shebna, who is over the house:

16.hebrew: ††о«д-мћјк» ф…д ећоƒй мјк» ф…д, лћƒй-з»ц«бјъћ» мћјк» фћ…д ч»б∆ш; з…цјбƒй о»ше…н чƒбјше…, з…чјчƒй б«сћ∆м«т оƒщ—јлћ»п ме….
16.english: What hast thou here, and whom hast thou here, that thou hast hewed thee out here a sepulchre, thou that hewest thee out a sepulchre on high, and gravest a habitation for thyself in the rock?

17.hebrew: ††дƒрћ≈д йјде»д оји«мји∆мјк», и«мји≈м»д вћ»б∆ш; ејт…ијк», т»и…д.
17.english: Behold, the LORD will hurl thee up and down with a man's throw; yea, He will wind thee round and round;

18.hebrew: ††ц»ре…у йƒцјр»фјк», цјр≈ф»д, лћ«гћећш, а∆м-а∆ш∆х ш«з¬б«ъ й»г»йƒн; щ—»оћ»д ъ»оећъ, ејщ—»оћ»д о«шјлћјбе…ъ лћјбе…г∆к»--чјме…п, бћ≈йъ а¬г…р∆йк».
18.english: He will violently roll and toss thee like a ball into a large country; there shalt thou die, and there shall be the chariots of thy glory, thou shame of the lord's house.

19.hebrew: ††е«д¬г«фјъћƒйк», оƒоћ«цћ»б∆к»; ећоƒоћ«т¬о»гјк», й∆д∆шјс∆к».
19.english: And I will thrust thee from thy post, and from thy station shalt thou be pulled down.

20.hebrew: ††ејд»й»д, бћ«йће…н д«дећа; ејч»ш»аъƒй мјт«бјгћƒй, мја∆мјй»чƒйн бћ∆п-зƒмјчƒйћ»дећ.
20.english: And it shall come to pass in that day, that I will call my servant Eliakim the son of Hilkiah;

21.hebrew: ††ејдƒмјбћ«щ—јъћƒйе лћЋъћ»рјъћ∆к», еја«бјр≈ијк» а¬з«жћјч∆рћећ, ећо∆ојщ—«мјъћјк», а∆ъћ≈п бћјй»ге…; ејд»й»д мја»б мјйе…щ—≈б йјшећщ—»м«ƒн, ећмјб≈йъ йјдећг»д.
21.english: And I will clothe him with thy robe, and bind him with thy girdle, and I will commit thy government into his hand; and he shall be a father to the inhabitants of Jerusalem, and to the house of Judah.

22.hebrew: ††ејр»ъ«ъћƒй о«фјъћ≈з« бћ≈йъ-гћ»еƒг, т«м-щ—ƒлјое…; ећф»ъ«з еја≈йп с…в≈ш, ејс»в«ш еја≈йп фћ…ъ≈з«.
22.english: And the key of the house of David will I lay upon his shoulder; and he shall open, and none shall shut; and he shall shut, and none shall open.

23.hebrew: ††ећъјч«тјъћƒйе й»ъ≈г, бћјо»че…н р∆аЅо»п; ејд»й»д мјлƒсћ≈а л»бе…г, мјб≈йъ а»бƒйе.
23.english: And I will fasten him as a peg in a sure place; and he shall be for a throne of honour to his father's house.

24.hebrew: ††ејъ»мећ т»м»йе лћ…м лћјбе…г бћ≈йъ-а»бƒйе, д«цћ∆аЅц»аƒйн ејд«цћјфƒте…ъ, лћ…м, лћјм≈й д«чћ»и»п--оƒлћјм≈й, д»а«вћ»ре…ъ, ејт«г, лћ»м-лћјм≈й д«рћјб»мƒйн.
24.english: And they shall hang upon him all the glory of his father's house, the offspring and the issue, all vessels of small quantity, from the vessels of cups even to all the vessels of flagons.

25.hebrew: ††бћ«йће…н д«дећа, рјаЋн йјде»д цјб»ае…ъ, ъћ»оећщ— д«йћ»ъ≈г, д«ъћјчећт»д бћјо»че…н р∆аЅо»п; ејрƒвјгћјт»д ејр»фјм»д, ејрƒлјш«ъ д«оћ«щћ“»а а¬щ—∆ш-т»м∆йд»--лћƒй йјде»д, гћƒбћ≈ш.† {ф}
25.english: In that day, saith the LORD of hosts, shall the peg that was fastened in a sure place give way; and it shall be hewn down, and fall, and the burden that was upon it shall be cut off; for the LORD hath spoken it. {P}

1.hebrew: מַשָּׂא, צֹר:  הֵילִילוּ אֳנִיּוֹת תַּרְשִׁישׁ, כִּי-שֻׁדַּד מִבַּיִת מִבּוֹא, מֵאֶרֶץ כִּתִּים, נִגְלָה-לָמוֹ.
1.english: The burden of Tyre. Howl, ye ships of Tarshish, for it is laid waste, so that there is no house, no entering in; from the land of Kittim it is revealed to them.

2.hebrew: דֹּמּוּ, יֹשְׁבֵי אִי; סֹחֵר צִידוֹן עֹבֵר יָם, מִלְאוּךְ.
2.english: Be still, ye inhabitants of the coast-land; thou whom the merchants of Zidon, that pass over the sea, have replenished.

3.hebrew: וּבְמַיִם רַבִּים זֶרַע שִׁחֹר, קְצִיר יְאוֹר תְּבוּאָתָהּ; וַתְּהִי, סְחַר גּוֹיִם.
3.english: And on great waters the seed of Shihor, the harvest of the Nile, was her revenue; and she was the mart of nations.

4.hebrew: בּוֹשִׁי צִידוֹן--כִּי-אָמַר יָם, מָעוֹז הַיָּם לֵאמֹר:  לֹא-חַלְתִּי וְלֹא-יָלַדְתִּי, וְלֹא גִדַּלְתִּי בַּחוּרִים--רוֹמַמְתִּי בְתוּלוֹת.
4.english: Be thou ashamed, O Zidon; for the sea hath spoken, the stronghold of the sea, saying: 'I have not travailed, nor brought forth, neither have I reared young men, nor brought up virgins.'

5.hebrew: כַּאֲשֶׁר-שֵׁמַע, לְמִצְרָיִם, יָחִילוּ, כְּשֵׁמַע צֹר.
5.english: When the report cometh to Egypt, they shall be sorely pained at the report of Tyre.

6.hebrew: עִבְרוּ, תַּרְשִׁישָׁה; הֵילִילוּ, יֹשְׁבֵי אִי.
6.english: Pass ye over to Tarshish; howl, ye inhabitants of the coast-land.

7.hebrew: הֲזֹאת לָכֶם, עַלִּיזָה; מִימֵי-קֶדֶם קַדְמָתָהּ יֹבִלוּהָ רַגְלֶיהָ, מֵרָחוֹק לָגוּר.
7.english: Is this your joyous city, whose feet in antiquity, in ancient days, carried her afar off to sojourn?

8.hebrew: מִי יָעַץ זֹאת, עַל-צֹר הַמַּעֲטִירָה, אֲשֶׁר סֹחֲרֶיהָ שָׂרִים, כִּנְעָנֶיהָ נִכְבַּדֵּי-אָרֶץ.
8.english: Who hath devised this against Tyre, the crowning city, whose merchants are princes, whose traffickers are the honourable of the earth?

9.hebrew: יְהוָה צְבָאוֹת, יְעָצָהּ--לְחַלֵּל גְּאוֹן כָּל-צְבִי, לְהָקֵל כָּל-נִכְבַּדֵּי-אָרֶץ.
9.english: The LORD of hosts hath devised it, to pollute the pride of all glory, to bring into contempt all the honourable of the earth.

10.hebrew: עִבְרִי אַרְצֵךְ, כַּיְאֹר; בַּת-תַּרְשִׁישׁ, אֵין מֵזַח עוֹד.
10.english: Overflow thy land as the Nile, O daughter of Tarshish! there is no girdle any more.

11.hebrew: יָדוֹ נָטָה עַל-הַיָּם, הִרְגִּיז מַמְלָכוֹת; יְהוָה צִוָּה אֶל-כְּנַעַן, לַשְׁמִד מָעֻזְנֶיהָ.
11.english: He hath stretched out His hand over the sea, He hath shaken the kingdoms; the LORD hath given commandment concerning Canaan, to destroy the strongholds thereof;

12.hebrew: וַיֹּאמֶר, לֹא-תוֹסִיפִי עוֹד לַעְלוֹז; הַמְעֻשָּׁקָה בְּתוּלַת בַּת-צִידוֹן, כתיים (כִּתִּים) קוּמִי עֲבֹרִי--גַּם-שָׁם, לֹא-יָנוּחַ לָךְ.
12.english: And He said: 'Thou shalt no more rejoice.' O thou oppressed virgin daughter of Zidon, arise, pass over to Kittim; even there shalt thou have no rest.

13.hebrew: הֵן אֶרֶץ כַּשְׂדִּים, זֶה הָעָם לֹא הָיָה--אַשּׁוּר, יְסָדָהּ לְצִיִּים; הֵקִימוּ בחיניו (בַחוּנָיו), עוֹרְרוּ אַרְמְנוֹתֶיהָ--שָׂמָהּ, לְמַפֵּלָה.
13.english: Behold, the land of the Chaldeans--this is the people that was not, when Asshur founded it for shipmen--they set up their towers, they overthrew the palaces thereof; it is made a ruin.

14.hebrew: הֵילִילוּ, אֳנִיּוֹת תַּרְשִׁישׁ:  כִּי שֻׁדַּד, מָעֻזְּכֶן.  {ס}
14.english: Howl, ye ships of Tarshish, for your stronghold is laid waste. {S}

15.hebrew: וְהָיָה, בַּיּוֹם הַהוּא, וְנִשְׁכַּחַת צֹר שִׁבְעִים שָׁנָה, כִּימֵי מֶלֶךְ אֶחָד; מִקֵּץ שִׁבְעִים שָׁנָה, יִהְיֶה לְצֹר, כְּשִׁירַת, הַזּוֹנָה.
15.english: And it shall come to pass in that day, that Tyre shall be forgotten seventy years, according to the days of one king; after the end of seventy years it shall fare with Tyre as in the song of the harlot:

16.hebrew: קְחִי כִנּוֹר סֹבִּי עִיר, זוֹנָה נִשְׁכָּחָה; הֵיטִיבִי נַגֵּן הַרְבִּי-שִׁיר, לְמַעַן תִּזָּכֵרִי.
16.english: Take a harp, go about the city, thou harlot long forgotten; make sweet melody, sing many songs, that thou mayest be remembered.

17.hebrew: וְהָיָה מִקֵּץ שִׁבְעִים שָׁנָה, יִפְקֹד יְהוָה אֶת-צֹר, וְשָׁבָה, לְאֶתְנַנָּה; וְזָנְתָה אֶת-כָּל-מַמְלְכוֹת הָאָרֶץ, עַל-פְּנֵי הָאֲדָמָה.
17.english: And it shall come to pass after the end of seventy years, that the LORD will remember Tyre, and she shall return to her hire, and shall have commerce with all the kingdoms of the world upon the face of the earth.

18.hebrew: וְהָיָה סַחְרָהּ וְאֶתְנַנָּהּ, קֹדֶשׁ לַיהוָה--לֹא יֵאָצֵר, וְלֹא יֵחָסֵן:  כִּי לַיֹּשְׁבִים לִפְנֵי יְהוָה, יִהְיֶה סַחְרָהּ, לֶאֱכֹל לְשָׂבְעָה, וְלִמְכַסֶּה עָתִיק.  {פ}
18.english: And her gain and her hire shall be holiness to the LORD; it shall not be treasured nor laid up; for her gain shall be for them that dwell before the LORD, to eat their fill, and for stately clothing. {P}

1.hebrew: הִנֵּה יְהוָה בּוֹקֵק הָאָרֶץ, וּבוֹלְקָהּ; וְעִוָּה פָנֶיהָ, וְהֵפִיץ יֹשְׁבֶיהָ.
1.english: Behold, the LORD maketh the earth empty and maketh it waste, and turneth it upside down, and scattereth abroad the inhabitants thereof.

2.hebrew: וְהָיָה כָעָם, כַּכֹּהֵן, כַּעֶבֶד כַּאדֹנָיו, כַּשִּׁפְחָה כַּגְּבִרְתָּהּ; כַּקּוֹנֶה, כַּמּוֹכֵר, כַּמַּלְוֶה כַּלֹּוֶה, כַּנֹּשֶׁה כַּאֲשֶׁר נֹשֶׁא בוֹ.
2.english: And it shall be, as with the people, so with the priest; as with the servant, so with his master; as with the maid, so with her mistress; as with the buyer, so with the seller; as with the lender, so with the borrower; as with the creditor, so with the debtor.

3.hebrew: הִבּוֹק תִּבּוֹק הָאָרֶץ, וְהִבּוֹז תִּבֹּז:  כִּי יְהוָה, דִּבֶּר אֶת-הַדָּבָר הַזֶּה.
3.english: The earth shall be utterly emptied, and clean despoiled; for the LORD hath spoken this word.

4.hebrew: אָבְלָה נָבְלָה הָאָרֶץ, אֻמְלְלָה נָבְלָה תֵּבֵל; אֻמְלָלוּ, מְרוֹם עַם-הָאָרֶץ.
4.english: The earth fainteth and fadeth away, the world faileth and fadeth away, the lofty people of the earth do fail.

5.hebrew: וְהָאָרֶץ חָנְפָה, תַּחַת יֹשְׁבֶיהָ:  כִּי-עָבְרוּ תוֹרֹת חָלְפוּ חֹק, הֵפֵרוּ בְּרִית עוֹלָם.
5.english: The earth also is defiled under the inhabitants thereof; because they have transgressed the laws, violated the statute, broken the everlasting covenant.

6.hebrew: עַל-כֵּן, אָלָה אָכְלָה אֶרֶץ, וַיֶּאְשְׁמוּ, יֹשְׁבֵי בָהּ; עַל-כֵּן, חָרוּ יֹשְׁבֵי אֶרֶץ, וְנִשְׁאַר אֱנוֹשׁ, מִזְעָר.
6.english: Therefore hath a curse devoured the earth, and they that dwell therein are found guilty; therefore the inhabitants of the earth waste away, and men are left few.

7.hebrew: אָבַל תִּירוֹשׁ, אֻמְלְלָה-גָפֶן; נֶאֶנְחוּ, כָּל-שִׂמְחֵי-לֵב.
7.english: The new wine faileth, the vine fadeth; all the merry-hearted do sigh.

8.hebrew: שָׁבַת מְשׂוֹשׂ תֻּפִּים, חָדַל שְׁאוֹן עַלִּיזִים; שָׁבַת, מְשׂוֹשׂ כִּנּוֹר.
8.english: The mirth of tabrets ceaseth, the noise of them that rejoice endeth, the joy of the harp ceaseth.

9.hebrew: בַּשִּׁיר, לֹא יִשְׁתּוּ-יָיִן; יֵמַר שֵׁכָר, לְשֹׁתָיו.
9.english: They drink not wine with a song; strong drink is bitter to them that drink it.

10.hebrew: נִשְׁבְּרָה, קִרְיַת-תֹּהוּ; סֻגַּר כָּל-בַּיִת, מִבּוֹא.
10.english: Broken down is the city of wasteness; every house is shut up, that none may come in.

11.hebrew: צְוָחָה עַל-הַיַּיִן, בַּחוּצוֹת; עָרְבָה, כָּל-שִׂמְחָה, גָּלָה, מְשׂוֹשׂ הָאָרֶץ.
11.english: There is a crying in the streets amidst the wine; all joy is darkened, the mirth of the land is gone.

12.hebrew: נִשְׁאַר בָּעִיר, שַׁמָּה; וּשְׁאִיָּה, יֻכַּת-שָׁעַר.
12.english: In the city is left desolation, and the gate is smitten unto ruin.

13.hebrew: כִּי כֹה יִהְיֶה בְּקֶרֶב הָאָרֶץ, בְּתוֹךְ הָעַמִּים, כְּנֹקֶף זַיִת, כְּעוֹלֵלֹת אִם-כָּלָה בָצִיר.
13.english: For thus shall it be in the midst of the earth, among the peoples, as at the beating of an olive-tree, as at the gleanings when the vintage is done.

14.hebrew: הֵמָּה יִשְׂאוּ קוֹלָם, יָרֹנּוּ; בִּגְאוֹן יְהוָה, צָהֲלוּ מִיָּם.
14.english: Those yonder lift up their voice, they sing for joy; for the majesty of the LORD they shout from the sea:

15.hebrew: עַל-כֵּן בָּאֻרִים, כַּבְּדוּ יְהוָה; בְּאִיֵּי הַיָּם, שֵׁם יְהוָה אֱלֹהֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל.  {ס}
15.english: 'Therefore glorify ye the LORD in the regions of light, even the name of the LORD, the God of Israel, in the isles of the sea.' {S}

16.hebrew: מִכְּנַף הָאָרֶץ זְמִרֹת שָׁמַעְנוּ, צְבִי לַצַּדִּיק, וָאֹמַר רָזִי-לִי רָזִי-לִי, אוֹי לִי; בֹּגְדִים בָּגָדוּ, וּבֶגֶד בּוֹגְדִים בָּגָדוּ.
16.english: From the uttermost part of the earth have we heard songs: 'Glory to the righteous.' But I say: I waste away, I waste away, woe is me! The treacherous deal treacherously; yea, the treacherous deal very treacherously.

17.hebrew: פַּחַד וָפַחַת, וָפָח; עָלֶיךָ, יוֹשֵׁב הָאָרֶץ.
17.english: Terror, and the pit, and the trap, are upon thee, O inhabitant of the earth.

18.hebrew: וְהָיָה הַנָּס מִקּוֹל הַפַּחַד, יִפֹּל אֶל-הַפַּחַת, וְהָעוֹלֶה מִתּוֹךְ הַפַּחַת, יִלָּכֵד בַּפָּח:  כִּי-אֲרֻבּוֹת מִמָּרוֹם נִפְתָּחוּ, וַיִּרְעֲשׁוּ מוֹסְדֵי אָרֶץ.
18.english: And it shall come to pass, that he who fleeth from the noise of the terror shall fall into the pit; and he that cometh up out of the midst of the pit shall be taken in the trap; for the windows on high are opened, and the foundations of the earth do shake;

19.hebrew: רֹעָה הִתְרֹעֲעָה, הָאָרֶץ; פּוֹר הִתְפּוֹרְרָה אֶרֶץ, מוֹט הִתְמוֹטְטָה אָרֶץ.
19.english: The earth is broken, broken down, the earth is crumbled in pieces, the earth trembleth and tottereth;

20.hebrew: נוֹעַ תָּנוּעַ אֶרֶץ כַּשִּׁכּוֹר, וְהִתְנוֹדְדָה כַּמְּלוּנָה; וְכָבַד עָלֶיהָ פִּשְׁעָהּ, וְנָפְלָה וְלֹא-תֹסִיף קוּם.  {ס}
20.english: The earth reeleth to and fro like a drunken man, and swayeth to and fro as a lodge; and the transgression thereof is heavy upon it, and it shall fall, and not rise again. {S}

21.hebrew: וְהָיָה בַּיּוֹם הַהוּא, יִפְקֹד יְהוָה עַל-צְבָא הַמָּרוֹם בַּמָּרוֹם; וְעַל-מַלְכֵי הָאֲדָמָה, עַל-הָאֲדָמָה.
21.english: And it shall come to pass in that day, that the LORD will punish the host of the high heaven on high, and the kings of the earth upon the earth.

22.hebrew: וְאֻסְּפוּ אֲסֵפָה אַסִּיר עַל-בּוֹר, וְסֻגְּרוּ עַל-מַסְגֵּר; וּמֵרֹב יָמִים, יִפָּקֵדוּ.
22.english: And they shall be gathered together, as prisoners are gathered in the dungeon, and shall be shut up in the prison, and after many days shall they be punished.

23.hebrew: וְחָפְרָה הַלְּבָנָה, וּבוֹשָׁה הַחַמָּה:  כִּי-מָלַךְ יְהוָה צְבָאוֹת, בְּהַר צִיּוֹן וּבִירוּשָׁלִַם, וְנֶגֶד זְקֵנָיו, כָּבוֹד.  {פ}
23.english: Then the moon shall be confounded, and the sun ashamed; for the LORD of hosts will reign in mount Zion, and in Jerusalem, and before His elders shall be Glory. {P}

1.hebrew: יְהוָה אֱלֹהַי, אַתָּה--אֲרוֹמִמְךָ אוֹדֶה שִׁמְךָ, כִּי עָשִׂיתָ פֶּלֶא:  עֵצוֹת מֵרָחֹק, אֱמוּנָה אֹמֶן.
1.english: O LORD, Thou art my God, I will exalt Thee, I will praise Thy name, for Thou hast done wonderful things; even counsels of old, in faithfulness and truth.

2.hebrew: כִּי שַׂמְתָּ מֵעִיר לַגָּל, קִרְיָה בְצוּרָה לְמַפֵּלָה; אַרְמוֹן זָרִים מֵעִיר, לְעוֹלָם לֹא יִבָּנֶה.
2.english: For Thou hast made of a city a heap, of a fortified city a ruin; a castle of strangers to be no city, it shall never be built.

3.hebrew: עַל-כֵּן, יְכַבְּדוּךָ עַם-עָז; קִרְיַת גּוֹיִם עָרִיצִים, יִירָאוּךָ.
3.english: Therefore shall the strong people glorify Thee, the city of the terrible nations shall fear Thee.

4.hebrew: כִּי-הָיִיתָ מָעוֹז לַדָּל מָעוֹז לָאֶבְיוֹן, בַּצַּר-לוֹ:  מַחְסֶה מִזֶּרֶם צֵל מֵחֹרֶב, כִּי רוּחַ עָרִיצִים כְּזֶרֶם קִיר.
4.english: For Thou hast been a stronghold to the poor, a stronghold to the needy in his distress, a refuge from the storm, a shadow from the heat; for the blast of the terrible ones was as a storm against the wall.

5.hebrew: כְּחֹרֶב בְּצָיוֹן, שְׁאוֹן זָרִים תַּכְנִיעַ; חֹרֶב בְּצֵל עָב, זְמִיר עָרִיצִים יַעֲנֶה.  {פ}
5.english: As the heat in a dry place, Thou didst subdue the noise of strangers; as the heat by the shadow of a cloud, the song of the terrible ones was brought low. {P}

6.hebrew: וְעָשָׂה יְהוָה צְבָאוֹת לְכָל-הָעַמִּים, בָּהָר הַזֶּה, מִשְׁתֵּה שְׁמָנִים, מִשְׁתֵּה שְׁמָרִים:  שְׁמָנִים, מְמֻחָיִם, שְׁמָרִים, מְזֻקָּקִים.
6.english: And in this mountain will the LORD of hosts make unto all peoples a feast of fat things, a feast of wines on the lees, of fat things full of marrow, of wines on the lees well refined.

7.hebrew: וּבִלַּע בָּהָר הַזֶּה, פְּנֵי-הַלּוֹט הַלּוֹט עַל-כָּל-הָעַמִּים; וְהַמַּסֵּכָה הַנְּסוּכָה, עַל-כָּל-הַגּוֹיִם.
7.english: And He will destroy in this mountain the face of the covering that is cast over all peoples, and the veil that is spread over all nations.

8.hebrew: בִּלַּע הַמָּוֶת לָנֶצַח, וּמָחָה אֲדֹנָי יְהוִה דִּמְעָה מֵעַל כָּל-פָּנִים; וְחֶרְפַּת עַמּוֹ, יָסִיר מֵעַל כָּל-הָאָרֶץ--כִּי יְהוָה, דִּבֵּר.  {פ}
8.english: He will swallow up death for ever; and the Lord GOD will wipe away tears from off all faces; and the reproach of His people will He take away from off all the earth; for the LORD hath spoken it. {P}

9.hebrew: וְאָמַר בַּיּוֹם הַהוּא, הִנֵּה אֱלֹהֵינוּ זֶה קִוִּינוּ לוֹ וְיוֹשִׁיעֵנוּ; זֶה יְהוָה קִוִּינוּ לוֹ, נָגִילָה וְנִשְׂמְחָה בִּישׁוּעָתוֹ.
9.english: And it shall be said in that day: 'Lo, this is our God, for whom we waited, that He might save us; this is the LORD, for whom we waited, we will be glad and rejoice in His salvation.'

10.hebrew: כִּי-תָנוּחַ יַד-יְהוָה, בָּהָר הַזֶּה--וְנָדוֹשׁ מוֹאָב תַּחְתָּיו, כְּהִדּוּשׁ מַתְבֵּן במי (בְּמוֹ) מַדְמֵנָה.
10.english: For in this mountain will the hand of the LORD rest, and Moab shall be trodden down in his place, even as straw is trodden down in the dunghill.

11.hebrew: וּפֵרַשׂ יָדָיו בְּקִרְבּוֹ, כַּאֲשֶׁר יְפָרֵשׂ הַשֹּׂחֶה לִשְׂחוֹת; וְהִשְׁפִּיל, גַּאֲוָתוֹ, עִם, אָרְבּוֹת יָדָיו.
11.english: And when he shall spread forth his hands in the midst thereof, as he that swimmeth spreadeth forth his hands to swim, his pride shall be brought down together with the cunning of his hands.

12.hebrew: וּמִבְצַר מִשְׂגַּב חוֹמֹתֶיךָ, הֵשַׁח הִשְׁפִּיל הִגִּיעַ לָאָרֶץ--עַד-עָפָר.  {ס}
12.english: And the high fortress of thy walls will He bring down, lay low, and bring to the ground, even to the dust. {S}

1.hebrew: ††бћ«йће…н д«дећа, йећщ—«ш д«щћ—ƒйш-д«жћ∆д бћја∆ш∆х йјдећг»д; тƒйш т»ж-м»рећ, йјщ—ећт»д й»щ—ƒйъ зе…ое…ъ е»з≈м.

8.english: Yea, in the way of Thy judgments, O LORD, have we waited for Thee; to Thy name and to Thy memorial is the desire of our soul.

9.english: With my soul have I desired Thee in the night; yea, with my spirit within me have I sought Thee earnestly; for when Thy judgments are in the earth, the inhabitants of the world learn righteousness.

10.hebrew: ††йЋз«п ш»щ—»т бћ«м-м»о«г ц∆г∆ч, бћја∆ш∆х рјл…зе…ъ йјт«ећ≈м; ећб«м-йƒшја∆д, вћ≈аећъ йјде»д.† {ф}
10.english: Let favour be shown to the wicked, yet will he not learn righteousness; in the land of uprightness will he deal wrongfully, and will not behold the majesty of the LORD. {P}

11.hebrew: ††йјде»д ш»о»д й»гјк», бћ«м-й∆зЅж»йећп:† й∆зЅжећ ејй≈б…щ—ећ чƒрја«ъ-т»н, а«у-а≈щ— ц»ш∆йк» ъ…алјм≈н.† {с}
11.english: LORD, Thy hand was lifted up, yet they see not; they shall see with shame Thy zeal for the people; yea, fire shall devour Thine adversaries. {S}

12.hebrew: ††йјде»д, ъћƒщ—јфћ…ъ щ—»ме…н м»рећ:† лћƒй вћ«н лћ»м-о«т¬щ“≈йрећ, фћ»т«мјъћ» мћ»рећ.† {с}
12.english: LORD, Thou wilt establish peace for us; for Thou hast indeed wrought all our works for us. {S}

13.hebrew: ††йјде»д аЅм…д≈йрећ, бћјт»мећрећ а¬г…рƒйн жећм»ъ∆к»; мјб«г-бћјк», р«жјлћƒйш щ—јо∆к».
13.english: O LORD our God, other lords beside Thee have had dominion over us; but by Thee only do we make mention of Thy name.
