14.english: The dead live not, the shades rise not; to that end hast Thou punished and destroyed them, and made all their memory to perish.

15.hebrew: ††й»с«фјъћ» м«вће…й йјде»д, й»с«фјъћ» м«вће…й рƒлјбћ»гјъћ»; шƒз«чјъћ», лћ»м-ч«цје≈й-а»ш∆х.† {ф}
15.english: Thou hast gotten Thee honour with the nations, O LORD, yea, exceeding great honour with the nations; Thou art honoured unto the farthest ends of the earth. {P}

16.hebrew: ††йјде»д, бћ«цћ«ш фћјч»гећк»; ц»чећп м«з«щ—, оећс»шјк» м»ое….
16.english: LORD, in trouble have they sought Thee, silently they poured out a prayer when Thy chastening was upon them.

17.hebrew: ††лћјое… д»ш»д ъћ«чјшƒйб м»м∆г∆ъ, ъћ»зƒйм ъћƒжјт«ч бћ«з¬б»м∆йд»--лћ≈п д»йƒйрећ оƒфћ»р∆йк», йјде»д.
17.english: Like as a woman with child, that draweth near the time of her delivery, is in pain and crieth out in her pangs; so have we been at Thy presence, O LORD.

18.hebrew: ††д»шƒйрећ з«мјрећ, лћјое… й»м«гјрећ шећз«; йјщ—ећт…ъ бћ«м-р«т¬щ“∆д а∆ш∆х, ећб«м-йƒфћјмећ й…щ—јб≈й ъ≈б≈м.
18.english: We have been with child, we have been in pain, we have as it were brought forth wind; we have not wrought any deliverance in the land; neither are the inhabitants of the world come to life.

19.hebrew: ††йƒзјйећ о≈ъ∆йк», рјб≈м»ъƒй йјчећоећп; д»чƒйцећ ејш«рћјрећ щ—…лјр≈й т»ф»ш, лћƒй и«м ае…ш…ъ и«мћ∆к», е»а»ш∆х, шјф»аƒйн ъћ«фћƒйм.† {ф}
19.english: Thy dead shall live, my dead bodies shall arise--awake and sing, ye that dwell in the dust--for Thy dew is as the dew of light, and the earth shall bring to life the shades. {P}

20.hebrew: ††м≈кј т«оћƒй бћ…а б«з¬г»ш∆йк», ећсјв…ш гмъйк (гћјм»ъјк») бћ«т¬г∆к»; з¬бƒй лƒојт«и-ш∆в«т, т«г-йтбеш- (й«т¬б»ш-) ж»т«н.
20.english: Come, my people, enter thou into thy chambers, and shut thy doors about thee; hide thyself for a little moment, until the indignation be overpast.

21.hebrew: ††лћƒй-дƒрћ≈д йјде»д й…ц≈а оƒоћјче…ое…, мƒфјч…г т¬е п й…щ—≈б-д»а»ш∆х т»м»йе; ејвƒмћјъ»д д»а»ш∆х а∆ъ-гћ»о∆йд», ејм…а-ъјл«сћ∆д те…г т«м-д¬шећв∆йд».† {ф}
21.english: For, behold, the LORD cometh forth out of His place to visit upon the inhabitants of the earth their iniquity; the earth also shall disclose her blood, and shall no more cover her slain. {P}

1.hebrew: ††бћ«йће…н д«дећа йƒфјч…г йјде»д бћјз«шјбће… д«чћ»щ—»д ејд«вћјге…м»д ејд«з¬ж»ч»д, т«м мƒејй»ъ»п р»з»щ— бћ»шƒз«, ејт«м мƒејй»ъ»п, р»з»щ— т¬ч«мћ»ъе…п; ејд»ш«в а∆ъ-д«ъћ«рћƒйп, а¬щ—∆ш бћ«йћ»н.† {с}
1.english: In that day the LORD with His sore and great and strong sword will punish leviathan the slant serpent, and leviathan the tortuous serpent; and He will slay the dragon that is in the sea. {S}

2.hebrew: ††бћ«йће…н, д«дећа, лћ∆ш∆н з∆о∆ш, т«рћећ-м»дћ.
2.english: In that day sing ye of her: 'A vineyard of foaming wine!'

3.hebrew: ††а¬рƒй йјде»д р…цјш»дћ, мƒшјв»тƒйн а«щ—јч∆рћ»д:† фћ∆п йƒфјч…г т»м∆йд», м«йјм»д е»йе…н а∆цћ√ш∆рћ»д.
3.english: I the LORD do guard it, I water it every moment; lest Mine anger visit it, I guard it night and day.

4.hebrew: ††з≈о»д, а≈йп мƒй:† оƒй-йƒъћјр≈рƒй щ—»оƒйш щ—«йƒъ, бћ«оћƒмјз»о»д--а∆фјщ“јт»д б»дћ, а¬цƒйъ∆рћ»д йћ»з«г.
4.english: Fury is not in Me; would that I were as the briers and thorns in flame! I would with one step burn it altogether.

5.hebrew: ††ае… й«з¬ж≈ч бћјо»тећжћƒй, й«т¬щ“∆д щ—»ме…н мƒй; щ—»ме…н, й«т¬щ“∆д-мћƒй.
5.english: Or else let him take hold of My strength, that he may make peace with Me; yea, let him make peace with Me.

6.hebrew: ††д«бћ»аƒйн й«щ—јш≈щ— й«т¬ч…б, й»цƒйх ећф»ш«з йƒщ“јш»а≈м; ећо»мјаећ фјр≈й-ъ≈б≈м, ъћјрећб»д.† {ф}
6.english: In days to come shall Jacob take root, Israel shall blossom and bud; and the face of the world shall be filled with fruitage. {P}

7.hebrew: ††д«лћјо«лћ«ъ о«лћ≈дећ, дƒлћ»дећ:† аƒн-лћјд∆ш∆в д¬шЋв»йе, д…ш»в.
7.english: Hath He smitten him as He smote those that smote him? Or is he slain according to the slaughter of them that were slain by Him?

8.hebrew: ††бћјс«асћја»д, бћјщ—«мјз»дћ ъћјшƒйб∆рћ»д; д»в»д бћјшећзе… д«чћ»щ—»д, бћјйе…н ч»гƒйн.
8.english: In full measure, when Thou sendest her away, Thou dost contend with her; He hath removed her with His rough blast in the day of the east wind.

9.hebrew: ††м»л≈п, бћјж…аъ йјлЋфћ«ш т¬е п-й«т¬ч…б, ејж∆д, лћ»м-фћјшƒй д»сƒш з«ић»аъе…:† бћјщ“ећое… лћ»м-а«бјр≈й оƒжјбћ≈з«, лћја«бјр≈й-вƒш ојрЋфћ»це…ъ, м…а-й»чЋоећ а¬щ—≈шƒйн, ејз«оћ»рƒйн.
9.english: Therefore by this shall the iniquity of Jacob be expiated, and this is all the fruit of taking away his sin: when he maketh all the stones of the altar as chalkstones that are beaten in pieces, so that the Asherim and the sun-images shall rise no more.

10.hebrew: ††лћƒй тƒйш бћјцећш»д, бћ»г»г, р»е∆д, ојщ—Ћмћ»з ејр∆тЅж»б лћ«оћƒгјбћ»ш; щ—»н йƒшјт∆д т≈в∆м ејщ—»н йƒшјбћ»х, ејлƒмћ»д сјтƒф∆йд».
10.english: For the fortified city is solitary, a habitation abandoned and forsaken, like the wilderness; there shall the calf feed, and there shall he lie down, and consume the branches thereof.

11.hebrew: ††бћƒйб…щ— чјцƒйш»дћ, ъћƒщћ—»б«шјр»д, р»щ—ƒйн, бћ»ае…ъ ојаƒйше…ъ ае…ъ»дћ:† лћƒй м…а т«н-бћƒйре…ъ, дећа--т«м-лћ≈п м…а-йјш«з¬о∆рћећ т…щ“≈дећ, ејй…цјше… м…а йјзЋрћ∆рћећ.† {ф}
11.english: When the boughs thereof are withered, they shall be broken off; the women shall come, and set them on fire; for it is a people of no understanding; therefore He that made them will not have compassion upon them, and He that formed them will not be gracious unto them. {P}

12.hebrew: ††ејд»й»д бћ«йће…н д«дећа, й«зјбћ…и йјде»д оƒщћ—ƒбћ…м∆ъ д«рћ»д»ш т«г-р«з«м оƒцјш»йƒн; еја«ъћ∆н ъћјмЋчћјиећ мја«з«г а∆з»г, бћјр≈й йƒщ“јш»а≈м.† {ф}
12.english: And it shall come to pass in that day, that the LORD will beat off [His fruit] from the flood of the River unto the Brook of Egypt, and ye shall be gathered one by one, O ye children of Israel. {P}

13.hebrew: ††ејд»й»д бћ«йће…н д«дећа, йƒъћ»ч«т бћјщ—е…ф»ш вћ»ге…м, ећб»аећ д»а…бјгƒйн бћја∆ш∆х а«щћ—ећш, ејд«рћƒгћ»зƒйн бћја∆ш∆х оƒцјш»йƒн; ејдƒщ—јъћ«з¬еећ м«йде»д бћјд«ш д«чћ…г∆щ—, бћƒйшећщ—»м»ƒн.† {ф}
13.english: And it shall come to pass in that day, that a great horn shall be blown; and they shall come that were lost in the land of Assyria, and they that were dispersed in the land of Egypt; and they shall worship the LORD in the holy mountain at Jerusalem. {P}

1.hebrew: הוֹי, עֲטֶרֶת גֵּאוּת שִׁכֹּרֵי אֶפְרַיִם, וְצִיץ נֹבֵל, צְבִי תִפְאַרְתּוֹ--אֲשֶׁר עַל-רֹאשׁ גֵּיא-שְׁמָנִים, הֲלוּמֵי יָיִן.
1.english: Woe to the crown of pride of the drunkards of Ephraim, and to the fading flower of his glorious beauty, which is on the head of the fat valley of them that are smitten down with wine!

2.hebrew: הִנֵּה חָזָק וְאַמִּץ לַאדֹנָי, כְּזֶרֶם בָּרָד שַׂעַר קָטֶב; כְּזֶרֶם מַיִם כַּבִּירִים שֹׁטְפִים, הִנִּיחַ לָאָרֶץ--בְּיָד.
2.english: Behold, the Lord hath a mighty and strong one, as a storm of hail, a tempest of destruction, as a storm of mighty waters overflowing, that casteth down to the earth with violence.

3.hebrew: בְּרַגְלַיִם, תֵּרָמַסְנָה; עֲטֶרֶת גֵּאוּת, שִׁכּוֹרֵי אֶפְרָיִם.
3.english: The crown of pride of the drunkards of Ephraim shall be trodden under foot;

4.hebrew: וְהָיְתָה צִיצַת נֹבֵל, צְבִי תִפְאַרְתּוֹ, אֲשֶׁר עַל-רֹאשׁ, גֵּיא שְׁמָנִים--כְּבִכּוּרָהּ, בְּטֶרֶם קַיִץ, אֲשֶׁר יִרְאֶה הָרֹאֶה אוֹתָהּ, בְּעוֹדָהּ בְּכַפּוֹ יִבְלָעֶנָּה.  {ס}
4.english: And the fading flower of his glorious beauty, which is on the head of the fat valley, shall be as the first-ripe fig before the summer, which when one looketh upon it, while it is yet in his hand he eateth it up. {S}

5.hebrew: בַּיּוֹם הַהוּא, יִהְיֶה יְהוָה צְבָאוֹת, לַעֲטֶרֶת צְבִי, וְלִצְפִירַת תִּפְאָרָה--לִשְׁאָר, עַמּוֹ.
5.english: In that day shall the LORD of hosts be for a crown of glory, and for a diadem of beauty, unto the residue of His people;

6.hebrew: וּלְרוּחַ, מִשְׁפָּט--לַיּוֹשֵׁב, עַל-הַמִּשְׁפָּט, וְלִגְבוּרָה, מְשִׁיבֵי מִלְחָמָה שָׁעְרָה.  {ס}
6.english: And for a spirit of judgment to him that sitteth in judgment, and for strength to them that turn back the battle at the gate. {S}

7.hebrew: וְגַם-אֵלֶּה בַּיַּיִן שָׁגוּ, וּבַשֵּׁכָר תָּעוּ:  כֹּהֵן וְנָבִיא שָׁגוּ בַשֵּׁכָר נִבְלְעוּ מִן-הַיַּיִן, תָּעוּ מִן-הַשֵּׁכָר, שָׁגוּ בָּרֹאֶה, פָּקוּ פְּלִילִיָּה.
7.english: But these also reel through wine, and stagger through strong drink; the priest and the prophet reel through strong drink, they are confused because of wine, they stagger because of strong drink; they reel in vision, they totter in judgment.

8.hebrew: כִּי כָּל-שֻׁלְחָנוֹת, מָלְאוּ קִיא צֹאָה, בְּלִי, מָקוֹם.  {פ}
8.english: For all tables are full of filthy vomit, and no place is clean. {P}

9.hebrew: אֶת-מִי יוֹרֶה דֵעָה, וְאֶת-מִי יָבִין שְׁמוּעָה--גְּמוּלֵי, מֵחָלָב, עַתִּיקֵי, מִשָּׁדָיִם.
9.english: Whom shall one teach knowledge? And whom shall one make to understand the message? Them that are weaned from the milk, them that are drawn from the breasts?

10.hebrew: כִּי צַו לָצָו צַו לָצָו, קַו לָקָו קַו לָקָו--זְעֵיר שָׁם, זְעֵיר שָׁם.
10.english: For it is precept by precept, precept by precept, line by line, line by line; here a little, there a little.

11.hebrew: כִּי בְּלַעֲגֵי שָׂפָה, וּבְלָשׁוֹן אַחֶרֶת, יְדַבֵּר, אֶל-הָעָם הַזֶּה.
11.english: For with stammering lips and with a strange tongue shall it be spoken to this people;

12.hebrew: אֲשֶׁר אָמַר אֲלֵיהֶם, זֹאת הַמְּנוּחָה הָנִיחוּ לֶעָיֵף, וְזֹאת, הַמַּרְגֵּעָה; וְלֹא אָבוּא, שְׁמוֹעַ.
12.english: To whom it was said: 'This is the rest, give ye rest to the weary; and this is the refreshing'; yet they would not hear.

13.hebrew: וְהָיָה לָהֶם דְּבַר-יְהוָה, צַו לָצָו צַו לָצָו קַו לָקָו קַו לָקָו, זְעֵיר שָׁם, זְעֵיר שָׁם--לְמַעַן יֵלְכוּ וְכָשְׁלוּ אָחוֹר, וְנִשְׁבָּרוּ, וְנוֹקְשׁוּ, וְנִלְכָּדוּ.  {פ}
13.english: And so the word of the LORD is unto them precept by precept, precept by precept, line by line, line by line; here a little, there a little; that they may go, and fall backward, and be broken, and snared, and taken. {P}

14.hebrew: לָכֵן שִׁמְעוּ דְבַר-יְהוָה, אַנְשֵׁי לָצוֹן--מֹשְׁלֵי הָעָם הַזֶּה, אֲשֶׁר בִּירוּשָׁלִָם.
14.english: Wherefore hear the word of the LORD, ye scoffers, the ballad-mongers of this people which is in Jerusalem:

15.hebrew: כִּי אֲמַרְתֶּם, כָּרַתְנוּ בְרִית אֶת-מָוֶת, וְעִם-שְׁאוֹל, עָשִׂינוּ חֹזֶה; שיט (שׁוֹט) שׁוֹטֵף כִּי-עבר (יַעֲבֹר) לֹא יְבוֹאֵנוּ, כִּי שַׂמְנוּ כָזָב מַחְסֵנוּ וּבַשֶּׁקֶר נִסְתָּרְנוּ.  {פ}
15.english: Because ye have said: 'We have made a covenant with death, and with the nether-world are we at agreement; when the scouring scourge shall pass through, it shall not come unto us; for we have made lies our refuge, and in falsehood have we hid ourselves'; {P}

16.hebrew: לָכֵן, כֹּה אָמַר אֲדֹנָי יְהוִה, הִנְנִי יִסַּד בְּצִיּוֹן, אָבֶן; אֶבֶן בֹּחַן פִּנַּת יִקְרַת, מוּסָד מוּסָּד--הַמַּאֲמִין, לֹא יָחִישׁ.
16.english: Therefore thus saith the Lord GOD: Behold, I lay in Zion for a foundation a stone, a tried stone, a costly corner-stone of sure foundation; he that believeth shall not make haste.

17.hebrew: וְשַׂמְתִּי מִשְׁפָּט לְקָו, וּצְדָקָה לְמִשְׁקָלֶת; וְיָעָה בָרָד מַחְסֵה כָזָב, וְסֵתֶר מַיִם יִשְׁטֹפוּ.  {ס}
17.english: And I will make justice the line, and righteousness the plummet; and the hail shall sweep away the refuge of lies, and the waters shall overflow the hiding-place. {S}

18.hebrew: וְכֻפַּר בְּרִיתְכֶם אֶת-מָוֶת, וְחָזוּתְכֶם אֶת-שְׁאוֹל לֹא תָקוּם; שׁוֹט שׁוֹטֵף כִּי יַעֲבֹר, וִהְיִיתֶם לוֹ לְמִרְמָס.
18.english: And your covenant with death shall be disannulled and your agreement with the nether-world shall not stand; when the scouring scourge shall pass through, then ye shall be trodden down by it,

19.hebrew: מִדֵּי עָבְרוֹ יִקַּח אֶתְכֶם, כִּי-בַבֹּקֶר בַּבֹּקֶר יַעֲבֹר בַּיּוֹם וּבַלָּיְלָה; וְהָיָה רַק-זְוָעָה, הָבִין שְׁמוּעָה.
19.english: As often as it passeth through, it shall take you; for morning by morning shall it pass through, by day and by night; and it shall be sheer terror to understand the message.

20.hebrew: כִּי-קָצַר הַמַּצָּע, מֵהִשְׂתָּרֵעַ; וְהַמַּסֵּכָה צָרָה, כְּהִתְכַּנֵּס.
20.english: For the bed is too short for a man to stretch himself; and the covering too narrow when he gathereth himself up.

21.hebrew: כִּי כְהַר-פְּרָצִים יָקוּם יְהוָה, כְּעֵמֶק בְּגִבְעוֹן יִרְגָּז--לַעֲשׂוֹת מַעֲשֵׂהוּ, זָר מַעֲשֵׂהוּ, וְלַעֲבֹד עֲבֹדָתוֹ, נָכְרִיָּה עֲבֹדָתוֹ.
21.english: For the LORD will rise up as in mount Perazim, He will be wroth as in the valley of Gibeon; that He may do His work, strange is His work, and bring to pass His act, strange is His act.

22.hebrew: וְעַתָּה, אַל-תִּתְלוֹצָצוּ, פֶּן-יֶחְזְקוּ, מוֹסְרֵיכֶם:  כִּי-כָלָה וְנֶחֱרָצָה שָׁמַעְתִּי, מֵאֵת אֲדֹנָי יְהוִה צְבָאוֹת--עַל-כָּל-הָאָרֶץ.  {פ}
22.english: Now therefore be ye not scoffers, lest your bands be made strong; for an extermination wholly determined have I heard from the Lord, the GOD of hosts, upon the whole land. {P}

23.hebrew: הַאֲזִינוּ וְשִׁמְעוּ, קוֹלִי; הַקְשִׁיבוּ וְשִׁמְעוּ, אִמְרָתִי.
23.english: Give ye ear, and hear my voice; attend, and hear my speech.

24.hebrew: הֲכֹל הַיּוֹם, יַחֲרֹשׁ הַחֹרֵשׁ לִזְרֹעַ; יְפַתַּח וִישַׂדֵּד, אַדְמָתוֹ.
24.english: Is the plowman never done with plowing to sow, with the opening and harrowing of his ground?

25.hebrew: הֲלוֹא אִם-שִׁוָּה פָנֶיהָ, וְהֵפִיץ קֶצַח וְכַמֹּן יִזְרֹק; וְשָׂם חִטָּה שׂוֹרָה וּשְׂעֹרָה נִסְמָן, וְכֻסֶּמֶת גְּבֻלָתוֹ.
25.english: When he hath made plain the face thereof, doth he not cast abroad the black cummin, and scatter the cummin, and put in the wheat in rows and the barley in the appointed place and the spelt in the border thereof?

26.english: For He doth instruct him aright; his God doth teach him.

27.hebrew: כִּי לֹא בֶחָרוּץ, יוּדַשׁ קֶצַח, וְאוֹפַן עֲגָלָה, עַל-כַּמֹּן יוּסָּב:  כִּי בַמַּטֶּה יֵחָבֶט קֶצַח, וְכַמֹּן בַּשָּׁבֶט.
27.english: For the black cummin is not threshed with a threshing-sledge, neither is a cart-wheel turned about upon the cummin; but the black cummin is beaten out with a staff, and the cummin with a rod.

28.hebrew: לֶחֶם יוּדָק, כִּי לֹא לָנֶצַח אָדוֹשׁ יְדוּשֶׁנּוּ; וְהָמַם גִּלְגַּל עֶגְלָתוֹ וּפָרָשָׁיו, לֹא יְדֻקֶּנּוּ.
28.english: Is bread corn crushed? Nay, he will not ever be threshing it; and though the roller of his wagon and its sharp edges move noisily, he doth not crush it.

29.hebrew: גַּם-זֹאת, מֵעִם יְהוָה צְבָאוֹת יָצָאָה:  הִפְלִא עֵצָה, הִגְדִּיל תּוּשִׁיָּה.  {פ}
29.english: This also cometh forth from the LORD of hosts: Wonderful is His counsel, and great His wisdom. {P}

1.hebrew: הוֹי אֲרִיאֵל אֲרִיאֵל, קִרְיַת חָנָה דָוִד; סְפוּ שָׁנָה עַל-שָׁנָה, חַגִּים יִנְקֹפוּ.
1.english: Ah, Ariel, Ariel, the city where David encamped! Add ye year to year, let the feasts come round!

2.hebrew: וַהֲצִיקוֹתִי, לַאֲרִיאֵל; וְהָיְתָה תַאֲנִיָּה וַאֲנִיָּה, וְהָיְתָה לִּי כַּאֲרִיאֵל.
2.english: Then will I distress Ariel, and there shall be mourning and moaning; and she shall be unto Me as a hearth of God.

3.hebrew: וְחָנִיתִי כַדּוּר, עָלָיִךְ; וְצַרְתִּי עָלַיִךְ מֻצָּב, וַהֲקִימֹתִי עָלַיִךְ מְצֻרֹת.
3.english: And I will encamp against thee round about, and will lay siege against thee with a mound, and I will raise siege works against thee.

4.hebrew: וְשָׁפַלְתְּ מֵאֶרֶץ תְּדַבֵּרִי, וּמֵעָפָר תִּשַּׁח אִמְרָתֵךְ; וְהָיָה כְּאוֹב מֵאֶרֶץ, קוֹלֵךְ, וּמֵעָפָר, אִמְרָתֵךְ תְּצַפְצֵף.
4.english: And brought down thou shalt speak out of the ground, and thy speech shall be low out of the dust; and thy voice shall be as of a ghost out of the ground, and thy speech shall chirp out of the dust.

5.hebrew: וְהָיָה כְּאָבָק דַּק, הֲמוֹן זָרָיִךְ; וּכְמֹץ עֹבֵר הֲמוֹן עָרִיצִים, וְהָיָה לְפֶתַע פִּתְאֹם.
5.english: But the multitude of thy foes shall be like small dust, and the multitude of the terrible ones as chaff that passeth away; yea, it shall be at an instant suddenly--

6.hebrew: מֵעִם יְהוָה צְבָאוֹת תִּפָּקֵד, בְּרַעַם וּבְרַעַשׁ וְקוֹל גָּדוֹל; סוּפָה, וּסְעָרָה, וְלַהַב, אֵשׁ אוֹכֵלָה.
6.english: There shall be a visitation from the LORD of hosts with thunder, and with earthquake, and great noise, with whirlwind and tempest, and the flame of a devouring fire.

7.hebrew: וְהָיָה, כַּחֲלוֹם חֲזוֹן לַיְלָה, הֲמוֹן כָּל-הַגּוֹיִם, הַצֹּבְאִים עַל-אֲרִיאֵל; וְכָל-צֹבֶיהָ, וּמְצֹדָתָהּ, וְהַמְּצִיקִים, לָהּ.
7.english: And the multitude of all the nations that war against Ariel, even all that war against her, and the bulwarks about her, and they that distress her, shall be as a dream, a vision of the night.

8.hebrew: וְהָיָה כַּאֲשֶׁר יַחֲלֹם הָרָעֵב וְהִנֵּה אוֹכֵל, וְהֵקִיץ וְרֵיקָה נַפְשׁוֹ, וְכַאֲשֶׁר יַחֲלֹם הַצָּמֵא וְהִנֵּה שֹׁתֶה, וְהֵקִיץ וְהִנֵּה עָיֵף וְנַפְשׁוֹ שׁוֹקֵקָה--כֵּן יִהְיֶה, הֲמוֹן כָּל-הַגּוֹיִם, הַצֹּבְאִים, עַל-הַר צִיּוֹן.  {פ}
8.english: And it shall be as when a hungry man dreameth, and, behold, he eateth, but he awaketh, and his soul is empty; or as when a thirsty man dreameth, and, behold, he drinketh, but he awaketh, and, behold, he is faint, and his soul hath appetite--so shall the multitude of all the nations be, that fight against mount Zion. {P}

9.hebrew: הִתְמַהְמְהוּ וּתְמָהוּ, הִשְׁתַּעַשְׁעוּ וָשֹׁעוּ; שָׁכְרוּ וְלֹא-יַיִן, נָעוּ וְלֹא שֵׁכָר.
9.english: Stupefy yourselves, and be stupid! Blind yourselves, and be blind! ye that are drunken, but not with wine, that stagger, but not with strong drink.

10.hebrew: כִּי-נָסַךְ עֲלֵיכֶם יְהוָה רוּחַ תַּרְדֵּמָה, וַיְעַצֵּם אֶת-עֵינֵיכֶם:  אֶת-הַנְּבִיאִים וְאֶת-רָאשֵׁיכֶם הַחֹזִים, כִּסָּה.
10.english: For the LORD hath poured out upon you the spirit of deep sleep, and hath closed your eyes; the prophets, and your heads, the seers, hath He covered.

11.hebrew: וַתְּהִי לָכֶם חָזוּת הַכֹּל, כְּדִבְרֵי הַסֵּפֶר הֶחָתוּם, אֲשֶׁר-יִתְּנוּ אֹתוֹ אֶל-יוֹדֵעַ הספר (סֵפֶר) לֵאמֹר, קְרָא נָא-זֶה; וְאָמַר לֹא אוּכַל, כִּי חָתוּם הוּא.
11.english: And the vision of all this is become unto you as the words of a writing that is sealed, which men deliver to one that is learned, saying: 'Read this, I pray thee'; and he saith: 'I cannot, for it is sealed';

12.hebrew: וְנִתַּן הַסֵּפֶר, עַל אֲשֶׁר לֹא-יָדַע סֵפֶר לֵאמֹר--קְרָא נָא-זֶה; וְאָמַר, לֹא יָדַעְתִּי סֵפֶר.  {ס}
12.english: and the writing is delivered to him that is not learned, saying: 'Read this, I pray thee'; and he saith: 'I am not learned.' {S}

13.hebrew: וַיֹּאמֶר אֲדֹנָי, יַעַן כִּי נִגַּשׁ הָעָם הַזֶּה, בְּפִיו וּבִשְׂפָתָיו כִּבְּדוּנִי, וְלִבּוֹ רִחַק מִמֶּנִּי--וַתְּהִי יִרְאָתָם אֹתִי, מִצְוַת אֲנָשִׁים מְלֻמָּדָה.
13.english: And the Lord said: Forasmuch as this people draw near, and with their mouth and with their lips do honour Me, but have removed their heart far from Me, and their fear of Me is a commandment of men learned by rote;

14.hebrew: לָכֵן, הִנְנִי יוֹסִף לְהַפְלִיא אֶת-הָעָם-הַזֶּה--הַפְלֵא וָפֶלֶא; וְאָבְדָה חָכְמַת חֲכָמָיו, וּבִינַת נְבֹנָיו תִּסְתַּתָּר.  {ס}
14.english: Therefore, behold, I will again do a marvellous work among this people, even a marvellous work and a wonder; and the wisdom of their wise men shall perish, and the prudence of their prudent men shall be hid. {S}

15.hebrew: הוֹי הַמַּעֲמִיקִים מֵיְהוָה, לַסְתִּר עֵצָה; וְהָיָה בְמַחְשָׁךְ, מַעֲשֵׂיהֶם, וַיֹּאמְרוּ, מִי רֹאֵנוּ וּמִי יֹדְעֵנוּ.
15.english: Woe unto them that seek deep to hide their counsel from the LORD, and their works are in the dark, and they say: 'Who seeth us? and who knoweth us?'

16.hebrew: הַפְכְּכֶם--אִם-כְּחֹמֶר הַיֹּצֵר, יֵחָשֵׁב:  כִּי-יֹאמַר מַעֲשֶׂה לְעֹשֵׂהוּ לֹא עָשָׂנִי, וְיֵצֶר אָמַר לְיֹצְרוֹ לֹא הֵבִין.
16.english: O your perversity! Shall the potter be esteemed as clay; that the thing made should say of him that made it: 'He made me not'; or the thing framed say of him that framed it: 'He hath no understanding?'

17.hebrew: הֲלוֹא-עוֹד מְעַט מִזְעָר, וְשָׁב לְבָנוֹן לַכַּרְמֶל; וְהַכַּרְמֶל, לַיַּעַר יֵחָשֵׁב.
17.english: Is it not yet a very little while, and Lebanon shall be turned into a fruitful field, and the fruitful field shall be esteemed as a forest?

18.hebrew: וְשָׁמְעוּ בַיּוֹם-הַהוּא הַחֵרְשִׁים, דִּבְרֵי-סֵפֶר; וּמֵאֹפֶל וּמֵחֹשֶׁךְ, עֵינֵי עִוְרִים תִּרְאֶינָה.
18.english: And in that day shall the deaf hear the words of a book, and the eyes of the blind shall see out of obscurity and out of darkness.

19.hebrew: וְיָסְפוּ עֲנָוִים בַּיהוָה, שִׂמְחָה; וְאֶבְיוֹנֵי אָדָם, בִּקְדוֹשׁ יִשְׂרָאֵל יָגִילוּ.
19.english: The humble also shall increase their joy in the LORD, and the neediest among men shall exult in the Holy One of Israel.

20.hebrew: כִּי-אָפֵס עָרִיץ, וְכָלָה לֵץ; וְנִכְרְתוּ, כָּל-שֹׁקְדֵי אָוֶן.
20.english: For the terrible one is brought to nought, and the scorner ceaseth, and all they that watch for iniquity are cut off;

21.hebrew: מַחֲטִיאֵי אָדָם בְּדָבָר, וְלַמּוֹכִיחַ בַּשַּׁעַר יְקֹשׁוּן; וַיַּטּוּ בַתֹּהוּ, צַדִּיק.  {פ}
21.english: That make a man an offender by words, and lay a snare for him that reproveth in the gate, and turn aside the just with a thing of nought. {P}

22.hebrew: לָכֵן, כֹּה-אָמַר יְהוָה אֶל-בֵּית יַעֲקֹב, אֲשֶׁר פָּדָה, אֶת-אַבְרָהָם:  לֹא-עַתָּה יֵבוֹשׁ יַעֲקֹב, וְלֹא עַתָּה פָּנָיו יֶחֱוָרוּ.
22.english: Therefore thus saith the LORD, who redeemed Abraham, concerning the house of Jacob: Jacob shall not now be ashamed, neither shall his face now wax pale;

23.hebrew: כִּי בִרְאֹתוֹ יְלָדָיו מַעֲשֵׂה יָדַי, בְּקִרְבּוֹ--יַקְדִּישׁוּ שְׁמִי; וְהִקְדִּישׁוּ אֶת-קְדוֹשׁ יַעֲקֹב, וְאֶת-אֱלֹהֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל יַעֲרִיצוּ.
23.english: When he seeth his children, the work of My hands, in the midst of him, that they sanctify My name; yea, they shall sanctify the Holy One of Jacob, and shall stand in awe of the God of Israel.

24.hebrew: וְיָדְעוּ תֹעֵי-רוּחַ, בִּינָה; וְרוֹגְנִים, יִלְמְדוּ-לֶקַח.  {ס}
24.english: They also that err in spirit shall come to understanding, and they that murmur shall learn instruction. {S}

1.hebrew: ††де…й бћ»рƒйн се…шјшƒйн, рјаЋн-йјде»д, м«т¬щ“е…ъ т≈ц»д ејм…а оƒрћƒй, ејмƒрјс…кј о«сћ≈л»д ејм…а шећзƒй--мјо«т«п сјфе…ъ з«ић»аъ, т«м-з«ић»аъ.
1.english: Woe to the rebellious children, saith the LORD, that take counsel, but not of Me; and that form projects, but not of My spirit, that they may add sin to sin;

2.hebrew: ††д«д…мјлƒйн м»ш∆г∆ъ оƒцјш«йƒн, ећфƒй м…а щ—»а»мећ; м»те…ж бћјо»те…ж фћ«шјт…д, ејм«зјсе…ъ бћјц≈м оƒцјш»йƒн.
2.english: That walk to go down into Egypt, and have not asked at My mouth; to take refuge in the stronghold of Pharaoh, and to take shelter in the shadow of Egypt!
