3.english: Therefore shall the stronghold of Pharaoh turn to your shame, and the shelter in the shadow of Egypt to your confusion.

4.hebrew: ††лћƒй-д»йећ бјц…т«п, щ“»ш»йе; ећо«мја»л»йе, з»р≈с й«вћƒйтећ.
4.english: For his princes are at Zoan, and his ambassadors are come to Hanes.

5.hebrew: ††лћ…м д…бƒайщ—, т«м-т«н м…а-йе…тƒймећ м»ое…:† м…а мјт≈ж∆ш ејм…а мјде…тƒйм, лћƒй мјб…щ—∆ъ ејв«н-мјз∆шјфћ»д.† {с}
5.english: They shall all be ashamed of a people that cannot profit them, that are not a help nor profit, but a shame, and also a reproach. {S}

6.hebrew: ††о«щћ“»а, бћ«д¬ое…ъ р∆в∆б:† бћја∆ш∆х ц»ш»д ејцећч»д м»бƒйа е»м«йƒщ— о≈д∆н, а∆фјт∆д ејщ“»ш»у ојте…ф≈у, йƒщ“јаећ т«м-лћ∆ъ∆у т¬й»шƒйн з≈йм≈д∆н ејт«м-гћ«бћ∆щ—∆ъ вћјо«мћƒйн ае…цјш…ъ»н, т«м-т«н м…а йе…тƒймећ.
6.english: The burden of the beasts of the South. Through the land of trouble and anguish, from whence come the lioness and the lion, the viper and flying serpent, they carry their riches upon the shoulders of young asses, and their treasures upon the humps of camels, to a people that shall not profit them.

7.hebrew: ††ећоƒцјш«йƒн, д∆б∆м е»шƒйч й«тјж…шећ; м»л≈п ч»ш»аъƒй м»ж…аъ, ш«д«б д≈н щ—»б∆ъ.
7.english: For Egypt helpeth in vain, and to no purpose; therefore have I called her arrogancy that sitteth still.

8.hebrew: ††т«ъћ»д, бће…а л»ъјб»дћ т«м-мећз« аƒъћ»н--ејт«м-с≈ф∆ш зЋчћ»дћ; ећъјдƒй мјйе…н а«з¬ше…п, м»т«г т«г-те…м»н.
8.english: Now go, write it before them on a tablet, and inscribe it in a book, that it may be for the time to come for ever and ever.

9.hebrew: ††лћƒй т«н ојшƒй дећа, бћ»рƒйн лћ∆з»щ—ƒйн; бћ»рƒйн, м…а-а»бећ щ—јое…т« ъће…ш«ъ йјде»д.
9.english: For it is a rebellious people, lying children, children that refuse to hear the teaching of the LORD;

10.hebrew: ††а¬щ—∆ш а»ојшећ м»ш…аƒйн, м…а ъƒшјаећ, ејм«з…жƒйн, м…а ъ∆зЅжећ-м»рећ рјл…зе…ъ; гћ«бћјшећ-м»рећ з¬м»че…ъ, з¬жећ о«д¬ъ«мће…ъ.
10.english: That say to the seers: 'See not,' and to the prophets: 'Prophesy not unto us right things, speak unto us smooth things, prophesy delusions;

11.hebrew: ††сећшећ, оƒрћ≈й-г∆ш∆кј, д«ићећ, оƒрћ≈й-а…ш«з; д«щ—јбћƒйъећ оƒфћ»р≈йрећ, а∆ъ-чјге…щ— йƒщ“јш»а≈м.† {с}
11.english: Get you out of the way, turn aside out of the path, cause the Holy One of Israel to cease from before us.' {S}

12.hebrew: ††м»л≈п, лћ…д а»о«ш чјге…щ— йƒщ“јш»а≈м, й«т«п о»а»сјл∆н, бћ«гћ»б»ш д«жћ∆д; е«ъћƒбјијзећ бћјт…щ—∆ч ејр»ме…ж, е«ъћƒщћ—»т¬рећ т»м»йе.
12.english: Wherefore thus saith the Holy One of Israel: because ye despise this word, and trust in oppression and perverseness, and stay thereon;

13.hebrew: ††м»л≈п, йƒдјй∆д м»л∆н д∆т»е п д«жћ∆д, лћјф∆ш∆х р…ф≈м, рƒбјт∆д бћјзе…о»д рƒщ“јвћ»б»д--а¬щ—∆ш-фћƒъја…н мјф∆ъ«т, й»бе…а щ—ƒбјш»дћ.
13.english: Therefore this iniquity shall be to you as a breach ready to fall, swelling out in a high wall, whose breaking cometh suddenly at an instant.

14.hebrew: ††ећщ—јб»ш»дћ лћјщ—≈б∆ш р≈б∆м йе…цјшƒйн, лћ»ъећъ--м…а й«зјо…м; ејм…а-йƒоћ»ц≈а бƒојлƒъћ»ъе…, з∆ш∆щ“, м«зјъће…ъ а≈щ— оƒйћ»чећг, ејм«зјщ“…у о«йƒн оƒвћ∆б∆а.† {с}
14.english: And He shall break it as a potter's vessel is broken, breaking it in pieces without sparing; so that there shall not be found among the pieces thereof a sherd to take fire from the hearth, or to take water out of the cistern. {S}

15.hebrew: ††лћƒй л…д-а»о«ш а¬г…р»й йјдеƒд чјге…щ— йƒщ“јш»а≈м, бћјщ—ећб»д е»р«з«ъ ъћƒећ»щ—≈тећп--бћјд«щ—јч≈и ећбјбƒијз»д, ъћƒдјй∆д вћјбећш«ъјл∆н; ејм…а, а¬бƒйъ∆н.
15.english: For thus said the Lord GOD, the Holy One of Israel: in sitting still and rest shall ye be saved, in quietness and in confidence shall be your strength; and ye would not.

16.hebrew: ††е«ъћ…аојшећ м…а-лƒй т«м-сећс р»рећс, т«м-лћ≈п ъћјрећсећп; ејт«м-ч«м рƒшјлћ»б, т«м-лћ≈п йƒчћ«мћећ ш…гјф≈йл∆н.
16.english: But ye said: 'No, for we will flee upon horses'; therefore shall ye flee; and: 'We will ride upon the swift'; therefore shall they that pursue you be swift.

17.hebrew: ††а∆м∆у а∆з»г, оƒфћјр≈й вћ«т¬ш«ъ а∆з»г--оƒфћјр≈й вћ«т¬ш«ъ з¬оƒщћ—»д, ъћ»рЋсећ:† т«г аƒн-ре…ъ«шјъћ∆н, лћ«ъћ…ш∆п т«м-ш…ащ— д»д»ш, ејл«рћ≈с, т«м-д«вћƒбјт»д.
17.english: One thousand shall flee at the rebuke of one, at the rebuke of five shall ye flee; till ye be left as a beacon upon the top of a mountain, and as an ensign on a hill.

18.hebrew: ††ејм»л≈п йјз«лћ∆д йјде»д, м«з¬р«рјл∆н, ејм»л≈п й»шећн, мјш«з∆ојл∆н:† лћƒй-аЅм…д≈й оƒщ—јфћ»и йјде»д, а«щ—јш≈й лћ»м-зе…л≈й ме….† {ф}
18.english: And therefore will the LORD wait, that He may be gracious unto you, and therefore will He be exalted, that He may have compassion upon you; for the LORD is a God of justice, happy are all they that wait for Him. {P}

19.hebrew: ††лћƒй-т«н бћјцƒйће…п й≈щ—≈б, бћƒйшећщ—»м»ƒн; бћ»ле… м…а-ъƒбјлћ∆д, з»ре…п й»зјрјк» мјче…м ж«т¬ч∆к»--лћјщ—»ојт»ъе…, т»р»кј.
19.english: For, O people that dwellest in Zion at Jerusalem, thou shalt weep no more; He will surely be gracious unto thee at the voice of thy cry, when He shall hear, He will answer thee.

20.hebrew: ††ејр»ъ«п м»л∆н а¬г…р»й м∆з∆н ц»ш, ећо«йƒн м»з«х; ејм…а-йƒлћ»р≈у те…г ое…ш∆йк», ејд»йећ т≈йр∆йк» ш…ае…ъ а∆ъ-ое…ш∆йк».
20.english: And though the Lord give you sparing bread and scant water, yet shall not thy Teacher hide Himself any more, but thine eyes shall see thy Teacher;

21.hebrew: ††еја»жјр∆йк» ъћƒщ—јо«тјр»д г»б»ш, о≈а«з¬ш∆йк» м≈ао…ш:† ж∆д д«гћ∆ш∆кј мјлећ бе…, лћƒй ъ«а¬оƒйрећ ејлƒй ъ«щ“јојаƒймећ.
21.english: And thine ears shall hear a word behind thee, saying: 'This is the way, walk ye in it, when ye turn to the right hand, and when ye turn to the left.'

22.hebrew: ††ејиƒоћ≈аъ∆н, а∆ъ-цƒфћећй фћјсƒйм≈й л«сјфћ∆к», еја∆ъ-а¬фЋгћ«ъ, о«сћ≈л«ъ жјд»б∆к»; ъћƒжјш≈н лћјое… г»е»д, ц≈а ъћ…ао«ш ме….
22.english: And ye shall defile thy graven images overlaid with silver, and thy molten images covered with gold; thou shalt put them far away as one unclean; thou shalt say unto it: 'Get thee hence.'

23.hebrew: ††ејр»ъ«п оји«ш ж«шјт¬к» а¬щ—∆ш-ъћƒжјш«т а∆ъ-д»а¬г»о»д, ејм∆з∆н ъћјбећа«ъ д»а¬г»о»д, ејд»й»д г»щ—≈п, ејщ—»о≈п; йƒшјт∆д оƒчјр∆йк» бћ«йће…н д«дећа, лћ«ш рƒшјз»б.
23.english: And He will give the rain for thy seed, wherewith thou sowest the ground, and bread of the increase of the ground, and it shall be fat and plenteous; in that day shall thy cattle feed in large pastures.

24.hebrew: ††ејд»а¬м»фƒйн ејд»т¬й»шƒйн, т…бјг≈й д»а¬г»о»д, бћјмƒйм з»оƒйх, й…ал≈мећ--а¬щ—∆ш-ж…ш∆д б»ш«з«ъ, ећб«оћƒжјш∆д.
24.english: The oxen likewise and the young asses that till the ground shall eat savoury provender, which hath been winnowed with the shovel and with the fan.

25.hebrew: ††ејд»й»д т«м-лћ»м-д«ш вћ»б…дћ«, ејт«м лћ»м-вћƒбјт»д рƒщћ“»а»д, фћјм»вƒйн, йƒбјм≈й-о»йƒн--бћјйе…н д∆ш∆в ш»б, бћƒрјф…м оƒвјгћ»мƒйн.
25.english: And there shall be upon every lofty mountain, and upon every high hill streams and watercourses, in the day of the great slaughter, when the towers fall.

26.hebrew: ††ејд»й»д ае…ш-д«мћјб»р»д, лћјае…ш д«з«оћ»д, ејае…ш д«з«оћ»д йƒдјй∆д щ—ƒбјт»ъ«йƒн, лћјае…ш щ—ƒбјт«ъ д«йћ»оƒйн--бћјйе…н, з¬б…щ— йјде»д а∆ъ-щ—∆б∆ш т«оће…, ећо«з«х о«лћ»ъе…, йƒшјфћ»а.† {ф}
26.english: Moreover the light of the moon shall be as the light of the sun, and the light of the sun shall be sevenfold, as the light of the seven days, in the day that the LORD bindeth up the bruise of His people, and healeth the stroke of their wound. {P}

27.hebrew: ††дƒрћ≈д щ—≈н-йјде»д, бћ»а оƒоћ∆шјз»ч, бћ…т≈ш а«фће…, ејл…б∆г о«щћ“»а»д; щ“јф»ъ»йе о»мјаећ ж«т«н, ећмјщ—е…ре… лћја≈щ— а…л»м∆ъ.
27.english: Behold, the name of the LORD cometh from far, with His anger burning, and in thick uplifting of smoke; His lips are full of indignation, and His tongue is as a devouring fire;

28.hebrew: ††ејшећзе… лћјр«з«м щ—е…и≈у, т«г-ц«ећ»аш й∆зЅц∆д, м«д¬р»ф»д ве…йƒн, бћјр»ф«ъ щ—»еја; ејш∆с∆п о«ъјт∆д, т«м мјз»й≈й т«оћƒйн.
28.english: And His breath is as an overflowing stream, that divideth even unto the neck, to sift the nations with the sieve of destruction; and a bridle that causeth to err shall be in the jaws of the peoples.

29.hebrew: ††д«щћ—ƒйш йƒдјй∆д м»л∆н, лћјм≈йм дƒъјч«гћ∆щ—-з»в; ејщ“ƒојз«ъ м≈б»б, лћ«де…м≈кј бћ∆з»мƒйм, м»бе…а бјд«ш-йјде»д, а∆м-цећш йƒщ“јш»а≈м.
29.english: Ye shall have a song as in the night when a feast is hallowed; and gladness of heart, as when one goeth with the pipe to come into the mountain of the LORD, to the Rock of Israel.

30.hebrew: ††ејдƒщ—јоƒйт« йјде»д а∆ъ-де…г че…ме…, ејр«з«ъ жјше…те… й«шја∆д, бћјж«т«у а«у, ејм«д«б а≈щ— ае…л≈м»д; р∆ф∆х е»ж∆ш∆н, еја∆б∆п бћ»ш»г.
30.english: And the LORD will cause His glorious voice to be heard, and will show the lighting down of His arm, with furious anger, and the flame of a devouring fire, with a bursting of clouds, and a storm of rain, and hailstones.

31.english: For through the voice of the LORD shall Asshur be dismayed, the rod with which He smote.

32.hebrew: ††ејд»й»д, лћ…м о«т¬б«ш о«ић≈д оећс»г»д, а¬щ—∆ш й»рƒйз« йјде»д т»м»йе, бћјъЋфћƒйн ећбјлƒрћ…ше…ъ; ећбјоƒмјз¬ое…ъ ъћјрећф»д, рƒмјз«н-бд (бћ»н).
32.english: And in every place where the appointed staff shall pass, which the LORD shall lay upon him, it shall be with tabrets and harps; and in battles of wielding will He fight with them.

33.hebrew: ††лћƒй-т»шећкј о≈а∆ъјоећм ъћ»фјъћ∆д, вћ«н-деа (дƒйа) м«оћ∆м∆кј дећл»п д∆тјоƒйч дƒшјзƒб; ојгЋш»ъ»дћ, а≈щ— ејт≈цƒйн д«шјбћ≈д--рƒщ—јо«ъ йјде»д лћјр«з«м вћ»фјшƒйъ, бћ…т¬ш»д бћ»дћ.† {ф}
33.english: For a hearth is ordered of old; yea, for the king it is prepared, deep and large; the pile thereof is fire and much wood; the breath of the LORD, like a stream of brimstone, doth kindle it. {P}

1.hebrew: הוֹי הַיֹּרְדִים מִצְרַיִם לְעֶזְרָה, עַל-סוּסִים יִשָּׁעֵנוּ; וַיִּבְטְחוּ עַל-רֶכֶב כִּי רָב, וְעַל פָּרָשִׁים כִּי-עָצְמוּ מְאֹד--וְלֹא שָׁעוּ עַל-קְדוֹשׁ יִשְׂרָאֵל, וְאֶת-יְהוָה לֹא דָרָשׁוּ.
1.english: Woe to them that go down to Egypt for help, and rely on horses, and trust in chariots, because they are many, and in horsemen, because they are exceeding mighty; but they look not unto the Holy One of Israel, neither seek the LORD!

2.hebrew: וְגַם-הוּא חָכָם וַיָּבֵא רָע, וְאֶת-דְּבָרָיו לֹא הֵסִיר; וְקָם עַל-בֵּית מְרֵעִים, וְעַל-עֶזְרַת פֹּעֲלֵי אָוֶן.
2.english: Yet He also is wise, and bringeth evil, and doth not call back His words; but will arise against the house of the evil-doers, and against the help of them that work iniquity.

3.hebrew: וּמִצְרַיִם אָדָם וְלֹא-אֵל, וְסוּסֵיהֶם בָּשָׂר וְלֹא-רוּחַ; וַיהוָה יַטֶּה יָדוֹ, וְכָשַׁל עוֹזֵר וְנָפַל עָזֻר--וְיַחְדָּו, כֻּלָּם יִכְלָיוּן.  {ס}
3.english: Now the Egyptians are men, and not God, and their horses flesh, and not spirit; so when the LORD shall stretch out His hand, both he that helpeth shall stumble, and he that is helped shall fall, and they all shall perish together. {S}

4.hebrew: כִּי כֹה אָמַר-יְהוָה אֵלַי כַּאֲשֶׁר יֶהְגֶּה הָאַרְיֵה וְהַכְּפִיר עַל-טַרְפּוֹ, אֲשֶׁר יִקָּרֵא עָלָיו מְלֹא רֹעִים, מִקּוֹלָם לֹא יֵחָת, וּמֵהֲמוֹנָם לֹא יַעֲנֶה; כֵּן, יֵרֵד יְהוָה צְבָאוֹת, לִצְבֹּא עַל-הַר-צִיּוֹן, וְעַל-גִּבְעָתָהּ.
4.english: For thus saith the LORD unto me: Like as the lion, or the young lion, growling over his prey, though a multitude of shepherds be called forth against him, will not be dismayed at their voice, nor abase himself for the noise of them; so will the LORD of hosts come down to fight upon mount Zion, and upon the hill thereof.

5.hebrew: כְּצִפֳּרִים עָפוֹת--כֵּן יָגֵן יְהוָה צְבָאוֹת, עַל-יְרוּשָׁלִָם; גָּנוֹן וְהִצִּיל, פָּסֹחַ וְהִמְלִיט.
5.english: As birds hovering, so will the LORD of hosts protect Jerusalem; He will deliver it as He protecteth it, He will rescue it as He passeth over.

6.hebrew: שׁוּבוּ, לַאֲשֶׁר הֶעְמִיקוּ סָרָה--בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל.
6.english: Turn ye unto Him against whom ye have deeply rebelled, O children of Israel.

7.hebrew: כִּי, בַּיּוֹם הַהוּא, יִמְאָסוּן אִישׁ אֱלִילֵי כַסְפּוֹ, וֶאֱלִילֵי זְהָבוֹ--אֲשֶׁר עָשׂוּ לָכֶם יְדֵיכֶם, חֵטְא.
7.english: For in that day they shall cast away every man his idols of silver, and his idols of gold, which your own hands have made unto you for a sin.

8.hebrew: וְנָפַל אַשּׁוּר בְּחֶרֶב לֹא-אִישׁ, וְחֶרֶב לֹא-אָדָם תֹּאכְלֶנּוּ; וְנָס לוֹ מִפְּנֵי-חֶרֶב, וּבַחוּרָיו לָמַס יִהְיוּ.
8.english: Then shall Asshur fall with the sword, not of man, and the sword, not of men, shall devour him; and he shall flee from the sword, and his young men shall become tributary.

9.hebrew: וְסַלְעוֹ מִמָּגוֹר יַעֲבוֹר, וְחַתּוּ מִנֵּס שָׂרָיו:  נְאֻם-יְהוָה, אֲשֶׁר-אוּר לוֹ בְּצִיּוֹן, וְתַנּוּר לוֹ, בִּירוּשָׁלִָם.  {פ}
9.english: And his rock shall pass away by reason of terror, and his princes shall be dismayed at the ensign, saith the LORD, whose fire is in Zion, and His furnace in Jerusalem. {P}

1.hebrew: הֵן לְצֶדֶק, יִמְלָךְ-מֶלֶךְ; וּלְשָׂרִים, לְמִשְׁפָּט יָשֹׂרוּ.
1.english: Behold, a king shall reign in righteousness, and as for princes, they shall rule in justice.

2.hebrew: וְהָיָה-אִישׁ כְּמַחֲבֵא-רוּחַ, וְסֵתֶר זָרֶם, כְּפַלְגֵי-מַיִם בְּצָיוֹן, כְּצֵל סֶלַע-כָּבֵד בְּאֶרֶץ עֲיֵפָה.
2.english: And a man shall be as in a hiding-place from the wind, and a covert from the tempest; as by the watercourses in a dry place, as in the shadow of a great rock in a weary land.

3.hebrew: וְלֹא תִשְׁעֶינָה, עֵינֵי רֹאִים; וְאָזְנֵי שֹׁמְעִים, תִּקְשַׁבְנָה.
3.english: And the eyes of them that see shall not be closed, and the ears of them that hear shall attend.

4.hebrew: וּלְבַב נִמְהָרִים, יָבִין לָדָעַת; וּלְשׁוֹן עִלְּגִים, תְּמַהֵר לְדַבֵּר צָחוֹת.
4.english: The heart also of the rash shall understand knowledge, and the tongue of the stammerers shall be ready to speak plainly.

5.hebrew: לֹא-יִקָּרֵא עוֹד לְנָבָל, נָדִיב; וּלְכִילַי, לֹא יֵאָמֵר שׁוֹעַ.
5.english: The vile person shall be no more called liberal, nor the churl said to be noble.

6.hebrew: כִּי נָבָל נְבָלָה יְדַבֵּר, וְלִבּוֹ יַעֲשֶׂה-אָוֶן--לַעֲשׂוֹת חֹנֶף, וּלְדַבֵּר אֶל-יְהוָה תּוֹעָה, לְהָרִיק נֶפֶשׁ רָעֵב, וּמַשְׁקֶה צָמֵא יַחְסִיר.
6.english: For the vile person will speak villainy, and his heart will work iniquity, to practise ungodliness, and to utter wickedness against the LORD, to make empty the soul of the hungry, and to cause the drink of the thirsty to fail.

7.hebrew: וְכֵלַי, כֵּלָיו רָעִים; הוּא, זִמּוֹת יָעָץ, לְחַבֵּל ענוים (עֲנִיִּים) בְּאִמְרֵי-שֶׁקֶר, וּבְדַבֵּר אֶבְיוֹן מִשְׁפָּט.
7.english: The instruments also of the churl are evil; he deviseth wicked devices to destroy the poor with lying words, and the needy when he speaketh right.

8.hebrew: וְנָדִיב, נְדִיבוֹת יָעָץ; וְהוּא, עַל-נְדִיבוֹת יָקוּם.  {ס}
8.english: But the liberal deviseth liberal things; and by liberal things shall he stand. {S}

9.hebrew: נָשִׁים, שַׁאֲנַנּוֹת--קֹמְנָה, שְׁמַעְנָה קוֹלִי; בָּנוֹת, בֹּטְחוֹת--הַאְזֵנָּה, אִמְרָתִי.
9.english: Rise up, ye women that are at ease, and hear my voice; ye confident daughters, give ear unto my speech.

10.hebrew: יָמִים, עַל-שָׁנָה, תִּרְגַּזְנָה, בֹּטְחוֹת:  כִּי כָּלָה בָצִיר, אֹסֶף בְּלִי יָבוֹא.
10.english: After a year and days shall ye be troubled, ye confident women; for the vintage shall fail, the ingathering shall not come.

11.hebrew: חִרְדוּ, שַׁאֲנַנּוֹת, רְגָזָה, בֹּטְחוֹת; פְּשֹׁטָה וְעֹרָה, וַחֲגוֹרָה עַל-חֲלָצָיִם.
11.english: Tremble, ye women that are at ease; be troubled, ye confident ones; strip you, and make you bare, and gird sackcloth upon your loins,

12.hebrew: עַל-שָׁדַיִם, סֹפְדִים; עַל-שְׂדֵי-חֶמֶד, עַל-גֶּפֶן פֹּרִיָּה.
12.english: Smiting upon the breasts for the pleasant fields, for the fruitful vine;

13.hebrew: עַל אַדְמַת עַמִּי, קוֹץ שָׁמִיר תַּעֲלֶה:  כִּי עַל-כָּל-בָּתֵּי מָשׂוֹשׂ, קִרְיָה עַלִּיזָה.
13.english: For the land of my people whereon thorns and briers come up; yea, for all the houses of joy and the joyous city.

14.hebrew: כִּי-אַרְמוֹן נֻטָּשׁ, הֲמוֹן עִיר עֻזָּב; עֹפֶל וָבַחַן הָיָה בְעַד מְעָרוֹת, עַד-עוֹלָם--מְשׂוֹשׂ פְּרָאִים, מִרְעֵה עֲדָרִים.
14.english: For the palace shall be forsaken; the city with its stir shall be deserted; the mound and the tower shall be for dens for ever, a joy of wild asses, a pasture of flocks;

15.hebrew: עַד-יֵעָרֶה עָלֵינוּ רוּחַ, מִמָּרוֹם; וְהָיָה מִדְבָּר לַכַּרְמֶל, וכרמל (וְהַכַּרְמֶל) לַיַּעַר יֵחָשֵׁב.
15.english: Until the spirit be poured upon us from on high, and the wilderness become a fruitful field, and the fruitful field be counted for a forest.

16.hebrew: וְשָׁכַן בַּמִּדְבָּר, מִשְׁפָּט; וּצְדָקָה, בַּכַּרְמֶל תֵּשֵׁב.
16.english: Then justice shall dwell in the wilderness, and righteousness shall abide in the fruitful field.

17.hebrew: וְהָיָה מַעֲשֵׂה הַצְּדָקָה, שָׁלוֹם; וַעֲבֹדַת, הַצְּדָקָה--הַשְׁקֵט וָבֶטַח, עַד-עוֹלָם.
17.english: And the work of righteousness shall be peace; and the effect of righteousness quietness and confidence for ever.

18.hebrew: וְיָשַׁב עַמִּי, בִּנְוֵה שָׁלוֹם; וּבְמִשְׁכְּנוֹת, מִבְטַחִים, וּבִמְנוּחֹת, שַׁאֲנַנּוֹת.
18.english: And my people shall abide in a peaceable habitation, and in secure dwellings, and in quiet resting-places.

19.hebrew: וּבָרַד, בְּרֶדֶת הַיָּעַר; וּבַשִּׁפְלָה, תִּשְׁפַּל הָעִיר.
19.english: And it shall hail, in the downfall of the forest; but the city shall descend into the valley.

20.hebrew: אַשְׁרֵיכֶם, זֹרְעֵי עַל-כָּל-מָיִם; מְשַׁלְּחֵי רֶגֶל-הַשּׁוֹר, וְהַחֲמוֹר.  {ס}
20.english: Happy are ye that sow beside all waters, that send forth freely the feet of the ox and the ass. {S}

1.hebrew: ††де…й щ—е…г≈г, еја«ъћ»д м…а щ—»гећг, ећбе…в≈г, ејм…а-б»вјгећ бе…; лћ«д¬ъƒојк» щ—е…г≈г ъћећщћ—«г, лћ«рћјм…ъјк» мƒбјвћ…г йƒбјвћјгећ-б»кј.† {с}
1.english: Woe to thee that spoilest, and thou wast not spoiled; and dealest treacherously, and they dealt not treacherously with thee! When thou hast ceased to spoil, thou shalt be spoiled; and when thou art weary with dealing treacherously, they shall deal treacherously with thee. {S}

2.hebrew: ††йјде»д з»рћ≈рећ, мјк» чƒећƒйрећ; дЅй≈д жјш…т»н м«бћјч»шƒйн, а«у-йјщ—ећт»ъ≈рећ бћјт≈ъ ц»ш»д.
2.english: O LORD, be gracious unto us; we have waited for Thee; be Thou their arm every morning, our salvation also in the time of trouble.

3.hebrew: ††оƒчће…м д»ое…п, р»гјгећ т«оћƒйн; о≈ше…ојоЋъ∆к», р»фјцећ вће…йƒн.
3.english: At the noise of the tumult the peoples are fled; at the lifting up of Thyself the nations are scattered.

4.hebrew: ††ејаЋсћ«у щ—јм«мјл∆н, а…с∆у д∆з»сƒйм--лћјо«щћ—«ч вћ≈бƒйн, щ—…ч≈ч бће….
4.english: And your spoil is gathered as the caterpillar gathereth; as locusts leap do they leap upon it.

5.hebrew: ††рƒщ“јвћ»б йјде»д, лћƒй щ—…л≈п о»ше…н; оƒмћ≈а цƒйће…п, оƒщ—јфћ»и ећцјг»ч»д.
5.english: The LORD is exalted, for He dwelleth on high; He hath filled Zion with justice and righteousness.

6.hebrew: ††ејд»й»д аЅоећр«ъ тƒъћ∆йк», з…с∆п йјщ—ећт…ъ з»лјо«ъ е»г»т«ъ; йƒшја«ъ йјде»д, дƒйа ае…ц»ше….† {ф}
6.english: And the stability of thy times shall be a hoard of salvation--wisdom and knowledge, and the fear of the LORD which is His treasure. {P}

7.hebrew: ††д≈п, а∆шја∆мћ»н, ц»т¬чећ, зЋц»д; о«мја¬л≈й щ—»ме…н, о«ш йƒбјлћ»йећп.
7.english: Behold, their valiant ones cry without; the ambassadors of peace weep bitterly.

8.hebrew: ††р»щ—«оћећ ојсƒмће…ъ, щ—»б«ъ т…б≈ш а…ш«з; д≈ф≈ш бћјшƒйъ о»а«с т»шƒйн, м…а з»щ—«б аЅре…щ—.
8.english: The highways lie waste, the wayfaring man ceaseth; he hath broken the covenant, he hath despised the cities, he regardeth not man.

9.hebrew: ††а»б«м аЋојмјм»д а»ш∆х, д∆зјфћƒйш мјб»ре…п ч»о«м; д»й»д д«щћ—»ше…п лћ»т¬ш»б»д, ејр…т≈ш бћ»щ—»п ејл«шјо∆м.† {с}
9.english: The land mourneth and languisheth; Lebanon is ashamed, it withereth; Sharon is like a wilderness; and Bashan and Carmel are clean bare. {S}

10.hebrew: ††т«ъћ»д а»чећн, й…ао«ш йјде»д; т«ъћ»д, а≈ше…о»н--т«ъћ»д, а∆рћ»щ“≈а.
10.english: Now will I arise, saith the LORD; now will I be exalted; now will I lift Myself up.

11.hebrew: ††ъћ«д¬шећ з¬щ—«щ—, ъћ≈мјгећ ч«щ—; шећз¬л∆н, а≈щ— ъћ…ал«мјл∆н.
11.english: Ye conceive chaff, ye shall bring forth stubble; your breath is a fire that shall devour you.

12.hebrew: ††ејд»йећ т«оћƒйн, оƒщ“јшјфе…ъ щ“ƒйг; че…цƒйн лћјсећзƒйн, бћ»а≈щ— йƒцћ«ъћећ.† {ф}
12.english: And the peoples shall be as the burnings of lime; as thorns cut down, that are burned in the fire. {P}

13.hebrew: ††щ—ƒојтећ шјзе…чƒйн, а¬щ—∆ш т»щ“ƒйъƒй; ећгјтећ чјше…бƒйн, вћјбЋш»ъƒй.
13.english: Hear, ye that are far off, what I have done; and, ye that are near, acknowledge My might.

14.hebrew: ††фћ»з¬гећ бјцƒйће…п з«ић»аƒйн, а»з¬ж»д шјт»г»д з¬р≈фƒйн; оƒй й»већш м»рећ, а≈щ— ае…л≈м»д--оƒй-й»већш м»рећ, ое…чјг≈й те…м»н.
14.english: The sinners in Zion are afraid; trembling hath seized the ungodly: 'Who among us shall dwell with the devouring fire? Who among us shall dwell with everlasting burnings?'

15.hebrew: ††д…м≈кј цјг»че…ъ, ејг…б≈ш о≈йщ—»шƒйн; о…а≈с бћјб∆ц«т о«т¬щ—«чће…ъ, р…т≈ш лћ«фћ»йе оƒъћјо…кј бћ«щћ—…з«г, а…и≈н а»жјре… оƒщћ—јо…т« гћ»оƒйн, ејт…ц≈н т≈йр»йе о≈шјае…ъ бћјш»т.
15.english: He that walketh righteously, and speaketh uprightly; he that despiseth the gain of oppressions, that shaketh his hands from holding of bribes, that stoppeth his ears from hearing of blood, and shutteth his eyes from looking upon evil;

16.hebrew: ††дећа ојше…оƒйн йƒщ—јлћ…п, ојц»ге…ъ сјм»тƒйн оƒщ“јвћ«бће…; м«зјое… рƒъћ»п, о≈йо»йе р∆аЅо»рƒйн.
16.english: He shall dwell on high; his place of defence shall be the munitions of rocks; his bread shall be given, his waters shall be sure.

17.hebrew: ††о∆м∆кј бћјй»фјйе…, ъћ∆зЅж∆йр»д т≈йр∆йк»; ъћƒшја∆йр»д, а∆ш∆х о«шјз«чћƒйн.
17.english: Thine eyes shall see the king in his beauty; they shall behold a land stretching afar.

18.hebrew: ††мƒбћјк», й∆дјвћ∆д а≈йо»д; а«йћ≈д с…ф≈ш а«йћ≈д щ—…ч≈м, а«йћ≈д с…ф≈ш а∆ъ-д«оћƒвјгћ»мƒйн.
18.english: Thy heart shall muse on the terror: 'Where is he that counted, where is he that weighed? Where is he that counted the towers?'

19.hebrew: ††а∆ъ-т«н ре…т»ж, м…а ъƒшја∆д:† т«н тƒојч≈й щ“»ф»д оƒщћ—јое…т«, рƒмјт«в м»щ—е…п а≈йп бћƒйр»д.
19.english: Thou shalt not see the fierce people; a people of a deep speech that thou canst not perceive, of a stammering tongue that thou canst not understand.

20.hebrew: ††з¬ж≈д цƒйће…п, чƒшјй«ъ ое…т¬г≈рећ; т≈йр∆йк» ъƒшја∆йр»д йјшећщ—»м«ƒн р»е∆д щ—«а¬р»п, а…д∆м бћ«м-йƒцјт»п бћ«м-йƒсћ«т йјъ≈г…ъ»йе м»р∆ц«з, ејл»м-з¬б»м»йе, бћ«м-йƒрћ»ъ≈чећ.
20.english: Look upon Zion, the city of our solemn gatherings; thine eyes shall see Jerusalem a peaceful habitation, a tent that shall not be removed, the stakes whereof shall never be plucked up, neither shall any of the cords thereof be broken.

21.hebrew: ††лћƒй аƒн-щ—»н а«гћƒйш йјде»д, м»рећ, ојче…н-рјд»шƒйн йја…шƒйн, ш«з¬б≈й й»г»йƒн; бћ«м-ъћ≈м∆кј бће… а√рƒй-щ—«йƒи, ејцƒй а«гћƒйш м…а й«т«бјш∆рћећ.
21.english: But there the LORD will be with us in majesty, in a place of broad rivers and streams; wherein shall go no galley with oars, neither shall gallant ship pass thereby.

22.hebrew: ††лћƒй йјде»д щ—…фји≈рећ, йјде»д ојз…чјч≈рећ; йјде»д о«мјлћ≈рећ, дећа йе…щ—ƒйт≈рећ.
22.english: For the LORD is our Judge, the LORD is our Lawgiver, the LORD is our King; He will save us.

23.hebrew: ††рƒићјщ—ећ, з¬б»м»йƒкј; бћ«м-йјз«жћјчећ л≈п-ъћ»шјр»н, бћ«м-фћ»шјщ“ећ р≈с, а»ж зЋмћ«ч т«г-щ—»м»м о«шјбћ∆д, фћƒсјзƒйн бћ»жјжећ б«ж.
23.english: Thy tacklings are loosed; they do not hold the stand of their mast, they do not spread the sail; then is the prey of a great spoil divided; the lame take the prey.

24.hebrew: ††ећб«м-й…ао«ш щ—»л≈п, з»мƒйъƒй; д»т»н д«йћ…щ—≈б бћ»дћ, рјщ“Ћа т»е п.† {с}
24.english: And the inhabitant shall not say: 'I am sick'; the people that dwell therein shall be forgiven their iniquity. {S}

1.hebrew: קִרְבוּ גוֹיִם לִשְׁמֹעַ, וּלְאֻמִּים הַקְשִׁיבוּ; תִּשְׁמַע הָאָרֶץ וּמְלֹאָהּ, תֵּבֵל וְכָל-צֶאֱצָאֶיהָ.
1.english: Come near, ye nations, to hear, and attend, ye peoples; let the earth hear, and the fulness thereof, the world, and all things that come forth of it.

2.hebrew: כִּי קֶצֶף לַיהוָה עַל-כָּל-הַגּוֹיִם, וְחֵמָה עַל-כָּל-צְבָאָם; הֶחֱרִימָם, נְתָנָם לַטָּבַח.
2.english: For the LORD hath indignation against all the nations, and fury against all their host; He hath utterly destroyed them, He hath delivered them to the slaughter.

3.hebrew: וְחַלְלֵיהֶם יֻשְׁלָכוּ, וּפִגְרֵיהֶם יַעֲלֶה בָאְשָׁם; וְנָמַסּוּ הָרִים, מִדָּמָם.
3.english: Their slain also shall be cast out, and the stench of their carcasses shall come up, and the mountains shall be melted with their blood.

4.hebrew: וְנָמַקּוּ כָּל-צְבָא הַשָּׁמַיִם, וְנָגֹלּוּ כַסֵּפֶר הַשָּׁמָיִם; וְכָל-צְבָאָם יִבּוֹל--כִּנְבֹל עָלֶה מִגֶּפֶן, וּכְנֹבֶלֶת מִתְּאֵנָה.
4.english: And all the host of heaven shall moulder away, and the heavens shall be rolled together as a scroll; and all their host shall fall down, as the leaf falleth off from the vine, and as a falling fig from the fig-tree.

5.hebrew: כִּי-רִוְּתָה בַשָּׁמַיִם, חַרְבִּי; הִנֵּה עַל-אֱדוֹם תֵּרֵד, וְעַל-עַם חֶרְמִי לְמִשְׁפָּט.
5.english: For My sword hath drunk its fill in heaven; behold, it shall come down upon Edom, and upon the people of My ban, to judgment.

6.hebrew: חֶרֶב לַיהוָה מָלְאָה דָם, הֻדַּשְׁנָה מֵחֵלֶב, מִדַּם כָּרִים וְעַתּוּדִים, מֵחֵלֶב כִּלְיוֹת אֵילִים:  כִּי זֶבַח לַיהוָה בְּבָצְרָה, וְטֶבַח גָּדוֹל בְּאֶרֶץ אֱדוֹם.
6.english: The sword of the LORD is filled with blood, it is made fat with fatness, with the blood of lambs and goats, with the fat of the kidneys of rams; for the LORD hath a sacrifice in Bozrah, and a great slaughter in the land of Edom.

7.hebrew: וְיָרְדוּ רְאֵמִים עִמָּם, וּפָרִים עִם-אַבִּירִים; וְרִוְּתָה אַרְצָם מִדָּם, וַעֲפָרָם מֵחֵלֶב יְדֻשָּׁן.
7.english: And the wild-oxen shall come down with them, and the bullocks with the bulls; and their land shall be drunken with blood, and their dust made fat with fatness.

8.hebrew: כִּי יוֹם נָקָם, לַיהוָה--שְׁנַת שִׁלּוּמִים, לְרִיב צִיּוֹן.
8.english: For the LORD hath a day of vengeance, a year of recompense for the controversy of Zion.

9.hebrew: וְנֶהֶפְכוּ נְחָלֶיהָ לְזֶפֶת, וַעֲפָרָהּ לְגָפְרִית; וְהָיְתָה אַרְצָהּ, לְזֶפֶת בֹּעֵרָה.
9.english: And the streams thereof shall be turned into pitch, and the dust thereof into brimstone, and the land thereof shall become burning pitch.

10.hebrew: לַיְלָה וְיוֹמָם לֹא תִכְבֶּה, לְעוֹלָם יַעֲלֶה עֲשָׁנָהּ; מִדּוֹר לָדוֹר, תֶּחֱרָב--לְנֵצַח נְצָחִים, אֵין עֹבֵר בָּהּ.
10.english: It shall not be quenched night nor day, the smoke thereof shall go up for ever; from generation to generation it shall lie waste: none shall pass through it for ever and ever.

11.hebrew: וִירֵשׁוּהָ קָאַת וְקִפּוֹד, וְיַנְשׁוֹף וְעֹרֵב יִשְׁכְּנוּ-בָהּ; וְנָטָה עָלֶיהָ קַו-תֹהוּ, וְאַבְנֵי-בֹהוּ.
11.english: But the pelican and the bittern shall possess it, and the owl and the raven shall dwell therein; and He shall stretch over it the line of confusion, and the plummet of emptiness.

12.hebrew: חֹרֶיהָ וְאֵין-שָׁם, מְלוּכָה יִקְרָאוּ; וְכָל-שָׂרֶיהָ, יִהְיוּ אָפֶס.
12.english: As for her nobles, none shall be there to be called to the kingdom; and all her princes shall be nothing.

13.hebrew: וְעָלְתָה אַרְמְנֹתֶיהָ סִירִים, קִמּוֹשׂ וָחוֹחַ בְּמִבְצָרֶיהָ; וְהָיְתָה נְוֵה תַנִּים, חָצִיר לִבְנוֹת יַעֲנָה.
13.english: And thorns shall come up in her palaces, nettles and thistles in the fortresses thereof; and it shall be a habitation of wild-dogs, an enclosure for ostriches.

14.hebrew: וּפָגְשׁוּ צִיִּים אֶת-אִיִּים, וְשָׂעִיר עַל-רֵעֵהוּ יִקְרָא; אַךְ-שָׁם הִרְגִּיעָה לִּילִית, וּמָצְאָה לָהּ מָנוֹחַ.
14.english: And the wild-cats shall meet with the jackals, and the satyr shall cry to his fellow; yea, the night-monster shall repose there, and shall find her a place of rest.

15.hebrew: שָׁמָּה קִנְּנָה קִפּוֹז וַתְּמַלֵּט, וּבָקְעָה וְדָגְרָה בְצִלָּהּ; אַךְ-שָׁם נִקְבְּצוּ דַיּוֹת, אִשָּׁה רְעוּתָהּ.
15.english: There shall the arrowsnake make her nest, and lay, and hatch, and brood under her shadow; yea, there shall the kites be gathered, every one with her mate.

16.hebrew: דִּרְשׁוּ מֵעַל-סֵפֶר יְהוָה, וּקְרָאוּ--אַחַת מֵהֵנָּה לֹא נֶעְדָּרָה, אִשָּׁה רְעוּתָהּ לֹא פָקָדוּ:  כִּי-פִי הוּא צִוָּה, וְרוּחוֹ הוּא קִבְּצָן.
16.english: Seek ye out of the book of the LORD, and read; no one of these shall be missing, none shall want her mate; for My mouth it hath commanded, and the breath thereof it hath gathered them.

17.hebrew: וְהוּא-הִפִּיל לָהֶן גּוֹרָל, וְיָדוֹ חִלְּקַתָּה לָהֶם בַּקָּו; עַד-עוֹלָם, יִירָשׁוּהָ--לְדוֹר וָדוֹר, יִשְׁכְּנוּ-בָהּ.  {ס}
17.english: And He hath cast the lot for them, and His hand hath divided it unto them by line; they shall possess it for ever, from generation to generation shall they dwell therein. {S}

1.hebrew: יְשֻׂשׂוּם מִדְבָּר, וְצִיָּה; וְתָגֵל עֲרָבָה וְתִפְרַח, כַּחֲבַצָּלֶת.
1.english: The wilderness and the parched land shall be glad; and the desert shall rejoice, and blossom as the rose.

2.hebrew: פָּרֹחַ תִּפְרַח וְתָגֵל, אַף גִּילַת וְרַנֵּן--כְּבוֹד הַלְּבָנוֹן נִתַּן-לָהּ, הֲדַר הַכַּרְמֶל וְהַשָּׁרוֹן; הֵמָּה יִרְאוּ כְבוֹד-יְהוָה, הֲדַר אֱלֹהֵינוּ.  {פ}
2.english: It shall blossom abundantly, and rejoice, even with joy and singing; the glory of Lebanon shall be given unto it, the excellency of Carmel and Sharon; they shall see the glory of the LORD, the excellency of our God. {P}

3.hebrew: חַזְּקוּ, יָדַיִם רָפוֹת; וּבִרְכַּיִם כֹּשְׁלוֹת, אַמֵּצוּ.
3.english: Strengthen ye the weak hands, and make firm the tottering knees.

4.hebrew: אִמְרוּ, לְנִמְהֲרֵי-לֵב, חִזְקוּ, אַל-תִּירָאוּ; הִנֵּה אֱלֹהֵיכֶם, נָקָם יָבוֹא--גְּמוּל אֱלֹהִים, הוּא יָבוֹא וְיֹשַׁעֲכֶם.
4.english: Say to them that are of a fearful heart: 'Be strong, fear not'; behold, your God will come with vengeance, with the recompense of God He will come and save you.

5.hebrew: אָז תִּפָּקַחְנָה, עֵינֵי עִוְרִים; וְאָזְנֵי חֵרְשִׁים, תִּפָּתַחְנָה.
5.english: Then the eyes of the blind shall be opened, and the ears of the deaf shall be unstopped.

6.hebrew: אָז יְדַלֵּג כָּאַיָּל פִּסֵּחַ, וְתָרֹן לְשׁוֹן אִלֵּם:  כִּי-נִבְקְעוּ בַמִּדְבָּר מַיִם, וּנְחָלִים בָּעֲרָבָה.
6.english: Then shall the lame man leap as a hart, and the tongue of the dumb shall sing; for in the wilderness shall waters break out, and streams in the desert.

7.hebrew: וְהָיָה הַשָּׁרָב לַאֲגַם, וְצִמָּאוֹן לְמַבּוּעֵי מָיִם; בִּנְוֵה תַנִּים רִבְצָהּ, חָצִיר לְקָנֶה וָגֹמֶא.
7.english: And the parched land shall become a pool, and the thirsty ground springs of water; in the habitation of jackals herds shall lie down, it shall be an enclosure for reeds and rushes.

8.hebrew: וְהָיָה-שָׁם מַסְלוּל וָדֶרֶךְ, וְדֶרֶךְ הַקֹּדֶשׁ יִקָּרֵא לָהּ--לֹא-יַעַבְרֶנּוּ טָמֵא, וְהוּא-לָמוֹ; הֹלֵךְ דֶּרֶךְ וֶאֱוִילִים, לֹא יִתְעוּ.
8.english: And a highway shall be there, and a way, and it shall be called the way of holiness; the unclean shall not pass over it; but it shall be for those; the wayfaring men, yea fools, shall not err therein.

9.hebrew: לֹא-יִהְיֶה שָׁם אַרְיֵה, וּפְרִיץ חַיּוֹת בַּל-יַעֲלֶנָּה--לֹא תִמָּצֵא, שָׁם; וְהָלְכוּ, גְּאוּלִים.
9.english: No lion shall be there, nor shall any ravenous beast go up thereon, they shall not be found there; but the redeemed shall walk there;

10.hebrew: וּפְדוּיֵי יְהוָה יְשֻׁבוּן, וּבָאוּ צִיּוֹן בְּרִנָּה, וְשִׂמְחַת עוֹלָם, עַל-רֹאשָׁם; שָׂשׂוֹן וְשִׂמְחָה יַשִּׂיגוּ, וְנָסוּ יָגוֹן וַאֲנָחָה.  {ס}
10.english: And the ransomed of the LORD shall return, and come with singing unto Zion, and everlasting joy shall be upon their heads; they shall obtain gladness and joy, and sorrow and sighing shall flee away. {S}

1.hebrew: וַיְהִי בְּאַרְבַּע עֶשְׂרֵה שָׁנָה לַמֶּלֶךְ חִזְקִיָּהוּ, עָלָה סַנְחֵרִיב מֶלֶךְ-אַשּׁוּר עַל כָּל-עָרֵי יְהוּדָה הַבְּצֻרוֹת--וַיִּתְפְּשֵׂם.
1.english: Now it came to pass in the fourteenth year of king Hezekiah, that Sennacherib king of Assyria came up against all the fortified cities of Judah, and took them.

2.hebrew: וַיִּשְׁלַח מֶלֶךְ-אַשּׁוּר אֶת-רַבְשָׁקֵה מִלָּכִישׁ יְרוּשָׁלְַמָה אֶל-הַמֶּלֶךְ חִזְקִיָּהוּ, בְּחֵיל כָּבֵד; וַיַּעֲמֹד, בִּתְעָלַת הַבְּרֵכָה הָעֶלְיוֹנָה, בִּמְסִלַּת, שְׂדֵה כוֹבֵס.
2.english: And the king of Assyria sent Rab-shakeh from Lachish to Jerusalem unto king Hezekiah with a great army. And he stood by the conduit of the upper pool in the highway of the fullers' field.

3.hebrew: וַיֵּצֵא אֵלָיו אֶלְיָקִים בֶּן-חִלְקִיָּהוּ, אֲשֶׁר עַל-הַבָּיִת--וְשֶׁבְנָא, הַסֹּפֵר, וְיוֹאָח בֶּן-אָסָף, הַמַּזְכִּיר.
3.english: Then came forth unto him Eliakim the son of Hilkiah, that was over the household, and Shebna the scribe, and Joah the son of Asaph the recorder.

4.hebrew: וַיֹּאמֶר אֲלֵיהֶם רַבְשָׁקֵה, אִמְרוּ-נָא אֶל-חִזְקִיָּהוּ:  כֹּה-אָמַר הַמֶּלֶךְ הַגָּדוֹל, מֶלֶךְ אַשּׁוּר, מָה הַבִּטָּחוֹן הַזֶּה, אֲשֶׁר בָּטָחְתָּ.
4.english: And Rab-shakeh said unto them: 'Say ye now to Hezekiah: Thus saith the great king, the king of Assyria: What confidence is this wherein thou trustest?

5.hebrew: אָמַרְתִּי, אַךְ-דְּבַר-שְׂפָתַיִם, עֵצָה וּגְבוּרָה, לַמִּלְחָמָה; עַתָּה עַל-מִי בָטַחְתָּ, כִּי מָרַדְתָּ בִּי.
5.english: I said: It is but vain words; for counsel and strength are for the war. Now on whom dost thou trust, that thou hast rebelled against me?

6.hebrew: הִנֵּה בָטַחְתָּ עַל-מִשְׁעֶנֶת הַקָּנֶה הָרָצוּץ הַזֶּה, עַל-מִצְרַיִם, אֲשֶׁר יִסָּמֵךְ אִישׁ עָלָיו, וּבָא בְכַפּוֹ וּנְקָבָהּ:  כֵּן פַּרְעֹה מֶלֶךְ-מִצְרַיִם, לְכָל-הַבֹּטְחִים עָלָיו.
6.english: Behold, thou trustest upon the staff of this bruised reed, even upon Egypt; whereon if a man lean, it will go into his hand, and pierce it; so is Pharaoh king of Egypt to all that trust on him.

7.hebrew: וְכִי-תֹאמַר אֵלַי, אֶל-יְהוָה אֱלֹהֵינוּ בָּטָחְנוּ:  הֲלוֹא-הוּא, אֲשֶׁר הֵסִיר חִזְקִיָּהוּ אֶת-בָּמֹתָיו וְאֶת-מִזְבְּחֹתָיו, וַיֹּאמֶר לִיהוּדָה וְלִירוּשָׁלִַם, לִפְנֵי הַמִּזְבֵּחַ הַזֶּה תִּשְׁתַּחֲווּ.
7.english: But if thou say unto me: We trust in the LORD our God; is not that He, whose high places and whose altars Hezekiah hath taken away, and hath said to Judah and to Jerusalem: Ye shall worship before this altar?

8.hebrew: וְעַתָּה הִתְעָרֶב נָא, אֶת-אֲדֹנִי הַמֶּלֶךְ אַשּׁוּר; וְאֶתְּנָה לְךָ, אַלְפַּיִם סוּסִים--אִם-תּוּכַל, לָתֶת לְךָ רֹכְבִים עֲלֵיהֶם.
8.english: Now therefore, I pray thee, make a wager with my master, the king of Assyria, and I will give thee two thousand horses, if thou be able on thy part to set riders upon them.

9.hebrew: וְאֵיךְ תָּשִׁיב, אֵת פְּנֵי פַחַת אַחַד עַבְדֵי אֲדֹנִי--הַקְּטַנִּים; וַתִּבְטַח לְךָ עַל-מִצְרַיִם, לְרֶכֶב וּלְפָרָשִׁים.
9.english: How then canst thou turn away the face of one captain, even of the least of my master's servants? yet thou puttest thy trust on Egypt for chariots and for horsemen!

10.hebrew: וְעַתָּה הֲמִבַּלְעֲדֵי יְהוָה, עָלִיתִי עַל-הָאָרֶץ הַזֹּאת לְהַשְׁחִיתָהּ; יְהוָה אָמַר אֵלַי, עֲלֵה אֶל-הָאָרֶץ הַזֹּאת וְהַשְׁחִיתָהּ.  {ס}
10.english: And am I now come up without the LORD against this land to destroy it? The LORD said unto me: Go up against this land, and destroy it.' {S}

11.hebrew: וַיֹּאמֶר אֶלְיָקִים וְשֶׁבְנָא וְיוֹאָח אֶל-רַבְשָׁקֵה, דַּבֶּר-נָא אֶל-עֲבָדֶיךָ אֲרָמִית--כִּי שֹׁמְעִים, אֲנָחְנוּ; וְאַל-תְּדַבֵּר אֵלֵינוּ, יְהוּדִית, בְּאָזְנֵי הָעָם, אֲשֶׁר עַל-הַחוֹמָה.
11.english: Then said Eliakim and Shebna and Joah unto Rab-shakeh: 'Speak, I pray thee, unto thy servants in the Aramean language, for we understand it; and speak not to us in the Jews' language, in the ears of the people that are on the wall.'

12.hebrew: וַיֹּאמֶר רַבְשָׁקֵה, הַאֶל אֲדֹנֶיךָ וְאֵלֶיךָ שְׁלָחַנִי אֲדֹנִי, לְדַבֵּר, אֶת-הַדְּבָרִים הָאֵלֶּה:  הֲלֹא עַל-הָאֲנָשִׁים, הַיֹּשְׁבִים עַל-הַחוֹמָה, לֶאֱכֹל אֶת-חראיהם (צוֹאָתָם) וְלִשְׁתּוֹת אֶת-שיניהם (מֵימֵי רַגְלֵיהֶם), עִמָּכֶם.
12.english: But Rab-shakeh said: 'Hath my master sent me to thy master, and to thee, to speak these words? hath he not sent me to the men that sit upon the wall, to eat their own dung, and to drink their own water with you?'

13.hebrew: וַיַּעֲמֹד, רַבְשָׁקֵה, וַיִּקְרָא בְקוֹל-גָּדוֹל, יְהוּדִית; וַיֹּאמֶר--שִׁמְעוּ אֶת-דִּבְרֵי הַמֶּלֶךְ הַגָּדוֹל, מֶלֶךְ אַשּׁוּר.
13.english: Then Rab-shakeh stood, and cried with a loud voice in the Jews' language, and said: 'Hear ye the words of the great king, the king of Assyria.

14.hebrew: כֹּה אָמַר הַמֶּלֶךְ, אַל-יַשִּׁא לָכֶם חִזְקִיָּהוּ:  כִּי לֹא-יוּכַל, לְהַצִּיל אֶתְכֶם.
14.english: Thus saith the king: Let not Hezekiah beguile you, for he will not be able to deliver you;

15.hebrew: וְאַל-יַבְטַח אֶתְכֶם חִזְקִיָּהוּ אֶל-יְהוָה לֵאמֹר, הַצֵּל יַצִּילֵנוּ יְהוָה:  לֹא תִנָּתֵן הָעִיר הַזֹּאת, בְּיַד מֶלֶךְ אַשּׁוּר.
15.english: neither let Hezekiah make you trust in the LORD, saying: The LORD will surely deliver us; this city shall not be given into the hand of the king of Assyria.

16.hebrew: אַל-תִּשְׁמְעוּ, אֶל-חִזְקִיָּהוּ;  {פ} כִּי כֹה אָמַר הַמֶּלֶךְ אַשּׁוּר, עֲשׂוּ-אִתִּי בְרָכָה וּצְאוּ אֵלַי, וְאִכְלוּ אִישׁ-גַּפְנוֹ וְאִישׁ תְּאֵנָתוֹ, וּשְׁתוּ אִישׁ מֵי-בוֹרוֹ.
16.english: Hearken not to Hezekiah; {P}  for thus saith the king of Assyria: Make your peace with me, and come out to me; and eat ye every one of his vine, and every one of his fig-tree, and drink ye every one the waters of his own cistern;

17.hebrew: עַד-בֹּאִי, וְלָקַחְתִּי אֶתְכֶם אֶל-אֶרֶץ כְּאַרְצְכֶם:  אֶרֶץ דָּגָן וְתִירוֹשׁ, אֶרֶץ לֶחֶם וּכְרָמִים.
17.english: until I come and take you away to a land like your own land, a land of corn and wine, a land of bread and vineyards.

18.hebrew: פֶּן-יַסִּית אֶתְכֶם חִזְקִיָּהוּ לֵאמֹר, יְהוָה יַצִּילֵנוּ; הַהִצִּילוּ אֱלֹהֵי הַגּוֹיִם, אִישׁ אֶת-אַרְצוֹ, מִיַּד, מֶלֶךְ אַשּׁוּר.
18.english: Beware lest Hezekiah persuade you, saying: The LORD will deliver us. Hath any of the gods of the nations delivered his land out of the hand of the king of Assyria?

19.hebrew: אַיֵּה אֱלֹהֵי חֲמָת, וְאַרְפָּד--אַיֵּה, אֱלֹהֵי סְפַרְוָיִם; וְכִי-הִצִּילוּ אֶת-שֹׁמְרוֹן, מִיָּדִי.
19.english: Where are the gods of Hamath and Arpad? where are the gods of Sepharvaim? and have they delivered Samaria out of my hand?

20.hebrew: מִי, בְּכָל-אֱלֹהֵי הָאֲרָצוֹת הָאֵלֶּה, אֲשֶׁר-הִצִּילוּ אֶת-אַרְצָם, מִיָּדִי; כִּי-יַצִּיל יְהוָה אֶת-יְרוּשָׁלִַם, מִיָּדִי.
20.english: Who are they among all the gods of these countries, that have delivered their country out of my hand, that the LORD should deliver Jerusalem out of my hand?'

21.hebrew: וַיַּחֲרִישׁוּ, וְלֹא-עָנוּ אֹתוֹ דָּבָר:  כִּי-מִצְוַת הַמֶּלֶךְ הִיא לֵאמֹר, לֹא תַעֲנֻהוּ.
21.english: But they held their peace, and answered him not a word; for the king's commandment was, saying: 'Answer him not.'

22.hebrew: וַיָּבֹא אֶלְיָקִים בֶּן-חִלְקִיָּהוּ אֲשֶׁר-עַל-הַבַּיִת וְשֶׁבְנָא הַסֹּפֵר וְיוֹאָח בֶּן-אָסָף הַמַּזְכִּיר, אֶל-חִזְקִיָּהוּ--קְרוּעֵי בְגָדִים; וַיַּגִּידוּ לוֹ, אֵת דִּבְרֵי רַבְשָׁקֵה.  {ס}
22.english: Then came Eliakim the son of Hilkiah, that was over the household, and Shebna the scribe, and Joah the son of Asaph the recorder, to Hezekiah with their clothes rent, and told him the words of Rab-shakeh. {S}

1.hebrew: וַיְהִי, כִּשְׁמֹעַ הַמֶּלֶךְ חִזְקִיָּהוּ, וַיִּקְרַע, אֶת-בְּגָדָיו; וַיִּתְכַּס בַּשָּׂק, וַיָּבֹא בֵּית יְהוָה.
1.english: And it came to pass, when king Hezekiah heard it, that he rent his clothes, and covered himself with sackcloth, and went into the house of the LORD.

2.hebrew: וַיִּשְׁלַח אֶת-אֶלְיָקִים אֲשֶׁר-עַל-הַבַּיִת וְאֵת שֶׁבְנָא הַסּוֹפֵר, וְאֵת זִקְנֵי הַכֹּהֲנִים, מִתְכַּסִּים, בַּשַּׂקִּים--אֶל-יְשַׁעְיָהוּ בֶן-אָמוֹץ, הַנָּבִיא.
2.english: And he sent Eliakim, who was over the household, and Shebna the scribe, and the elders of the priests, covered with sackcloth, unto Isaiah the prophet the son of Amoz.

3.hebrew: וַיֹּאמְרוּ אֵלָיו, כֹּה אָמַר חִזְקִיָּהוּ, יוֹם-צָרָה וְתוֹכֵחָה וּנְאָצָה, הַיּוֹם הַזֶּה:  כִּי בָאוּ בָנִים עַד-מַשְׁבֵּר, וְכֹחַ אַיִן לְלֵדָה.
3.english: And they said unto him: 'Thus saith Hezekiah: This day is a day of trouble, and of rebuke, and of contumely; for the children are come to the birth, and there is not strength to bring forth.

4.hebrew: אוּלַי יִשְׁמַע יְהוָה אֱלֹהֶיךָ אֵת דִּבְרֵי רַבְשָׁקֵה, אֲשֶׁר שְׁלָחוֹ מֶלֶךְ-אַשּׁוּר אֲדֹנָיו לְחָרֵף אֱלֹהִים חַי, וְהוֹכִיחַ בַּדְּבָרִים, אֲשֶׁר שָׁמַע יְהוָה אֱלֹהֶיךָ; וְנָשָׂאתָ תְפִלָּה, בְּעַד הַשְּׁאֵרִית הַנִּמְצָאָה.
4.english: It may be the LORD thy God will hear the words of Rab-shakeh, whom the king of Assyria his master hath sent to taunt the living God, and will rebuke the words which the LORD thy God hath heard; wherefore make prayer for the remnant that is left.'

5.hebrew: וַיָּבֹאוּ, עַבְדֵי הַמֶּלֶךְ חִזְקִיָּהוּ--אֶל-יְשַׁעְיָהוּ.
5.english: So the servants of king Hezekiah came to Isaiah.

6.hebrew: וַיֹּאמֶר אֲלֵיהֶם יְשַׁעְיָהוּ, כֹּה תֹאמְרוּן אֶל-אֲדֹנֵיכֶם:  כֹּה אָמַר יְהוָה, אַל-תִּירָא מִפְּנֵי הַדְּבָרִים אֲשֶׁר שָׁמַעְתָּ, אֲשֶׁר גִּדְּפוּ נַעֲרֵי מֶלֶךְ-אַשּׁוּר, אוֹתִי.
6.english: And Isaiah said unto them: 'Thus shall ye say to your master: Thus saith the LORD: Be not afraid of the words that thou hast heard, wherewith the servants of the king of Assyria have blasphemed Me.

7.hebrew: הִנְנִי נוֹתֵן בּוֹ רוּחַ, וְשָׁמַע שְׁמוּעָה וְשָׁב אֶל-אַרְצוֹ; וְהִפַּלְתִּיו בַּחֶרֶב, בְּאַרְצוֹ.
7.english: Behold, I will put a spirit in him, and he shall hear a rumour, and shall return unto his own land; and I will cause him to fall by the sword in his own land.'

8.hebrew: וַיָּשָׁב, רַבְשָׁקֵה, וַיִּמְצָא אֶת-מֶלֶךְ אַשּׁוּר, נִלְחָם עַל-לִבְנָה:  כִּי שָׁמַע, כִּי נָסַע מִלָּכִישׁ.
8.english: So Rab-shakeh returned, and found the king of Assyria warring against Libnah; for he had heard that he was departed from Lachish.

9.hebrew: וַיִּשְׁמַע, עַל-תִּרְהָקָה מֶלֶךְ-כּוּשׁ לֵאמֹר, יָצָא, לְהִלָּחֵם אִתָּךְ; וַיִּשְׁמַע וַיִּשְׁלַח מַלְאָכִים, אֶל-חִזְקִיָּהוּ לֵאמֹר.
9.english: And he heard say concerning Tirhakah king of Ethiopia: 'He is come out to fight against thee.' And when he heard it, he sent messengers to Hezekiah, saying:

10.hebrew: כֹּה תֹאמְרוּן, אֶל-חִזְקִיָּהוּ מֶלֶךְ-יְהוּדָה לֵאמֹר, אַל-יַשִּׁאֲךָ אֱלֹהֶיךָ, אֲשֶׁר אַתָּה בּוֹטֵחַ בּוֹ לֵאמֹר:  לֹא תִנָּתֵן יְרוּשָׁלִַם, בְּיַד מֶלֶךְ אַשּׁוּר.
10.english: 'Thus shall ye speak to Hezekiah king of Judah, saying: Let not thy God in whom thou trustest beguile thee, saying: Jerusalem shall not be given into the hand of the king of Assyria.

11.hebrew: הִנֵּה אַתָּה שָׁמַעְתָּ, אֲשֶׁר עָשׂוּ מַלְכֵי אַשּׁוּר לְכָל-הָאֲרָצוֹת--לְהַחֲרִימָם; וְאַתָּה, תִּנָּצֵל.
11.english: Behold, thou hast heard what the kings of Assyria have done to all lands, by destroying them utterly; and shalt thou be delivered?

12.hebrew: הַהִצִּילוּ אוֹתָם אֱלֹהֵי הַגּוֹיִם, אֲשֶׁר הִשְׁחִיתוּ אֲבוֹתַי, אֶת-גּוֹזָן, וְאֶת-חָרָן; וְרֶצֶף וּבְנֵי-עֶדֶן, אֲשֶׁר בִּתְלַשָּׂר.
12.english: Have the gods of the nations delivered them, which my fathers have destroyed, Gozan, and Haran, and Rezeph, and the children of Eden that were in Telassar?

13.hebrew: אַיֵּה מֶלֶךְ-חֲמָת וּמֶלֶךְ אַרְפָּד, וּמֶלֶךְ לָעִיר סְפַרְוָיִם, הֵנַע, וְעִוָּה.
13.english: Where is the king of Hamath, and the king of Arpad, and the king of the city of Sepharvaim, of Hena, and Ivvah?'

14.hebrew: וַיִּקַּח חִזְקִיָּהוּ אֶת-הַסְּפָרִים מִיַּד הַמַּלְאָכִים, וַיִּקְרָאֵהוּ; וַיַּעַל בֵּית יְהוָה, וַיִּפְרְשֵׂהוּ חִזְקִיָּהוּ לִפְנֵי יְהוָה.  {ס}
14.english: And Hezekiah received the letter from the hand of the messengers, and read it; and Hezekiah went up unto the house of the LORD, and spread it before the LORD. {S}

15.hebrew: וַיִּתְפַּלֵּל, חִזְקִיָּהוּ, אֶל-יְהוָה, לֵאמֹר.
15.english: And Hezekiah prayed unto the LORD, saying:

16.hebrew: יְהוָה צְבָאוֹת אֱלֹהֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל, יֹשֵׁב הַכְּרֻבִים, אַתָּה-הוּא הָאֱלֹהִים לְבַדְּךָ, לְכֹל מַמְלְכוֹת הָאָרֶץ; אַתָּה עָשִׂיתָ, אֶת-הַשָּׁמַיִם וְאֶת-הָאָרֶץ.
16.english: 'O LORD of hosts, the God of Israel, that sittest upon the cherubim, Thou art the God, even Thou alone, of all the kingdoms of the earth; Thou hast made heaven and earth.

17.hebrew: הַטֵּה יְהוָה אָזְנְךָ וּשְׁמָע, פְּקַח יְהוָה עֵינֶךָ וּרְאֵה; וּשְׁמַע, אֵת כָּל-דִּבְרֵי סַנְחֵרִיב, אֲשֶׁר שָׁלַח, לְחָרֵף אֱלֹהִים חָי.
17.english: Incline Thine ear, O LORD, and hear; open Thine eyes, O LORD, and see; and hear all the words of Sennacherib, who hath sent to taunt the living God.

18.hebrew: אָמְנָם, יְהוָה:  הֶחֱרִיבוּ מַלְכֵי אַשּׁוּר, אֶת-כָּל-הָאֲרָצוֹת--וְאֶת-אַרְצָם.
18.english: Of a truth, LORD, the kings of Assyria have laid waste all the countries, and their land,

19.hebrew: וְנָתֹן אֶת-אֱלֹהֵיהֶם, בָּאֵשׁ:  כִּי לֹא אֱלֹהִים הֵמָּה, כִּי אִם-מַעֲשֵׂה יְדֵי-אָדָם עֵץ וָאֶבֶן--וַיְאַבְּדוּם.
19.english: and have cast their gods into the fire; for they were no gods, but the work of men's hands, wood and stone; therefore they have destroyed them.

20.hebrew: וְעַתָּה יְהוָה אֱלֹהֵינוּ, הוֹשִׁיעֵנוּ מִיָּדוֹ; וְיֵדְעוּ כָּל-מַמְלְכוֹת הָאָרֶץ, כִּי-אַתָּה יְהוָה לְבַדֶּךָ.
20.english: Now therefore, O LORD our God, save us from his hand, that all the kingdoms of the earth may know that Thou art the LORD, even Thou only.'

21.hebrew: וַיִּשְׁלַח יְשַׁעְיָהוּ בֶן-אָמוֹץ, אֶל-חִזְקִיָּהוּ לֵאמֹר:  כֹּה-אָמַר יְהוָה, אֱלֹהֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל, אֲשֶׁר הִתְפַּלַּלְתָּ אֵלַי, אֶל-סַנְחֵרִיב מֶלֶךְ אַשּׁוּר.
21.english: Then Isaiah the son of Amoz sent unto Hezekiah, saying: 'Thus saith the LORD, the God of Israel: Whereas thou hast prayed to Me against Sennacherib king of Assyria,

22.hebrew: זֶה הַדָּבָר, אֲשֶׁר-דִּבֶּר יְהוָה עָלָיו:  בָּזָה לְךָ לָעֲגָה לְךָ, בְּתוּלַת בַּת-צִיּוֹן--אַחֲרֶיךָ רֹאשׁ הֵנִיעָה, בַּת יְרוּשָׁלִָם.
22.english: this is the word which the LORD hath spoken concerning him: The virgin daughter of Zion hath despised thee and laughed thee to scorn; the daughter of Jerusalem hath shaken her head at thee.

23.hebrew: אֶת-מִי חֵרַפְתָּ וְגִדַּפְתָּ, וְעַל-מִי הֲרִימוֹתָה קּוֹל; וַתִּשָּׂא מָרוֹם עֵינֶיךָ, אֶל-קְדוֹשׁ יִשְׂרָאֵל.
23.english: Whom hast thou taunted and blasphemed? And against whom hast thou exalted thy voice? Yea, thou hast lifted up thine eyes on high, even against the Holy One of Israel!

24.hebrew: בְּיַד עֲבָדֶיךָ, חֵרַפְתָּ אֲדֹנָי, וַתֹּאמֶר בְּרֹב רִכְבִּי אֲנִי עָלִיתִי מְרוֹם הָרִים, יַרְכְּתֵי לְבָנוֹן; וְאֶכְרֹת קוֹמַת אֲרָזָיו, מִבְחַר בְּרֹשָׁיו, וְאָבוֹא מְרוֹם קִצּוֹ, יַעַר כַּרְמִלּוֹ.
24.english: By thy servants hast thou taunted the Lord, and hast said: With the multitude of my chariots am I come up to the height of the mountains, to the innermost parts of Lebanon; and I have cut down the tall cedars thereof, and the choice cypress-trees thereof; and I have entered into his farthest height, the forest of his fruitful field.

25.hebrew: אֲנִי קַרְתִּי, וְשָׁתִיתִי מָיִם; וְאַחְרִב, בְּכַף-פְּעָמַי, כֹּל, יְאֹרֵי מָצוֹר.
25.english: I have digged and drunk water, and with the sole of my feet have I dried up all the rivers of Egypt.

26.hebrew: הֲלוֹא-שָׁמַעְתָּ לְמֵרָחוֹק אוֹתָהּ עָשִׂיתִי, מִימֵי קֶדֶם וִיצַרְתִּיהָ; עַתָּה הֲבֵאתִיהָ--וּתְהִי לְהַשְׁאוֹת גַּלִּים נִצִּים, עָרִים בְּצֻרוֹת.
26.english: Hast thou not heard? Long ago I made it, in ancient times I fashioned it; now have I brought it to pass, yea, it is done; that fortified cities should be laid waste into ruinous heaps.

27.hebrew: וְיֹשְׁבֵיהֶן, קִצְרֵי-יָד, חַתּוּ, וָבֹשׁוּ; הָיוּ עֵשֶׂב שָׂדֶה, וִירַק דֶּשֶׁא, חֲצִיר גַּגּוֹת, וּשְׁדֵמָה לִפְנֵי קָמָה.
27.english: Therefore their inhabitants were of small power, they were dismayed and confounded; they were as the grass of the field, and as the green herb, as the grass on the housetops, and as a field of corn before it is grown up.

28.hebrew: וְשִׁבְתְּךָ וְצֵאתְךָ וּבוֹאֲךָ, יָדָעְתִּי; וְאֵת, הִתְרַגֶּזְךָ אֵלָי.
28.english: But I know thy sitting down, and thy going out, and thy coming in, and thy raging against Me.

29.hebrew: יַעַן הִתְרַגֶּזְךָ אֵלַי, וְשַׁאֲנַנְךָ עָלָה בְאָזְנָי--וְשַׂמְתִּי חַחִי בְּאַפֶּךָ, וּמִתְגִּי בִּשְׂפָתֶיךָ, וַהֲשִׁיבֹתִיךָ, בַּדֶּרֶךְ אֲשֶׁר-בָּאתָ בָּהּ.
29.english: Because of thy raging against Me, and for that thine uproar is come up into Mine ears, therefore will I put My hook in thy nose, and My bridle in thy lips, and I will turn thee back by the way by which thou camest.

30.hebrew: וְזֶה-לְּךָ הָאוֹת--אָכוֹל הַשָּׁנָה סָפִיחַ, וּבַשָּׁנָה הַשֵּׁנִית שָׁחִיס; וּבַשָּׁנָה הַשְּׁלִישִׁית, זִרְעוּ וְקִצְרוּ וְנִטְעוּ כְרָמִים--ואכול (וְאִכְלוּ) פִרְיָם.
30.english: And this shall be the sign unto thee: ye shall eat this year that which groweth of itself, and in the second year that which springeth of the same; and in the third year sow ye, and reap, and plant vineyards, and eat the fruit thereof.

31.hebrew: וְיָסְפָה פְּלֵיטַת בֵּית-יְהוּדָה, הַנִּשְׁאָרָה--שֹׁרֶשׁ לְמָטָּה; וְעָשָׂה פְרִי, לְמָעְלָה.
31.english: And the remnant that is escaped of the house of Judah shall again take root downward, and bear fruit upward.

32.hebrew: כִּי מִירוּשָׁלִַם תֵּצֵא שְׁאֵרִית, וּפְלֵיטָה מֵהַר צִיּוֹן; קִנְאַת יְהוָה צְבָאוֹת, תַּעֲשֶׂה-זֹּאת.  {ס}
32.english: For out of Jerusalem shall go forth a remnant, and out of mount Zion they that shall escape; the zeal of the LORD of hosts shall perform this. {S}

33.hebrew: לָכֵן, כֹּה-אָמַר יְהוָה אֶל-מֶלֶךְ אַשּׁוּר, לֹא יָבוֹא אֶל-הָעִיר הַזֹּאת, וְלֹא-יוֹרֶה שָׁם חֵץ; וְלֹא-יְקַדְּמֶנָּה מָגֵן, וְלֹא-יִשְׁפֹּךְ עָלֶיהָ סֹלְלָה.
33.english: Therefore thus saith the LORD concerning the king of Assyria: He shall not come unto this city, nor shoot an arrow there, neither shall he come before it with shield, nor cast a mound against it.

34.hebrew: בַּדֶּרֶךְ אֲשֶׁר-בָּא, בָּהּ יָשׁוּב; וְאֶל-הָעִיר הַזֹּאת לֹא יָבוֹא, נְאֻם-יְהוָה.
34.english: By the way that he came, by the same shall he return, and he shall not come unto this city, saith the LORD.

35.hebrew: וְגַנּוֹתִי עַל-הָעִיר הַזֹּאת, לְהוֹשִׁיעָהּ--לְמַעֲנִי, וּלְמַעַן דָּוִד עַבְדִּי.  {ס}
35.english: For I will defend this city to save it, for Mine own sake, and for My servant David's sake.' {S}

36.hebrew: וַיֵּצֵא מַלְאַךְ יְהוָה, וַיַּכֶּה בְּמַחֲנֵה אַשּׁוּר, מֵאָה וּשְׁמֹנִים וַחֲמִשָּׁה, אָלֶף; וַיַּשְׁכִּימוּ בַבֹּקֶר, וְהִנֵּה כֻלָּם פְּגָרִים מֵתִים.
36.english: And the angel of the LORD went forth, and smote in the camp of the Assyrians a hundred and fourscore and five thousand; and when men arose early in the morning, behold, they were all dead corpses.

37.hebrew: וַיִּסַּע וַיֵּלֶךְ, וַיָּשָׁב סַנְחֵרִיב מֶלֶךְ-אַשּׁוּר; וַיֵּשֶׁב, בְּנִינְוֵה.
37.english: So Sennacherib king of Assyria departed, and went, and returned, and dwelt at Nineveh.

38.hebrew: וַיְהִי הוּא מִשְׁתַּחֲוֶה בֵּית נִסְרֹךְ אֱלֹהָיו, וְאַדְרַמֶּלֶךְ וְשַׂרְאֶצֶר בָּנָיו הִכֻּהוּ בַחֶרֶב, וְהֵמָּה נִמְלְטוּ, אֶרֶץ אֲרָרָט; וַיִּמְלֹךְ אֵסַר-חַדֹּן בְּנוֹ, תַּחְתָּיו.  {ס}
38.english: And it came to pass, as he was worshipping in the house of Nisroch his god, that Adrammelech and Sarezer his sons smote him with the sword; and they escaped into the land of Ararat. And Esarhaddon his son reigned in his stead. {S}

1.hebrew: בַּיָּמִים הָהֵם, חָלָה חִזְקִיָּהוּ לָמוּת; וַיָּבוֹא אֵלָיו יְשַׁעְיָהוּ בֶן-אָמוֹץ הַנָּבִיא, וַיֹּאמֶר אֵלָיו כֹּה-אָמַר יְהוָה צַו לְבֵיתֶךָ--כִּי מֵת אַתָּה, וְלֹא תִחְיֶה.
1.english: In those days was Hezekiah sick unto death. And Isaiah the prophet the son of Amoz came to him, and said unto him: 'Thus saith the LORD: Set thy house in order; for thou shalt die, and not live.'

2.hebrew: וַיַּסֵּב חִזְקִיָּהוּ פָּנָיו, אֶל-הַקִּיר; וַיִּתְפַּלֵּל, אֶל-יְהוָה.
2.english: Then Hezekiah turned his face to the wall, and prayed unto the LORD,

3.hebrew: וַיֹּאמַר, אָנָּה יְהוָה זְכָר-נָא אֵת אֲשֶׁר הִתְהַלַּכְתִּי לְפָנֶיךָ בֶּאֱמֶת וּבְלֵב שָׁלֵם, וְהַטּוֹב בְּעֵינֶיךָ, עָשִׂיתִי; וַיֵּבְךְּ חִזְקִיָּהוּ, בְּכִי גָדוֹל.  {ס}
3.english: and said: 'Remember now, O LORD, I beseech Thee, how I have walked before Thee in truth and with a whole heart, and have done that which is good in Thy sight.' And Hezekiah wept sore. {S}

4.hebrew: וַיְהִי, דְּבַר-יְהוָה, אֶל-יְשַׁעְיָהוּ, לֵאמֹר.
4.english: Then came the word of the LORD to Isaiah, saying:

5.hebrew: הָלוֹךְ וְאָמַרְתָּ אֶל-חִזְקִיָּהוּ, כֹּה-אָמַר יְהוָה אֱלֹהֵי דָּוִד אָבִיךָ, שָׁמַעְתִּי אֶת-תְּפִלָּתֶךָ, רָאִיתִי אֶת-דִּמְעָתֶךָ; הִנְנִי יוֹסִף עַל-יָמֶיךָ, חֲמֵשׁ עֶשְׂרֵה שָׁנָה.
5.english: 'Go, and say to Hezekiah: Thus saith the LORD, the God of David thy father: I have heard thy prayer, I have seen thy tears; behold, I will add unto thy days fifteen years.

6.hebrew: וּמִכַּף מֶלֶךְ-אַשּׁוּר אַצִּילְךָ, וְאֵת הָעִיר הַזֹּאת; וְגַנּוֹתִי, עַל-הָעִיר הַזֹּאת.
6.english: And I will deliver thee and this city out of the hand of the king of Assyria; and I will defend this city.

7.hebrew: וְזֶה-לְּךָ הָאוֹת, מֵאֵת יְהוָה, אֲשֶׁר יַעֲשֶׂה יְהוָה, אֶת-הַדָּבָר הַזֶּה אֲשֶׁר דִּבֵּר.
7.english: And this shall be the sign unto thee from the LORD, that the LORD will do this thing that He hath spoken:

8.hebrew: הִנְנִי מֵשִׁיב אֶת-צֵל הַמַּעֲלוֹת אֲשֶׁר יָרְדָה בְמַעֲלוֹת אָחָז בַּשֶּׁמֶשׁ, אֲחֹרַנִּית--עֶשֶׂר מַעֲלוֹת; וַתָּשָׁב הַשֶּׁמֶשׁ עֶשֶׂר מַעֲלוֹת, בַּמַּעֲלוֹת אֲשֶׁר יָרָדָה.  {ס}
8.english: behold, I will cause the shadow of the dial, which is gone down on the sun-dial of Ahaz, to return backward ten degrees.' So the sun returned ten degrees, by which degrees it was gone down. {S}

9.hebrew: מִכְתָּב, לְחִזְקִיָּהוּ מֶלֶךְ-יְהוּדָה, בַּחֲלֹתוֹ, וַיְחִי מֵחָלְיוֹ.
9.english: The writing of Hezekiah king of Judah, when he had been sick, and was recovered of his sickness.

10.hebrew: אֲנִי אָמַרְתִּי, בִּדְמִי יָמַי אֵלֵכָה--בְּשַׁעֲרֵי שְׁאוֹל; פֻּקַּדְתִּי, יֶתֶר שְׁנוֹתָי.
10.english: I said: In the noontide of my days I shall go, even to the gates of the nether-world; I am deprived of the residue of my years.

11.hebrew: אָמַרְתִּי לֹא-אֶרְאֶה יָהּ, יָהּ בְּאֶרֶץ הַחַיִּים; לֹא-אַבִּיט אָדָם עוֹד, עִם-יוֹשְׁבֵי חָדֶל.
11.english: I said: I shall not see the LORD, even the LORD in the land of the living; I shall behold man no more with the inhabitants of the world.

12.hebrew: דּוֹרִי, נִסַּע וְנִגְלָה מִנִּי--כְּאֹהֶל רֹעִי; קִפַּדְתִּי כָאֹרֵג חַיַּי מִדַּלָּה יְבַצְּעֵנִי, מִיּוֹם עַד-לַיְלָה תַּשְׁלִימֵנִי.
12.english: My habitation is plucked up and carried away from me as a shepherd's tent; I have rolled up like a weaver my life; He will cut me off from the thrum; from day even to night wilt Thou make an end of me.

13.hebrew: שִׁוִּיתִי עַד-בֹּקֶר כָּאֲרִי, כֵּן יְשַׁבֵּר כָּל-עַצְמוֹתָי; מִיּוֹם עַד-לַיְלָה, תַּשְׁלִימֵנִי.
13.english: The more I make myself like unto a lion until morning, the more it breaketh all my bones; from day even to night wilt Thou make an end of me.

14.hebrew: כְּסוּס עָגוּר כֵּן אֲצַפְצֵף, אֶהְגֶּה כַּיּוֹנָה; דַּלּוּ עֵינַי לַמָּרוֹם, אֲדֹנָי עָשְׁקָה-לִּי עָרְבֵנִי.
14.english: Like a swallow or a crane, so do I chatter, I do moan as a dove; mine eyes fail with looking upward. O LORD, I am oppressed, be Thou my surety.

15.hebrew: מָה-אֲדַבֵּר וְאָמַר-לִי, וְהוּא עָשָׂה; אֶדַּדֶּה כָל-שְׁנוֹתַי, עַל-מַר נַפְשִׁי.
15.english: What shall I say? He hath both spoken unto me, and Himself hath done it; I shall go softly all my years for the bitterness of my soul.

16.hebrew: אֲדֹנָי, עֲלֵיהֶם יִחְיוּ; וּלְכָל-בָּהֶן חַיֵּי רוּחִי, וְתַחֲלִימֵנִי וְהַחֲיֵנִי.
16.english: O Lord, by these things men live, and altogether therein is the life of my spirit; wherefore recover Thou me, and make me to live.

17.hebrew: הִנֵּה לְשָׁלוֹם, מַר-לִי מָר; וְאַתָּה חָשַׁקְתָּ נַפְשִׁי, מִשַּׁחַת בְּלִי, כִּי הִשְׁלַכְתָּ אַחֲרֵי גֵוְךָ, כָּל-חֲטָאָי.
17.english: Behold, for my peace I had great bitterness; but Thou hast in love to my soul delivered it from the pit of corruption; for Thou hast cast all my sins behind Thy back.

18.hebrew: כִּי לֹא שְׁאוֹל תּוֹדֶךָּ, מָוֶת יְהַלְלֶךָּ; לֹא-יְשַׂבְּרוּ יוֹרְדֵי-בוֹר, אֶל-אֲמִתֶּךָ.
18.english: For the nether-world cannot praise Thee, death cannot celebrate Thee; they that go down into the pit cannot hope for Thy truth.

19.hebrew: חַי חַי הוּא יוֹדֶךָ, כָּמוֹנִי הַיּוֹם; אָב לְבָנִים, יוֹדִיעַ אֶל-אֲמִתֶּךָ.
19.english: The living, the living, he shall praise Thee, as I do this day; the father to the children shall make known Thy truth.

20.hebrew: יְהוָה, לְהוֹשִׁיעֵנִי; וּנְגִנוֹתַי נְנַגֵּן כָּל-יְמֵי חַיֵּינוּ, עַל-בֵּית יְהוָה.
20.english: The LORD is ready to save me; therefore we will sing songs to the stringed instruments all the days of our life in the house of the LORD.

21.hebrew: וַיֹּאמֶר יְשַׁעְיָהוּ, יִשְׂאוּ דְּבֶלֶת תְּאֵנִים; וְיִמְרְחוּ עַל-הַשְּׁחִין, וְיֶחִי.
21.english: And Isaiah said: 'Let them take a cake of figs, and lay it for a plaster upon the boil, and he shall recover.'

22.hebrew: וַיֹּאמֶר חִזְקִיָּהוּ, מָה אוֹת:  כִּי אֶעֱלֶה, בֵּית יְהוָה.  {ס}
22.english: And Hezekiah said. 'What is the sign that I shall go up to the house of the LORD?' {S}

1.hebrew: בָּעֵת הַהִיא שָׁלַח מְרֹדַךְ בַּלְאֲדָן בֶּן-בַּלְאֲדָן מֶלֶךְ-בָּבֶל, סְפָרִים וּמִנְחָה--אֶל-חִזְקִיָּהוּ; וַיִּשְׁמַע, כִּי חָלָה וַיֶּחֱזָק.
1.english: At that time Merodach-baladan the son of Baladan, king of Babylon, sent a letter and a present to Hezekiah; for he heard that he had been sick, and was recovered.

2.hebrew: וַיִּשְׂמַח עֲלֵיהֶם, חִזְקִיָּהוּ, וַיַּרְאֵם אֶת-בֵּית נְכֹתֹה אֶת-הַכֶּסֶף וְאֶת-הַזָּהָב וְאֶת-הַבְּשָׂמִים וְאֵת הַשֶּׁמֶן הַטּוֹב וְאֵת כָּל-בֵּית כֵּלָיו, וְאֵת כָּל-אֲשֶׁר נִמְצָא בְּאֹצְרֹתָיו:  לֹא-הָיָה דָבָר, אֲשֶׁר לֹא-הֶרְאָם חִזְקִיָּהוּ בְּבֵיתוֹ--וּבְכָל-מֶמְשַׁלְתּוֹ.  {ס}
2.english: And Hezekiah was glad of them, and showed them his treasure-house, the silver, and the gold, and the spices, and the precious oil, and all the house of his armour, and all that was found in his treasures; there was nothing in his house, nor in all his dominion, that Hezekiah showed them not. {S}

3.hebrew: וַיָּבֹא יְשַׁעְיָהוּ הַנָּבִיא, אֶל-הַמֶּלֶךְ חִזְקִיָּהוּ; וַיֹּאמֶר אֵלָיו מָה אָמְרוּ הָאֲנָשִׁים הָאֵלֶּה, וּמֵאַיִן יָבֹאוּ אֵלֶיךָ, וַיֹּאמֶר חִזְקִיָּהוּ, מֵאֶרֶץ רְחוֹקָה בָּאוּ אֵלַי מִבָּבֶל.
3.english: Then came Isaiah the prophet unto king Hezekiah, and said unto him: 'What said these men? and from whence came they unto thee?' And Hezekiah said: 'They are come from a far country unto me, even from Babylon.'

4.hebrew: וַיֹּאמֶר, מָה רָאוּ בְּבֵיתֶךָ; וַיֹּאמֶר חִזְקִיָּהוּ, אֵת כָּל-אֲשֶׁר בְּבֵיתִי רָאוּ--לֹא-הָיָה דָבָר אֲשֶׁר לֹא-הִרְאִיתִים, בְּאוֹצְרֹתָי.
4.english: Then said he: 'What have they seen in thy house?' And Hezekiah answered: 'All that is in my house have they seen; there is nothing among my treasures that I have not shown them.'

5.hebrew: וַיֹּאמֶר יְשַׁעְיָהוּ, אֶל-חִזְקִיָּהוּ:  שְׁמַע, דְּבַר-יְהוָה צְבָאוֹת.
5.english: Then said Isaiah to Hezekiah: 'Hear the word of the LORD of hosts:

6.hebrew: הִנֵּה, יָמִים בָּאִים, וְנִשָּׂא כָּל-אֲשֶׁר בְּבֵיתֶךָ וַאֲשֶׁר אָצְרוּ אֲבֹתֶיךָ עַד-הַיּוֹם הַזֶּה, בָּבֶל:  לֹא-יִוָּתֵר דָּבָר, אָמַר יְהוָה.
6.english: Behold, the days come, that all that is in thy house, and that which thy fathers have laid up in store until this day, shall be carried to Babylon; nothing shall be left, saith the LORD.

7.hebrew: וּמִבָּנֶיךָ אֲשֶׁר יֵצְאוּ מִמְּךָ, אֲשֶׁר תּוֹלִיד--יִקָּחוּ; וְהָיוּ, סָרִיסִים, בְּהֵיכַל, מֶלֶךְ בָּבֶל.
7.english: And of thy sons that shall issue from thee, whom thou shalt beget, shall they take away; and they shall be officers in the palace of the king of Babylon.'

8.hebrew: וַיֹּאמֶר חִזְקִיָּהוּ אֶל-יְשַׁעְיָהוּ, טוֹב דְּבַר-יְהוָה אֲשֶׁר דִּבַּרְתָּ; וַיֹּאמֶר, כִּי יִהְיֶה שָׁלוֹם וֶאֱמֶת בְּיָמָי.  {פ}
8.english: Then said Hezekiah unto Isaiah: 'Good is the word of the LORD which thou hast spoken.' He said moreover: 'If but there shall be peace and truth in my days.' {P}

1.hebrew: ††р«з¬оећ р«з¬оећ, т«оћƒй--й…ао«ш, аЅм…д≈йл∆н.
1.english: Comfort ye, comfort ye My people, saith your God.

2.english: Bid Jerusalem take heart, and proclaim unto her, that her time of service is accomplished, that her guilt is paid off; that she hath received of the LORD'S hand double for all her sins. {S}

3.english: Hark! one calleth: 'Clear ye in the wilderness the way of the LORD, make plain in the desert a highway for our God.

4.hebrew: ††лћ»м-вћ∆йа, йƒрћ»щ“≈а, ејл»м-д«ш ејвƒбјт»д, йƒщ—јфћ»мећ; ејд»й»д д∆т»ч…б мјоƒйщ—е…ш, ејд»шјл»сƒйн мјбƒчјт»д.
4.english: Every valley shall be lifted up, and every mountain and hill shall be made low; and the rugged shall be made level, and the rough places a plain;

5.hebrew: ††ејрƒвјм»д, лћјбе…г йјде»д; ејш»аећ л»м-бћ»щ“»ш й«зјгћ»е, лћƒй фћƒй йјде»д гћƒбћ≈ш.† {ф}
5.english: And the glory of the LORD shall be revealed, and all flesh shall see it together; for the mouth of the LORD hath spoken it.' {P}

6.hebrew: ††че…м а…о≈ш чјш»а, еја»о«ш о»д а∆чјш»а; лћ»м-д«бћ»щ“»ш з»цƒйш, ејл»м-з«сјгће… лћјцƒйх д«щћ“»г∆д.
6.english: Hark! one saith: 'Proclaim!' And he saith: 'What shall I proclaim?' 'All flesh is grass, and all the goodliness thereof is as the flower of the field;

7.hebrew: ††й»б≈щ— з»цƒйш р»б≈м цƒйх, лћƒй шећз« йјде»д р»щ—јб»д бће…; а»л≈п з»цƒйш, д»т»н.
7.english: The grass withereth, the flower fadeth; because the breath of the LORD bloweth upon it--surely the people is grass.

8.hebrew: ††й»б≈щ— з»цƒйш, р»б≈м цƒйх; ећгјб«ш-аЅм…д≈йрећ, й»чећн мјте…м»н.† {с}
8.english: The grass withereth, the flower fadeth; but the word of our God shall stand for ever.' {S}

9.hebrew: ††т«м д«ш-вћ»б…дћ« т¬мƒй-м»кј, ојб«щћ“∆ш∆ъ цƒйће…п, д»шƒйоƒй б«лћ…з« че…м≈кј, ојб«щћ“∆ш∆ъ йјшећщ—»м»ƒн; д»шƒйоƒй, а«м-ъћƒйш»аƒй, аƒојшƒй мјт»ш≈й йјдећг»д, дƒрћ≈д аЅм…д≈йл∆н.
9.english: O thou that tellest good tidings to Zion, get thee up into the high mountain; O thou that tellest good tidings to Jerusalem, lift up thy voice with strength; lift it up, be not afraid; say unto the cities of Judah: 'Behold your God!'

10.hebrew: ††дƒрћ≈д а¬г…р»й йјдеƒд бћјз»ж»ч й»бе…а, ећжјш…те… о…щ—јм»д ме…; дƒрћ≈д щ“јл»ше… аƒъће…, ећфјтЋмћ»ъе… мјф»р»йе.
10.english: Behold, the Lord GOD will come as a Mighty One, and His arm will rule for Him; behold, His reward is with Him, and His recompense before Him.

11.hebrew: ††лћјш…т∆д, т∆гјше… йƒшјт∆д, бћƒжјш…те… йјч«бћ≈х ијм»аƒйн, ећбјз≈йче… йƒщћ“»а; т»ме…ъ, йјр«д≈м.† {с}
11.english: Even as a shepherd that feedeth his flock, that gathereth the lambs in his arm, and carrieth them in his bosom, and gently leadeth those that give suck. {S}

12.hebrew: ††оƒй-о»г«г бћјщ—»т√ме… о«йƒн, ејщ—»о«йƒн бћ«жћ∆ш∆ъ ъћƒлћ≈п, ејл»м бћ«щћ—»мƒщ—, т¬ф«ш д»а»ш∆х; ејщ—»ч«м бћ«фћ∆м∆с д»шƒйн, ећвјб»те…ъ бћјо…ажјр»йƒн.
12.english: Who hath measured the waters in the hollow of his hand, and meted out heaven with the span, and comprehended the dust of the earth in a measure, and weighed the mountains in scales, and the hills in a balance?

13.hebrew: ††оƒй-ъƒлћ≈п а∆ъ-шећз«, йјде»д; ејаƒйщ—, т¬ц»ъе… йе…гƒйт∆рћећ.
13.english: Who hath meted out the spirit of the LORD? Or who was His counsellor that he might instruct Him?

14.hebrew: ††а∆ъ-оƒй ре…т»х е«йјбƒйр≈дећ, е«йјм«оћјг≈дећ бћја…ш«з оƒщ—јфћ»и; е«йјм«оћјг≈дећ г«т«ъ, ејг∆ш∆кј ъћјбећре…ъ йе…гƒйт∆рћећ.
14.english: With whom took He counsel, and who instructed Him, and taught Him in the path of right, and taught Him knowledge, and made Him to know the way of discernment?

15.hebrew: ††д≈п вће…йƒн лћјо«ш оƒгћјмƒй, ећлјщ—«з«ч о…ажјр«йƒн р∆зјщ—»бећ; д≈п аƒйћƒйн, лћ«гћ«ч йƒиће…м.
15.english: Behold, the nations are as a drop of a bucket, and are counted as the small dust of the balance; behold the isles are as a mote in weight.

16.hebrew: ††ећмјб»ре…п, а≈йп гћ≈й бћ»т≈ш; ејз«йћ»ъе…--а≈йп гћ≈й, те…м»д.† {ф}
16.english: And Lebanon is not sufficient fuel, nor the beasts thereof sufficient for burnt-offerings. {P}

17.hebrew: ††лћ»м-д«вће…йƒн, лћја«йƒп р∆вјгће…; о≈а∆ф∆с е»ъ…дећ, р∆зјщ—јбећ-ме….
17.english: All the nations are as nothing before Him; they are accounted by Him as things of nought, and vanity.

18.hebrew: ††еја∆м-оƒй, ъћјг«оћјйећп а≈м; ећо«д-гћјоећъ, ъћ«т«шјлећ ме….
18.english: To whom then will ye liken God? Or what likeness will ye compare unto Him?

19.hebrew: ††д«фћ∆с∆м р»с«кј з»ш»щ—, ејц…ш≈у бћ«жћ»д»б йјш«чћјт∆рћећ; ећшјъЋче…ъ лћ∆с∆у, це…ш≈у.
19.english: The image perchance, which the craftsman hath melted, and the goldsmith spread over with gold, the silversmith casting silver chains?

20.hebrew: ††д«ојсЋлћ»п ъћјшећо»д, т≈х м…а-йƒшјч«б йƒбјз»ш; з»ш»щ— з»л»н йјб«чћ∆щ—-ме…, мјд»лƒйп фћ∆с∆м м…а йƒоће…и.† {с}
20.english: A holm-oak is set apart, he chooseth a tree that will not rot; he seeketh unto him a cunning craftsman to set up an image, that shall not be moved. {S}

21.hebrew: ††д¬ме…а ъ≈гјтећ д¬ме…а ъƒщ—јо»тећ, д¬ме…а дЋвћ«г о≈ш…ащ— м»л∆н; д¬ме…а, д¬бƒйре…ъ∆н, ое…сјге…ъ, д»а»ш∆х.
21.english: Know ye not? hear ye not? Hath it not been told you from the beginning? Have ye not understood the foundations of the earth?

22.hebrew: ††д«йћ…щ—≈б т«м-зећв д»а»ш∆х, ејй…щ—јб∆йд» лћ«з¬в»бƒйн; д«рће…и∆д л«гћ…ч щ—»о«йƒн, е«йћƒојъћ»з≈н лћ»а…д∆м м»щ—»б∆ъ.
22.english: It is He that sitteth above the circle of the earth, and the inhabitants thereof are as grasshoppers; that stretcheth out the heavens as a curtain, and spreadeth them out as a tent to dwell in;

23.hebrew: ††д«рће…ъ≈п ше…жјрƒйн, мја»йƒп; щ—…фји≈й а∆ш∆х, лћ«ъћ…дећ т»щ“»д.
23.english: That bringeth princes to nothing; He maketh the judges of the earth as a thing of nought.

24.hebrew: ††а«у бћ«м-рƒић»тећ, а«у бћ«м-ж…ш»тећ--а«у бћ«м-щ—…ш≈щ— бћ»а»ш∆х, вћƒжјт»н; ејв«н-р»щ—«у бћ»д∆н е«йћƒб»щ—ећ, ећсјт»ш»д лћ«чћ«щ— ъћƒщћ“»а≈н.† {с}
24.english: Scarce are they planted, scarce are they sown, scarce hath their stock taken root in the earth; when He bloweth upon them, they wither, and the whirlwind taketh them away as stubble. {S}

25.english: To whom then will ye liken Me, that I should be equal? saith the Holy One.

26.hebrew: ††щ“јаећ-о»ше…н т≈йр≈йл∆н ећшјаећ оƒй-б»ш»а а≈мћ∆д, д«оће…цƒйа бјоƒсјфћ»ш цјб»а»н; мјлЋмћ»н, бћјщ—≈н йƒчјш»а, о≈ш…б ае…рƒйн еја«оћƒйх лћ…з«, аƒйщ— м…а р∆тјгћ»ш.† {с}
26.english: Lift up your eyes on high, and see: who hath created these? He that bringeth out their host by number, He calleth them all by name; by the greatness of His might, and for that He is strong in power, not one faileth. {S}

27.hebrew: ††м»оћ»д ъ…ао«ш й«т¬ч…б, ећъјг«бћ≈ш йƒщ“јш»а≈м:† рƒсјъћјш»д г«шјлћƒй о≈йјде»д, ећо≈аЅм…д«й оƒщ—јфћ»иƒй й«т¬бе…ш.
27.english: Why sayest thou, O Jacob, and speakest, O Israel: 'My way is hid from the LORD, and my right is passed over from my God'?

28.hebrew: ††д¬ме…а й»г«тјъћ» аƒн-м…а щ—»о«тјъћ», аЅм…д≈й те…м»н йјде»д бће…ш≈а чјце…ъ д»а»ш∆х--м…а йƒйт«у, ејм…а йƒйв»т:† а≈йп з≈ч∆ш, мƒъјбећр»ъе….
28.english: Hast thou not known? hast thou not heard that the everlasting God, the LORD, the Creator of the ends of the earth, fainteth not, neither is weary? His discernment is past searching out.

29.hebrew: ††р…ъ≈п м«йћ»т≈у, лћ…з«; ећмја≈йп ае…рƒйн, т»цјо»д й«шјбћ∆д.
29.english: He giveth power to the faint; and to him that hath no might He increaseth strength.

30.english: Even the youths shall faint and be weary, and the young men shall utterly fall;

31.hebrew: ††ејче…й≈ йјде»д й«з¬мƒйфећ л…з«, й«т¬мећ а≈б∆ш лћ«рћјщ—»шƒйн; й»шећцећ ејм…а йƒйв»тећ, й≈мјлећ ејм…а йƒйт»фећ.† {с}
31.english: But they that wait for the LORD shall renew their strength; they shall mount up with wings as eagles; they shall run, and not be weary; they shall walk, and not faint. {S}

1.hebrew: הַחֲרִישׁוּ אֵלַי אִיִּים, וּלְאֻמִּים יַחֲלִיפוּ כֹחַ; יִגְּשׁוּ אָז יְדַבֵּרוּ, יַחְדָּו לַמִּשְׁפָּט נִקְרָבָה.
1.english: Keep silence before Me, O islands, and let the peoples renew their strength; let them draw near, then let them speak; let us come near together to judgment.

2.hebrew: מִי הֵעִיר מִמִּזְרָח, צֶדֶק יִקְרָאֵהוּ לְרַגְלוֹ; יִתֵּן לְפָנָיו גּוֹיִם, וּמְלָכִים יַרְדְּ--יִתֵּן כֶּעָפָר חַרְבּוֹ, כְּקַשׁ נִדָּף קַשְׁתּוֹ.
2.english: Who hath raised up one from the east, at whose steps victory attendeth? He giveth nations before him, and maketh him rule over kings; his sword maketh them as the dust, his bow as the driven stubble.

3.hebrew: יִרְדְּפֵם, יַעֲבוֹר שָׁלוֹם; אֹרַח בְּרַגְלָיו, לֹא יָבוֹא.
3.english: He pursueth them, and passeth on safely; the way with his feet he treadeth not.

4.hebrew: מִי-פָעַל וְעָשָׂה, קֹרֵא הַדֹּרוֹת מֵרֹאשׁ:  אֲנִי יְהוָה רִאשׁוֹן, וְאֶת-אַחֲרֹנִים אֲנִי-הוּא.
4.english: Who hath wrought and done it? He that called the generations from the beginning. I, the LORD, who am the first, and with the last am the same.

5.hebrew: רָאוּ אִיִּים וְיִרָאוּ, קְצוֹת הָאָרֶץ יֶחֱרָדוּ; קָרְבוּ, וַיֶּאֱתָיוּן.
5.english: The isles saw, and feared; the ends of the earth trembled; they drew near, and came.

6.hebrew: אִישׁ אֶת-רֵעֵהוּ, יַעְזֹרוּ; וּלְאָחִיו, יֹאמַר חֲזָק.
6.english: They helped every one his neighbour; and every one said to his brother: 'Be of good courage.'

7.hebrew: וַיְחַזֵּק חָרָשׁ אֶת-צֹרֵף, מַחֲלִיק פַּטִּישׁ אֶת-הוֹלֶם פָּעַם; אֹמֵר לַדֶּבֶק טוֹב הוּא, וַיְחַזְּקֵהוּ בְמַסְמְרִים לֹא יִמּוֹט.  {ס}
7.english: So the carpenter encouraged the goldsmith, and he that smootheth with the hammer him that smiteth the anvil, saying of the soldering: 'It is good'; and he fastened it with nails, that it should not be moved. {S}

8.hebrew: וְאַתָּה יִשְׂרָאֵל עַבְדִּי, יַעֲקֹב אֲשֶׁר בְּחַרְתִּיךָ; זֶרַע, אַבְרָהָם אֹהֲבִי.
8.english: But thou, Israel, My servant, Jacob whom I have chosen, the seed of Abraham My friend;

9.hebrew: אֲשֶׁר הֶחֱזַקְתִּיךָ מִקְצוֹת הָאָרֶץ, וּמֵאֲצִילֶיהָ קְרָאתִיךָ; וָאֹמַר לְךָ עַבְדִּי-אַתָּה, בְּחַרְתִּיךָ וְלֹא מְאַסְתִּיךָ.
9.english: Thou whom I have taken hold of from the ends of the earth, and called thee from the uttermost parts thereof, and said unto thee: 'Thou art My servant, I have chosen thee and not cast thee away';

10.hebrew: אַל-תִּירָא כִּי עִמְּךָ-אָנִי, אַל-תִּשְׁתָּע כִּי-אֲנִי אֱלֹהֶיךָ; אִמַּצְתִּיךָ, אַף-עֲזַרְתִּיךָ--אַף-תְּמַכְתִּיךָ, בִּימִין צִדְקִי.
10.english: Fear thou not, for I am with thee, be not dismayed, for I am thy God; I strengthen thee, yea, I help thee; yea, I uphold thee with My victorious right hand.

11.hebrew: הֵן יֵבֹשׁוּ וְיִכָּלְמוּ, כֹּל הַנֶּחֱרִים בָּךְ; יִהְיוּ כְאַיִן וְיֹאבְדוּ, אַנְשֵׁי רִיבֶךָ.
11.english: Behold, all they that were incensed against thee shall be ashamed and confounded; they that strove with thee shall be as nothing, and shall perish.

12.hebrew: תְּבַקְשֵׁם וְלֹא תִמְצָאֵם, אַנְשֵׁי מַצֻּתֶךָ; יִהְיוּ כְאַיִן וּכְאֶפֶס, אַנְשֵׁי מִלְחַמְתֶּךָ.
12.english: Thou shalt seek them, and shalt not find them, even them that contended with thee; they that warred against thee shall be as nothing, and as a thing of nought.

13.hebrew: כִּי, אֲנִי יְהוָה אֱלֹהֶיךָ--מַחֲזִיק יְמִינֶךָ; הָאֹמֵר לְךָ אַל-תִּירָא, אֲנִי עֲזַרְתִּיךָ.  {ס}
13.english: For I the LORD thy God hold thy right hand, who say unto thee: 'Fear not, I help thee.' {S}

14.hebrew: אַל-תִּירְאִי תּוֹלַעַת יַעֲקֹב, מְתֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל; אֲנִי עֲזַרְתִּיךְ נְאֻם-יְהוָה, וְגֹאֲלֵךְ קְדוֹשׁ יִשְׂרָאֵל.
14.english: Fear not, thou worm Jacob, and ye men of Israel; I help thee, saith the LORD, and thy Redeemer, the Holy One of Israel.

15.hebrew: הִנֵּה שַׂמְתִּיךְ, לְמוֹרַג חָרוּץ חָדָשׁ--בַּעַל, פִּיפִיּוֹת; תָּדוּשׁ הָרִים וְתָדֹק, וּגְבָעוֹת כַּמֹּץ תָּשִׂים.
15.english: Behold, I make thee a new threshing-sledge having sharp teeth; thou shalt thresh the mountains, and beat them small, and shalt make the hills as chaff.

16.hebrew: תִּזְרֵם וְרוּחַ תִּשָּׂאֵם, וּסְעָרָה תָּפִיץ אוֹתָם; וְאַתָּה תָּגִיל בַּיהוָה, בִּקְדוֹשׁ יִשְׂרָאֵל תִּתְהַלָּל.  {ס}
16.english: Thou shalt fan them, and the wind shall carry them away, and the whirlwind shall scatter them; and thou shalt rejoice in the LORD, thou shalt glory in the Holy One of Israel. {S}

17.hebrew: הָעֲנִיִּים וְהָאֶבְיוֹנִים מְבַקְשִׁים מַיִם, וָאַיִן--לְשׁוֹנָם, בַּצָּמָא נָשָׁתָּה; אֲנִי יְהוָה אֶעֱנֵם, אֱלֹהֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל לֹא אֶעֶזְבֵם.
17.english: The poor and needy seek water and there is none, and their tongue faileth for thirst; I the LORD will answer them, I the God of Israel will not forsake them.

18.hebrew: אֶפְתַּח עַל-שְׁפָיִים נְהָרוֹת, וּבְתוֹךְ בְּקָעוֹת מַעְיָנוֹת; אָשִׂים מִדְבָּר לַאֲגַם-מַיִם, וְאֶרֶץ צִיָּה לְמוֹצָאֵי מָיִם.
18.english: I will open rivers on the high hills, and fountains in the midst of the valleys; I will make the wilderness a pool of water, and the dry land springs of water.

19.hebrew: אֶתֵּן בַּמִּדְבָּר אֶרֶז שִׁטָּה, וַהֲדַס וְעֵץ שָׁמֶן; אָשִׂים בָּעֲרָבָה, בְּרוֹשׁ תִּדְהָר וּתְאַשּׁוּר--יַחְדָּו.
19.english: I will plant in the wilderness the cedar, the acacia-tree, and the myrtle, and the oil-tree; I will set in the desert the cypress, the plane-tree, and the larch together;

20.hebrew: לְמַעַן יִרְאוּ וְיֵדְעוּ, וְיָשִׂימוּ וְיַשְׂכִּילוּ יַחְדָּו--כִּי יַד-יְהוָה, עָשְׂתָה זֹּאת; וּקְדוֹשׁ יִשְׂרָאֵל, בְּרָאָהּ.  {פ}
20.english: That they may see, and know, and consider, and understand together, that the hand of the LORD hath done this, and the Holy One of Israel hath created it. {P}

21.hebrew: קָרְבוּ רִיבְכֶם, יֹאמַר יְהוָה; הַגִּישׁוּ, עֲצֻמוֹתֵיכֶם, יֹאמַר, מֶלֶךְ יַעֲקֹב.
21.english: Produce your cause, saith the LORD; bring forth your reasons, saith the King of Jacob.

22.hebrew: יַגִּישׁוּ וְיַגִּידוּ לָנוּ, אֵת אֲשֶׁר תִּקְרֶינָה; הָרִאשֹׁנוֹת מָה הֵנָּה, הַגִּידוּ וְנָשִׂימָה לִבֵּנוּ וְנֵדְעָה אַחֲרִיתָן, אוֹ הַבָּאוֹת, הַשְׁמִיעֻנוּ.
22.english: Let them bring them forth, and declare unto us the things that shall happen; the former things, what are they? Declare ye, that we may consider, and know the end of them; or announce to us things to come.

23.hebrew: הַגִּידוּ, הָאֹתִיּוֹת לְאָחוֹר, וְנֵדְעָה, כִּי אֱלֹהִים אַתֶּם; אַף-תֵּיטִיבוּ וְתָרֵעוּ, וְנִשְׁתָּעָה ונרא (וְנִרְאֶה) יַחְדָּו.
23.english: Declare the things that are to come hereafter, that we may know that ye are gods; yea, do good, or do evil, that we may be dismayed, and behold it together.

24.hebrew: הֵן-אַתֶּם מֵאַיִן, וּפָעָלְכֶם מֵאָפַע; תּוֹעֵבָה, יִבְחַר בָּכֶם.  {פ}
24.english: Behold, ye are nothing, and your work a thing of nought; an abomination is he that chooseth you. {P}

25.hebrew: הַעִירוֹתִי מִצָּפוֹן וַיַּאת, מִמִּזְרַח-שֶׁמֶשׁ יִקְרָא בִשְׁמִי; וְיָבֹא סְגָנִים כְּמוֹ-חֹמֶר, וּכְמוֹ יוֹצֵר יִרְמָס-טִיט.
25.english: I have roused up one from the north, and he is come, from the rising of the sun one that calleth upon My name; and he shall come upon rulers as upon mortar, and as the potter treadeth clay.

26.hebrew: מִי-הִגִּיד מֵרֹאשׁ וְנֵדָעָה, וּמִלְּפָנִים וְנֹאמַר צַדִּיק; אַף אֵין-מַגִּיד, אַף אֵין מַשְׁמִיעַ--אַף אֵין-שֹׁמֵעַ, אִמְרֵיכֶם.
26.english: Who hath declared from the beginning, that we may know? and beforetime, that we may say that he is right? Yea, there is none that declareth, yea, there is none that announceth, yea, there is none that heareth your utterances.

27.hebrew: רִאשׁוֹן לְצִיּוֹן, הִנֵּה הִנָּם; וְלִירוּשָׁלִַם, מְבַשֵּׂר אֶתֵּן.
27.english: A harbinger unto Zion will I give: 'Behold, behold them', and to Jerusalem a messenger of good tidings.

28.hebrew: וְאֵרֶא וְאֵין אִישׁ, וּמֵאֵלֶּה וְאֵין יוֹעֵץ; וְאֶשְׁאָלֵם, וְיָשִׁיבוּ דָבָר.
28.english: And I look, but there is no man; even among them, but there is no counsellor, that, when I ask of them, can give an answer.

29.hebrew: הֵן כֻּלָּם, אָוֶן אֶפֶס מַעֲשֵׂיהֶם; רוּחַ וָתֹהוּ, נִסְכֵּיהֶם.  {פ}
29.english: Behold, all of them, their works are vanity and nought; their molten images are wind and confusion. {P}

1.hebrew: הֵן עַבְדִּי אֶתְמָךְ-בּוֹ, בְּחִירִי רָצְתָה נַפְשִׁי; נָתַתִּי רוּחִי עָלָיו, מִשְׁפָּט לַגּוֹיִם יוֹצִיא.
1.english: Behold My servant, whom I uphold; Mine elect, in whom My soul delighteth; I have put My spirit upon him, he shall make the right to go forth to the nations.

2.hebrew: לֹא יִצְעַק, וְלֹא יִשָּׂא; וְלֹא-יַשְׁמִיעַ בַּחוּץ, קוֹלוֹ.
2.english: He shall not cry, nor lift up, nor cause his voice to be heard in the street.

3.hebrew: קָנֶה רָצוּץ לֹא יִשְׁבּוֹר, וּפִשְׁתָּה כֵהָה לֹא יְכַבֶּנָּה; לֶאֱמֶת, יוֹצִיא מִשְׁפָּט.
3.english: A bruised reed shall he not break, and the dimly burning wick shall he not quench; he shall make the right to go forth according to the truth.

4.hebrew: לֹא יִכְהֶה וְלֹא יָרוּץ, עַד-יָשִׂים בָּאָרֶץ מִשְׁפָּט; וּלְתוֹרָתוֹ, אִיִּים יְיַחֵלוּ.  {פ}
4.english: He shall not fail nor be crushed, till he have set the right in the earth; and the isles shall wait for his teaching. {P}

5.hebrew: כֹּה-אָמַר הָאֵל יְהוָה, בּוֹרֵא הַשָּׁמַיִם וְנוֹטֵיהֶם, רֹקַע הָאָרֶץ, וְצֶאֱצָאֶיהָ; נֹתֵן נְשָׁמָה לָעָם עָלֶיהָ, וְרוּחַ לַהֹלְכִים בָּהּ.
5.english: Thus saith God the LORD, He that created the heavens, and stretched them forth, He that spread forth the earth and that which cometh out of it, He that giveth breath unto the people upon it, and spirit to them that walk therein:

6.hebrew: אֲנִי יְהוָה קְרָאתִיךָ בְצֶדֶק, וְאַחְזֵק בְּיָדֶךָ; וְאֶצָּרְךָ, וְאֶתֶּנְךָ לִבְרִית עָם--לְאוֹר גּוֹיִם.
6.english: I the LORD have called thee in righteousness, and have taken hold of thy hand, and kept thee, and set thee for a covenant of the people, for a light of the nations;

7.hebrew: לִפְקֹחַ, עֵינַיִם עִוְרוֹת; לְהוֹצִיא מִמַּסְגֵּר אַסִּיר, מִבֵּית כֶּלֶא יֹשְׁבֵי חֹשֶׁךְ.
7.english: To open the blind eyes, to bring out the prisoners from the dungeon, and them that sit in darkness out of the prison-house.

8.hebrew: אֲנִי יְהוָה, הוּא שְׁמִי; וּכְבוֹדִי לְאַחֵר לֹא-אֶתֵּן, וּתְהִלָּתִי לַפְּסִילִים.
8.english: I am the LORD, that is My name; and My glory will I not give to another, neither My praise to graven images.

9.hebrew: הָרִאשֹׁנוֹת, הִנֵּה-בָאוּ; וַחֲדָשׁוֹת אֲנִי מַגִּיד, בְּטֶרֶם תִּצְמַחְנָה אַשְׁמִיעַ אֶתְכֶם.  {פ}
9.english: Behold, the former things are come to pass, and new things do I declare; before they spring forth I tell you of them. {P}

10.hebrew: שִׁירוּ לַיהוָה שִׁיר חָדָשׁ, תְּהִלָּתוֹ מִקְצֵה הָאָרֶץ; יוֹרְדֵי הַיָּם וּמְלֹאוֹ, אִיִּים וְיֹשְׁבֵיהֶם.
10.english: Sing unto the LORD a new song, and His praise from the end of the earth; ye that go down to the sea, and all that is therein, the isles, and the inhabitants thereof.

11.hebrew: יִשְׂאוּ מִדְבָּר וְעָרָיו, חֲצֵרִים תֵּשֵׁב קֵדָר; יָרֹנּוּ יֹשְׁבֵי סֶלַע, מֵרֹאשׁ הָרִים יִצְוָחוּ.
11.english: Let the wilderness and the cities thereof lift up their voice, the villages that Kedar doth inhabit; let the inhabitants of Sela exult, let them shout from the top of the mountains.

12.hebrew: יָשִׂימוּ לַיהוָה, כָּבוֹד; וּתְהִלָּתוֹ, בָּאִיִּים יַגִּידוּ.
12.english: Let them give glory unto the LORD, and declare His praise in the islands.

13.hebrew: יְהוָה כַּגִּבּוֹר יֵצֵא, כְּאִישׁ מִלְחָמוֹת יָעִיר קִנְאָה; יָרִיעַ, אַף-יַצְרִיחַ--עַל-אֹיְבָיו, יִתְגַּבָּר.  {ס}
13.english: The LORD will go forth as a mighty man, He will stir up jealousy like a man of war; He will cry, yea, He will shout aloud, He will prove Himself mighty against His enemies. {S}

14.hebrew: הֶחֱשֵׁיתִי, מֵעוֹלָם--אַחֲרִישׁ, אֶתְאַפָּק; כַּיּוֹלֵדָה אֶפְעֶה, אֶשֹּׁם וְאֶשְׁאַף יָחַד.
14.english: I have long time held My peace, I have been still, and refrained Myself; now will I cry like a travailing woman, gasping and panting at once.

15.hebrew: אַחֲרִיב הָרִים וּגְבָעוֹת, וְכָל-עֶשְׂבָּם אוֹבִישׁ; וְשַׂמְתִּי נְהָרוֹת לָאִיִּים, וַאֲגַמִּים אוֹבִישׁ.
15.english: I will make waste mountains and hills, and dry up all their herbs; and I will make the rivers islands, and will dry up the pools.

16.hebrew: וְהוֹלַכְתִּי עִוְרִים, בְּדֶרֶךְ לֹא יָדָעוּ--בִּנְתִיבוֹת לֹא-יָדְעוּ, אַדְרִיכֵם; אָשִׂים מַחְשָׁךְ לִפְנֵיהֶם לָאוֹר, וּמַעֲקַשִּׁים לְמִישׁוֹר--אֵלֶּה הַדְּבָרִים, עֲשִׂיתִם וְלֹא עֲזַבְתִּים.
16.english: And I will bring the blind by a way that they knew not, in paths that they knew not will I lead them; I will make darkness light before them, and rugged places plain. These things will I do, and I will not leave them undone.

17.hebrew: נָסֹגוּ אָחוֹר יֵבֹשׁוּ בֹשֶׁת, הַבֹּטְחִים בַּפָּסֶל; הָאֹמְרִים לְמַסֵּכָה, אַתֶּם אֱלֹהֵינוּ.  {פ}
17.english: They shall be turned back, greatly ashamed, that trust in graven images, that say unto molten images: 'Ye are our gods.' {P}

18.hebrew: הַחֵרְשִׁים, שְׁמָעוּ; וְהַעִוְרִים, הַבִּיטוּ לִרְאוֹת.
18.english: Hear, ye deaf, and look, ye blind, that ye may see.

19.hebrew: מִי עִוֵּר כִּי אִם-עַבְדִּי, וְחֵרֵשׁ כְּמַלְאָכִי אֶשְׁלָח; מִי עִוֵּר כִּמְשֻׁלָּם, וְעִוֵּר כְּעֶבֶד יְהוָה.
19.english: Who is blind, but My servant? Or deaf, as My messenger that I send? Who is blind as he that is wholehearted, and blind as the LORD'S servant?
